11003: In the absence of any special role whenever @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि] is enjoined about any expression by using the terms @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि], it is to be understood to come in the room of the @deva[इक्] (@deva[इ], @deva[उ], @deva[ऋ], @deva[लृ]) of that expression.
11004: The @deva[गुण] and @deva[वृद्धि] substitutions which otherwise would have presented themselves do not take place, when such an @deva[आर्धधातुक] @ref[3.4.114] affix follows, which causes a portion of the root to be elided.
11005: And that, which otherwise would have caused @deva[गुण] or @deva[वृद्धि], does not do so, when it has an indicatory @deva[क्] , @deva[ग्] , @deva[ङ्]।
11006: The @deva[गुण] and @deva[वृद्धि] substitutions which otherwise would have presented themselves do not however come, in the place of the vowels of @deva[दिधि] 'to shine' and @deva[वेवि] 'to go', and of the augment called @deva[इट्] ।
11007: Consonants unseparated by a vowel are called conjunct consonants.
11008: That which is pronounced by the nose along with the mouth is called @deva[अनुनासिक] or nasal.
11009: Those whose place of utterance and effort are equal are called @deva[सवर्ण] or homogeneous letters.
11010: There is however no homogeneity between vowels and consonants, though their place and effort be equal.
11011: A dual case affix ending in @deva[ई] or @deva[ऊ] or @deva[ए] is called @deva[प्रगृह्य] , or excepted vowels which do not admit @deva[सन्धि] or conjugation.
11012: The same letters after the @deva[म्] of the pronoun @deva[अदस्] are @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11013: The affix @deva[शे] (the Vedic substitute of the case-affixes) is a @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11014: A particle @ref[1.4.56] consisting of a single vowel, with the exception of the particle @deva[आङ्] is @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11015: The final @deva[ओ] of a particle is a @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11016: The final @deva[ओ] of a vocative singular @ref[2.3.49] before the word @deva[इति] according to @deva[शाकल्य] , in a secular or non-vedic literature is a @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11017: The particle @deva[ऊञ्] before @deva[इति] , according to @deva[शाकल्य] is a @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11018: The particle @deva[ऊँ] replaces @deva[उञ] in non-vedic literature and it is a @deva[प्रगृह्य] in the opinion of @deva[शाकल्य]।
11019: The final @deva[ई] and @deva[ऊ] of words giving the sense of the locative case are @deva[प्रगृह्य]।
11020: The words having the form of @deva[दा] 'to give' and @deva[धा] 'to place' are called @deva[घु]।
11021: An operation should be performed on a single letter, as upon an initial or upon a final.
11023: The words @deva[बहु] 'many' , @deva[गण] 'class' and the words ending in the affix @deva[वतु] -- @deva[यद्तदेतेभ्यः] @deva[परिमाणे] @deva[वतुप्] @ref[5.2.39] and @deva[डति] -- @deva[किमः] @deva[संख्यापरिमाणे] @deva[डति] @deva[च] @ref[5.2.41] are called numerals (@deva[संख्या]).
11024: The @deva[संख्या]-s having @deva[ष] or @deva[न] as their final are called @deva[षट्]।
11025: And the @deva[संख्या]-s ending with the affix @deva[डति] are called @deva[षट्]।
11027: The words @deva[सर्व] 'all' and the rest are called @deva[सर्वनाम] or pronouns.
11028: The above words are optionally @deva[सर्वनाम] when they occur in a @deva[बहुव्रीही] compound signifying direction -- @deva[दिङ्नामान्यन्तराले] @ref[2.2.26].
11029: The words @deva[सर्व] etc. are not @deva[सर्वनाम] when they occur in a @deva[बहुव्रीही] compound.
11030: In the Instrumental Determinative Compounds the words @deva[सर्व] etc. are not @deva[सर्वनाम]।
11031: And in Collective Compound -- @deva[दिङ्नामान्यन्तराले] @ref[2.2.26], the words @deva[सर्व] etc. are not @deva[सर्वनाम]।
11032: Their @deva[द्वन्द] compounds are optionally @deva[सर्वनाम] when the nominative plural termination @deva[जस्] follows.
11033: And also the words @deva[प्रथम] 'first', @deva[चरम] 'last', words with the affix @deva[तय] -- @deva[संख्याया] @deva[अवयवे] @deva[तयप्] @ref[5.2.42], @deva[अल्प] 'few', @deva[अर्ध] 'half', @deva[कतिपय] 'some' and @deva[नेम] 'half' are optionally @deva[सर्वनाम] , before the Nominative Plural termination.
11034: The words @deva[पूर्व] 'prior', @deva[पर] 'after', @deva[अवर] 'posterior', @deva[दक्षिण] 'south', @deva[उत्तर] 'north', @deva[अपर] 'other', @deva[अधर] 'inferior', when they discriminate relative position, not when they are appellatives, are optionally @deva[सर्वनाम] before the affix @deva[जस्]।
11035: The word @deva[स्व] 'own', when it does not mean a kinsman or property is optionally @deva[सर्वनाम] before the affix @deva[जस्]।
11036: The word @deva[अन्तर] always being a @deva[सर्वनाम] , when meaning 'outer' or 'lower garment', is optionally so before the affix @deva[जस्]।
11037: The words @deva[स्वर्] 'heaven' etc. and the particles -- @deva[निपात] @deva[एकाजनाङ्] @ref[1.4.56], are called @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinables.
11038: And the words ending in @deva[तद्धित] or secondary affixes -- @deva[तद्धिताः] @ref[4.1.76], which are not declined in all the cases are also @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinables.
11039: The words formed by those @deva[कृत्] or primary affixes -- @deva[कृदतिङ्] @ref[3.1.93], which end with a @deva[म्] or in a @deva[ए] , @deva[ओ] , @deva[ऐ] and @deva[औ] are also @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinables.
11040: The words ending in @deva[क्त्व] , @deva[तोसुन्] -- @deva[भावलक्षणे] @deva[स्थेण्कृञ्वदिचरिहुतमिजनिभ्यस्तोसुन्] @ref[3.4.16], and @deva[कसुन्] are @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinables.
11041: The compound called @deva[अव्ययीभाव] is also @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinable.
11043: The first five case affixes comprised in the @deva[प्रत्यहार] @deva[सुट्] (i.e. the three case-terminations of the Nominative, and the singular and dual of the Accusative) are also called @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] , except the case-affixes of the neuter gender.
11044: May or may not' is called @deva[विभाषा] or option.
11045: The @deva[इक्] vowels which replace the semi-vowels @deva[यण्] are called @deva[सम्प्रसारण]।
11046: Of whatsoever the augments enunciated are distinguished by an indicatory @deva[ट्] or @deva[क्] , they precede or follow it accordingly.
11047: The augment that has an indicatory @deva[म्] comes after the last among the vowels and becomes the final position of that which it augments.
11048: Of @deva[एच्] vowels, @deva[इक्] is the substitute, when short is to be substituted.
11049: The force of the genitive case in a sūtra is that of the phrase 'in the place of', when no special rules qualify the sense of Genitive 6th-Case.
11050: When a common term is obtained as a substitute, the likest of its significates to that in the place of which it comes, is the actual substitute.
11051: When a letter of @deva[अण्] @deva[प्रत्यहार] comes as a substitute for @deva[ऋ] it is always followed by @deva[र्]।
11052: The substitute takes the place of only the final letter (of that which is denoted by a term exhibited in the Genitive 6th-Case.
11053: And the substitute which is indicatory @deva[ङ्] (even though it consists of more than one letter) takes the place of the final letter only of the original expression.
11054: That which is enjoined to come in the room of what follows is to be understood as coming in the room only of the first letter thereof.
11055: A substitute consisting of more than one letter and a substitute having an indicatory @deva[श्] take the place of the whole of the original expression exhibited in the Genitive 6th-Case.
11056: A substitute (@deva[आदेश]) is like the former occupant (@deva[स्थानी]) but not in the case of a rule the occasion for the operation of which is furnished by the letters of the original term.
11057: A substitute in the room of a vowel caused by something that follows, should be regarded as that whose place it takes when a rule would else take effect on what stands anterior to the original vowel.
11058: Not so, in rules relating to the finals of words, to the doubling of letters, to the affixing of @deva[वरच्] , to the elision of @deva[य] , to accent, to homogenous letters, to @deva[अनुस्वर] , to the lengthening of vowels and to the substitution of @deva[जस्] and @deva[चर्] characters.
11059: Before an affix having an initial vowel, which causes reduplication, the substitute which takes the place of a vowel is like the original vowel even in form, only for the purpose of reduplication and no further.
11060: The substitution of a blank (@deva[लोप]) signifies disappearance.
11061: The disappearance of an affix when it is caused by the words @deva[लुक्] , @deva[श्लु] or @deva[लुप्] are designated by those terms respectively.
11062: When elision of an affix has taken place (@deva[लोप]), the affix still exerts its influence and the operations dependant upon it, take place as if it were present.
11063: Of the base (@deva[अङ्ग]), whose affix has been elided by the use of the three words containing @deva[लु] , the operations dependant on it do not take place, regarding such base.
11064: The final portion of a word, beginning with the last among the vowels in the word, is called @deva[टि]।
11065: The letter immediately preceding the last letter of a word is called penultimate (@deva[उपधा]).
11066: When a term is exhibited in the seventh case in these sūtras, the operation directed, is to be understood as effecting the state of what immediately precedes the which the term denotes.
11067: An operation caused by the exhibition of a term in the Ablative 5th case, is to be understood to enjoin the substitution of something in the room of that which immediately follows the word denoted by the term.
11068: In this Grammar, when an operation is directed with regard to a word, the individual form of the word possessing meaning is to be understood, except with regard to a word which is a definition.
11069: The letters of the @deva[प्रत्याहार] @deva[अण्] i.e. the vowels and semi-vowels and a term having @deva[उ] for its indicatory letter, refer to their own form as well as to their homogeneous letters, except when they are used as @deva[प्रत्यय]-s or affixes.
11070: The letter which has @deva[त्] after or before it, besides referring to its own form, refers to those homogeneous letters which have the some prosodial length or time.
11071: An initial letter, with a final @deva[इत्] letter as a final, is the name of itself and of the intervening letters.
11072: An injunction which is made with regard to a particular attribute, applies to words having that attribute at their end as well as to that attribute itself.
11073: That word, among the vowels of which the first is a @deva[वृद्धि] , is called @deva[वृद्धम्]।
11075: A word that has the letters @deva[ए] and @deva[ओ] as the first among its vowels, gets also the designation of @deva[वृद्धम्]।
12001: All affixes after the verb @deva[गाङ्] 'to study' and the verb @deva[कुट्] 'to be crooked' and the rest, are as if they had an indicatory @deva[ङ्] (@deva[ङित्]), except those affixes which have an indicatory @deva[ञ्] (@deva[ञित्]) or @deva[ण्] (@deva[णित्]).
12002: An affix which begins with the augment @deva[इट्] -- @deva[आर्धधातुकस्येड्] @deva[वलादेः] @ref[7.2.35], is @deva[ङित्] after the root @deva[विज्] 'to fear, to move'.
12003: After the verb @deva[ऊर्ण] 'to cover', the affix beginning with the augment @deva[इट्] is regarded optionally like @deva[ङित्]।
12004: A @deva[सार्वधातुक] -- @deva[तिङ्शित्सार्वधातुकम्] @ref[3.4.113], affix not having an indicatory @deva[ङित्]।
12005: The affixes of @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) not coming after a conjunct consonant, are as if they had an indicatory @deva[क्] (@deva[कित्]).
12006: The @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) affixes after the roots @deva[इन्धि] 'to kindle' and @deva[भू] 'to become' are also @deva[कित्]।
12007: The affix @deva[क्त्वा] is @deva[कित्] after @deva[मृड्] 'to be gracious', @deva[मृद्] 'to squeeze', @deva[गुध्] 'to wrap up', @deva[कुष्] 'to tear', @deva[क्लिश्] 'to suffer', @deva[वद्] 'to speak' and @deva[वस्] 'to dwell'.
12008: The affixes @deva[क्त्वा] and @deva[सन्] @ref[3.1.7] are @deva[कित्] after @deva[रुद्] 'to weep', @deva[विद्] 'to know', @deva[मुष्] 'to steal', @deva[गृह्] 'to seize', @deva[स्वप्] 'to sleep' and @deva[प्रच्छ्] 'to ask'.
12009: The affix @deva[सन्] beginning with a letter of the @deva[प्रत्यहार] @deva[झल्] is like @deva[कित्] after the verbs ending in @deva[इक्] vowels.
12010: And after a root ending in a consonant and preceded by a vowel of the @deva[प्रत्यहार] @deva[इक्] , the affix @deva[सन्] beginning with a @deva[झल्] consonant, is like @deva[कित्] ।
12011: After roots ending in a consonant, that adjoins a vowel of @deva[इक्] @deva[प्रत्यहार] , the substitutes of the -- @deva[विधिनिमन्त्रणामन्त्रण] @deva[अधीष्टसम्प्रश्नप्रार्थनेषु] @deva[लिङ्] @ref[3.3.161] and @deva[सिच्] -- @deva[च्लेः] @deva[सिच्] @ref[3.1.44], when they begin with a consonant of @deva[झल्] @deva[प्रत्यहार] , are @deva[कित्] when the @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes follow.
12012: And after the verbs ending in @deva[ऋ] , the substitutes of @deva[लिङ्] and the affix @deva[सिच्] , are @deva[कित्] , when they begin with @deva[झल्] and the @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes follow.
12013: Optionally after the verb @deva[गम्] , the @deva[लिङ्] and the @deva[सिच्] beginning with @deva[झल्] consonants, in the @deva[आत्मनेपद] , are @deva[कित्]।
12014: The @deva[सिच्] @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes are @deva[कित्] after the root @deva[हन्] 'to kill'.
12015: The affix @deva[सिच्] before @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes is @deva[कित्] after the verb @deva[यम्] when meaning 'to divulge'.
12016: The affix @deva[सिच्] before @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes is @deva[कित्] optionally when @deva[यम्] means 'to expose'.
12017: The affix @deva[सिच्] before @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes is @deva[कित्] after @deva[स्था] 'to stand' and @deva[घु] @deva[मृषस्तितिक्षायाम्] @ref[1.2.20] verbs, and these verbs change their @deva[आ] into @deva[इ] before these terminations.
12018: The affix @deva[क्त्वा] when it takes the augment @deva[इट्] (i.e. when it is @deva[सेट्]) is not @deva[कित्] ।
12019: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[निष्ठा] affixes are not @deva[कित्] after the verbs @deva[शीङ्] 'to lie down', @deva[स्विद्] 'to sweat', @deva[मिद्] 'to melt', @deva[क्ष्विद्] 'to be unctuous', and @deva[दृश्] 'to offend'.
12020: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[निष्ठा] affix is not @deva[कित्] after the verb @deva[मृष्] 'to forbear'.
12021: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[निष्ठा] affix is optionally not @deva[कित्] after the verbs with a penultimate @deva[उ] if used impersonally or denoting the beginning of action.
12022: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[निष्ठा] affix and the @deva[सेट्] @deva[क्त्वा] are not @deva[कित्] after the verb @deva[पुङ्] 'to purify'.
12023: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[क्त्वा] is optionally @deva[कित्] after the verbs having a penultimate @deva[न्] ending in a @deva[थ्] and @deva[फ्]।
12024: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[क्त्वा] is optionally @deva[कित्] after the verbs @deva[वञ्च्] 'to cheat', @deva[लुञ्च्] 'to pluck' and @deva[ऋत्] 'to dare or abhor'.
12025: The @deva[सेट्] @deva[क्त्वा] is optionally @deva[कित्] , according to the opinion of @deva[ऋषि] @deva[काश्यप] after the verbs @deva[तृष्] 'to be thirsty', @deva[मृष्] 'to sprinkle' and @deva[कृश्] 'to become lean'.
12026: After a verb which begins in a consonant and ends in a letter of @deva[रल्] @deva[प्रत्यहार] and has as its penultimate @deva[इ] or @deva[ई] and @deva[उ] or @deva[ऊ] , the @deva[क्त्वा] and @deva[सन्] affixes are optionally @deva[कित्] ।
12027: A vowel whose time is that of short @deva[उ] , @deva[ऊ] and the prolated @deva[ऊ] , is called respectively @deva[ह्रस्व] short, @deva[दीर्घ] long and @deva[प्लुत] prolated.
12028: The short, long and prolated, when enunciated as such, by using these terms, are to be understood to come in the place of vowels only.
12029: The vowel that is perceived as having a high tone is called @deva[उदात्त] or acutely accented.
12030: The vowel that is perceived as having a low tone is called @deva[अनुदात्तः] or gravely accented
12031: The vowel that has the combination of @deva[अनुदात्त] and @deva[उदात्त] tones is said to be @deva[स्वरित] or circumflexly accented.
12032: Of it (@deva[स्वरित]-s) the first portion is @deva[उदात्त] , to the extent of a half measure, or prosodial length.
12033: In addressing a person from a distance the tone is called @deva[एकश्रुति] or monotony.
12034: In sacrificial works there is Monotony, except in @deva[जप] (silent repetition of a formula), @deva[न्यूङ्ख] vowels (16 sorts of @deva[ओम्]) and the @deva[साम] Vedas.
12035: The pronunciation of the word @deva[वषट्] , may optionally be by raising the voice (acutely accented), or it may be pronounced with monotony.
12036: The monotony is optional in the recitation of the Vedas or they may be recited with accents.
12037: There should be no Monotony in the recitation of the @deva[सब्रह्मण्य] hymns and in those hymns, the vowels, that would otherwise have taken the @deva[स्वरित] accent, take the @deva[उदात्त] accent instead.
12038: The words @deva[देवा] and @deva[ब्राह्मण] in those hymns have @deva[अनुदात्त] accent.
12039: The Monotony takes the place of the @deva[अनुदात्त] vowels which follow the @deva[स्वरित] vowels, in close proximity (@deva[संहिता]).
12040: The accent called @deva[सन्नतर] is substituted in the room of an @deva[अनुदात्त] vowel, which has an @deva[उदात्त] or @deva[स्वरित] vowel following it.
12041: An affix consisting of a single letter is called @deva[अपृक्त]।
12042: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound, the case of each member is the same, is called @deva[कर्मधारय] or Appositional Determinative compound.
12043: In (this book, in the sūtras relating to) compound, the word that is exhibited in the Nominative -1st case, is called @deva[उपसर्जन] or the secondary word.
12044: A word which is one fixed case, (while the word compounded with it may vary its case) is also @deva[उपसर्जन] , except for the purposes of the the rule which requires the @deva[उपसर्जन] to stand first in a compound.
12045: A significant form of a word, not being a verbal root (@deva[धातु]), or an affix (@deva[प्रत्यय]) is called a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] or crude-form.
12046: The forms ending @deva[कृत्] affixes or @deva[तद्धित] affixes, or compound are also called @deva[प्रातिपदिक]।
12047: The short vowel is substituted in the neuter, for the final vowel, of a @deva[प्रातिपदिक]।
12048: A short vowel is the substitute of @deva[प्रातिपदिक] which ends with the word @deva[गो] 'a cow' and of that which ends with what has as its termination a feminine affix, when regarded as @deva[उपसर्जन]।
12049: When a @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided by the word @deva[लुक्] there takes place the elision by @deva[लुक्] of feminine affix of the @deva[उपसर्जन]।
12050: The short is substituted in the place of @deva[गोणी] , when the @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided by @deva[लुक्]।
12051: When a @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided by using the word @deva[लुप्] , then the gender and number (of the derivative word) agree with those of the original word.
12052: And of adjectives (the gender and number are the same as of the word formed by @deva[लुप्] elision of the @deva[तद्धित] and which they qualify) so far as the @deva[जाति] (or kind of species) is concerned, (or when not expressing @deva[जाति]).
12053: This (concord or gender and number, of primitive and derivative nouns, and of attributes and substantives need not be taught (or approved), because it has the authority of @deva[संज्ञा] (conventional term or idiom).

14005: Feminine words ending in @deva[ई] and @deva[ऊ] though admitting @deva[इयङ्] and @deva[उवङ्] @ref[6.1.77] substitutes, are optionally termed @deva[नदी] when the affix @deva[अम्] (Genitive Plural) follows, but not so the word @deva[स्त्री] , which is always @deva[नदी]।
14006: When a case-affix having an indicatory @deva[ङ्] (@deva[ङित्]) follows, then feminine words ending in short @deva[इ] and @deva[उ] are optionally termed @deva[नदी] , as well as feminine nouns in long @deva[ई] and @deva[ऊ] which admit @deva[इयङ्] and @deva[उवङ्] ; but not so the word @deva[स्त्री] which is always @deva[नदी]।
14007: The rest of the words that end in short @deva[इ] and @deva[उ] are @deva[घि] with the exception of the word @deva[सखि]।
14008: The word @deva[पति] is called @deva[घि] only when it is in a compound.
14009: The word @deva[पति] when used in connection with a noun ending in the 6th or genitive case, is @deva[घि] , optionally, in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Veda).
14011: When a conjunct consonant follows a short vowel is termed @deva[गुरु] 'heavy'.
14012: And a long vowel is also called @deva[गुरु] 'heavy'.
14013: After whatsoever there is an affix enjoined, whether verbal or crude-form, that which begins therewith in the form in which it appears when the affix follows it, is called an @deva[अङ्ग] 'Inflective base'.
14014: That which ends in @deva[सुप्] 'case-affix' @ref[4.1.2] or @deva[तिङ्] @ref[3.4.78] (tense-affix), is called @deva[पद] or inflected word.
14015: The word-form ending in @deva[न्] , is called @deva[पद] when @deva[क्य] follows (i.e. the affixes @deva[क्यच्] , @deva[क्यङ्] and @deva[क्यष्]।
14016: When an affix having an indicatory @deva[स्] follows then that which precedes it is called @deva[पद]।
14017: When the affixes beginning with a @deva[सु] @ref[4.1.2] and ending in @deva[कप्] @ref[5.4.151] follow, not being @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] @ref[1.1.43] then that which precedes is called @deva[पद]।
14018: And when an affix with an initial @deva[य्] or an initial vowel, being one of the affixes, beginning with @deva[सु] and ending in @deva[क्] , follows, not being @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] , then what precedes, is called @deva[भ]।
14019: The word-form ending in @deva[त्] or in @deva[स्] is called @deva[भ] when an affix with the force of @deva[मतुप्] 'whose is it' or 'in whom it is' @ref[5.2.94], follows.
14020: Words like @deva[अयस्मय] etc. are valid forms in the @deva[छन्दस्]।
14021: In expressing multeity, a Plural case affix is employed.
14022: The dual and singular case-affixes are employed severally in the sense of duality and unity.
14023: The phrase @deva[कारक] (meaning 'in the special relation to a word expressing an action') is to be understood in the following aphorisms.
14024: A noun whose relation to an action is that of a fixed point from which departure takes place is called @deva[अपादान] or Ablation.
14025: In case of words implying 'fear' and 'protection from danger' that from which the danger of fear proceeds is called @deva[अपादान] @deva[कारक]।
14026: In the case of the verb @deva[पराजि] 'to be tired or weary of', that which becomes unbearable, is called @deva[अपादान] @deva[कारक]।
14027: In case of verbs having the sense of 'preventing, the desired object from which one is prevented or warded off', is called Ablation or @deva[अपदान] @deva[कारक]।
14028: When concealment is indicated, the person whose sight one wishes to avoid, is called @deva[अपादान] @deva[कारक]।
14029: The noun denoting the teacher is called Ablation or @deva[अपादान] , in relation to the action signifying formal teaching.
14030: The prime cause of the agent of the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be born', is called @deva[अपादान]।
14031: The source of the agent of the verb @deva[भू] 'to become' is called @deva[अपादान]।
14032: The person whom one wishes to connect with the object of giving, is called @deva[सम्प्रदान] or recipient.
14033: In case of verbs having the signification of the root @deva[रुच्] 'to like', the person or thing that is pleased or satisfied, is called @deva[सम्प्रदान] or recipient.
14034: In case of verbs @deva[श्लाघ्] 'to praise', @deva[ह्नु] 'to take away', @deva[स्था] 'to stand', @deva[शप्] 'to curse', the person whom it is intended to inform of or persuade by, these actions, is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14035: In the case of the verb @deva[धारि] 'to owe', the creditor is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14036: In the case of the verb @deva[स्पृह्] 'to desire', the thing desired is called @deva[सम्प्रदान] @deva[कारक]।
14037: In the case of the verbs having the sense of @deva[क्रद्ध्] 'to be angry', @deva[द्रुह्] 'to injure', @deva[ईर्ष्या] 'to envy', @deva[असूया] 'to detract', the person against whom the feeling of anger etc. is directed is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14038: But in the case of the verbs @deva[क्रुद्ध्] and @deva[द्रुह्] , when preceded by prepositions, the person against whom the feeling of anger etc. is directed is called @deva[कर्म] @deva[कारक] or object.
14039: In the case of the verbs @deva[राध्] 'to propitiate' and @deva[ईक्ष्] 'to look to', the person about whose good or bad fortune questions are asked is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14040: In the case of the verb @deva[श्रु] preceded by the prepositions @deva[प्रति] and @deva[अङ्] and meaning 'to promise', the person to whom promise is made (literally: the person who as the agent of the former verb) is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14041: In the case of the verb @deva[गृ] preceded by @deva[अनु] and @deva[प्रति] and meaning 'to encourage by repeating', the person who was the agent of the prior action, which is repeated, is called @deva[सम्प्रदान]।
14042: That which is especially auxiliary in the accomplishment of the action is called Instrument or @deva[करण] @deva[कारक]।
14043: That which is especially auxiliary in the accomplishment of the action, of the verb @deva[दिव्] 'to play' is called @deva[कर्म] - object, as well as @deva[करण]।
14044: In the case of hiring on wages, that which is especially auxiliary in the accomplishment of the action of the verb @deva[परिक्री] 'employing on stipulated wages', is optionally called @deva[सम्प्रदान] or recipient.
14045: That which is related to the action as the site where the action is performed by reason of the agent or the object being in that place is called @deva[अधिकरण] or location.
14046: That which is the site of the verbs @deva[शीङ्] 'to lie down', @deva[स्था] 'to stand', @deva[आस्] 'to sit', when preceded by the preposition @deva[अधि] , is however called @deva[कर्म] @deva[कारक] or object.
14047: That which is the site of the verb @deva[अभिनिविश्] 'to enter', is also called @deva[कर्म] @deva[कारक]।
14048: That which is the site of the verb @deva[वस्] 'to dwell', when preceded by @deva[उप] , @deva[अनु] , and @deva[आङ्] is called @deva[कर्म] @deva[कारक]।
14049: That which is intended should be most effected by the act of the agent is called the object or @deva[कर्म]।
14050: If that which is not intended to be most affected by the act becomes however similarly connected with the action it also is called @deva[कर्म]।
14051: And if that @deva[कारक] which is not spoken of as coming under any of the special relations of Ablation etc., is also called @deva[कर्म]।
14052: Of the verbs having the sense of 'motion', 'knowledge or information' and 'eating' and of verbs that have some literary work for their object and of intransitive verbs, that which was the agent of the verb in its primitive (non-@deva[णि] or non-causal state), is called the @deva[कर्म] or object, in its causative state (when the verb takes the affix @deva[णि]).
14053: The agent of the verb in its non-@deva[णि] (primitive) form in the case of @deva[हृ] 'to lose' and @deva[कृ] 'to make', is optionally called @deva[कर्म] or object when these verbs take the affix.
14054: Whatever the speaker chooses as the independent, principal and absolute source of action is called @deva[कर्ता] or agent.
14055: That which is the mover thereof, i.e. of the independent source of action, is called @deva[हेतु] or cause, as well as @deva[कर्ता] or agent.
14056: From this point forward up to the aphorism @deva[अधिरीश्वरे] @ref[1.4.97], all that we shall say is to be understood to have the name of @deva[निपात] or Particles.
14057: The word @deva[च] 'and' etc. are called @deva[निपात] or Particles, when they do not signify substances.
14058: The words @deva[प्र] etc. are called @deva[निपात] when not signifying substances.
14059: The words @deva[प्र] etc. get the designation of @deva[उपसर्ग] or prepositions, when in composition with a verb.
14060: The words @deva[प्र] etc. are called also @deva[गति] when in composition with a verb.
14061: The words @deva[उरी] 'assent' etc. and those that end with @deva[च्वि] @ref[5.4.50] and those that end with @deva[डाच्] @ref[5.4.57] (when in composition with the verb @deva[भू] , @deva[कृ] or @deva[अस्] ) are called @deva[गति]।
14062: A word imitative of sounds is also called @deva[गति] when it is not followed by the word @deva[इति]।
14063: The words @deva[सत्] and @deva[असत्] when in composition with a verb is called @deva[गति] , when used in the sense of 'respect or love' and 'disrespect or indifference'.
14064: The word @deva[अलम्] when in composition with a verb is called @deva[गति] , when used in the sense of 'ornament'.
14065: The word @deva[अन्तर्] is called @deva[गति] , when used in the sense of 'non-accepting', when in composition with a verb.
14066: The words @deva[कणे] and @deva[मनस्] are @deva[गति] when in composition with a verb and used in the sense of 'reaction by satiation'.
14067: The word @deva[पुरः] 'in front of', when indeclinable and in composition with a verb, is called @deva[गति]।
14068: And the indeclinable word @deva[अस्तम्] 'at home' is called @deva[गति] , when in composition with a verb.
14069: The indeclinable word @deva[अच्छ] 'before in the presence of' is called @deva[गति] , when used in the composition with verbs denoting 'motion' or with the verb @deva[वद्] 'to speak'.
14070: The word @deva[अदस्] 'that' is called @deva[गति] when in composition with a verb and not implying a direction to another.
14071: The word @deva[तिरस्] when used in the sense of 'disappearance' is called @deva[गति] when in composition with a verb.
14072: The word @deva[तिरस्] 'disappearance' is optionally called @deva[गति] when the verb @deva[कृ] follows.
14073: The words @deva[उपाजे] and @deva[अनवाजे] both meaning 'supporting or assisting the weak', are optionally called @deva[गति] when used along with the verb @deva[कृ]।
14074: The words @deva[साक्षात्] 'in the presence of' etc. are optionally called @deva[गति] when used along with the verb @deva[कृ]।
14075: The word @deva[उर्सि] 'in the breast' and @deva[मनसि] 'in the mind' ae optionally called @deva[गति] when the verb @deva[कृ] follows, provided that they are not used in the sense of 'placing'.
14076: And the words @deva[मध्ये] 'in the middle', @deva[पदे] 'in the foot' and @deva[निवचने] 'speechless' are optionally called @deva[गति] , when @deva[कृ] follows, the sense not being of placing.
14077: The word @deva[हस्ते] 'in the hand', @deva[पाणौ] 'in the hand' are always necessarily called @deva[गति] when used with the verb @deva[कृ] in the sense of 'marriage'.
14078: The indeclinable word @deva[प्रध्वम्] followed by the verb @deva[कृ] , is always called @deva[गति] when in used in the sense of 'binding'.
14079: The words @deva[जीविका] and @deva[उपनिषद्] followed by the verb @deva[कृ] are called @deva[गति] when used in the sense of 'likeness and resemblance'.
14080: The particles called @deva[गति] and @deva[उपसर्ग] are to be employed before the verbal roots (i.e. to say that they are prefixes).
14081: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Veda) these @deva[गति] and @deva[उपसर्ग] are employed indifferently after the verbal root, as well as before it.
14082: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Veda) these @deva[गति] and @deva[उपसर्ग] are also seen separated from the verb by intervening words.
14083: From this point as far as aphorism @ref[1.4.97] treated of, are to be understood as having the name of @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय]।
14084: The word @deva[अनु] , when it denotes a sign, is called @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय]।
14085: The word @deva[अनु] , @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when it has the force of the 3rd case.
14086: The word @deva[अनु] , @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when it is used in the sense of 'inferior or subordinate to'.
14087: The word @deva[उप] when it means 'superior' or 'inferior to' is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय]।
14088: The words @deva[अप] and @deva[परि] are @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when meaning 'exclusion'.
14089: The word @deva[आङ्] 'as far as', is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when it expresses limit (e.g. when it means 'as far as inclusive of' or 'as far as exclusive of').
14090: The words @deva[प्रति] , @deva[परि] and @deva[अनु] are @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when used in the sense of 'sign' ('in the direction of') , 'mere statement of circumstances' ('as regards'), 'division', 'share of' and 'pervasion', severally.
14091: The word @deva[अभि] is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when used in the above senses of 'in the direction of', 'as regards', and 'each severally', but not when it means 'division', 'share of'.
14092: The word @deva[प्रति] is @deva[कर्म] -@deva[प्रवचनीय] when used in the sense of representative ('representative of') or exchange ('in exchange for').
14093: The words @deva[अधि] and @deva[परि] are @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when used as mere expletives.
14094: The word @deva[सु] is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when used in the sense of respect, (when it means 'excellently').
14095: The word @deva[अति] in the sense of super-abundance ('excessively') and 'excellently' is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय]।
14096: The word @deva[अपि] is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when it implies, the sense of word 'understood' ('somewhat') or 'possibility' (e.g. 'even' in the sense of such a great person), or permission to do as one likes, ('if you like'), or censure ('even' in the sense of what is disgraceful); or collection ('and').
14097: The words @deva[अधि] is @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when used in the sense of 'lord' ('being as a lord' or 'having as a lord')
14098: The words @deva[अधि] is optionally @deva[कर्म-प्रवचनीय] when the verb @deva[कृ] follows.
14100: The nine affixes comprised under the @deva[प्रत्याहार] - @deva[तङ्] and the two ending in @deva[आन] (@deva[शानच्] and @deva[कानच्]), which are substitutes of @deva[ल] are called @deva[आत्मनेपद]।
14101: The three triads in both the sets @deva[परस्मैपद] and @deva[आत्मनेपद] , of conjugational affixes (comprised under the general name @deva[तिङ्] , a @deva[प्रत्यहार] formed of the first and last of them, viz. @deva[तिप्] and @deva[महिङ्]) are called, in order, Lowest - 3rd Person of European Grammar, Middle -2nd Person, and Highest -1st Person.
14102: These three triads of conjugational affixes, which have received the name of Lowest etc. are called (as regard the three expressions in each triad) severally 'the expression for one' (singular), 'the expression for two' (dual) and 'the expression for many' (plural).
14103: Of @deva[सुप्] (which is a @deva[प्रत्याहार] formed of @deva[सु] the first of the case affixes and the final @deva[प्] of the last of them), the expressions in each successive set of the three, are also severally called singular, dual and plural.
14104: The triads of conjugational affixes and case affixes are also called @deva[विभक्ति] or Inflective affixes.
14105: When the pronoun @deva[युष्मद्] 'thou' understood, and also when the same expressed, is the attendant word in the agreement with the verb, then there is the verbal termination called the middle (2nd person).
14106: When joke is implied with reference to an action, the verb denoting it is used in the 2nd person; provided that the word @deva[मन्य] 'to think' is the attendant word (@deva[उपपद]) of such verb and of the verb @deva[मन्य] itself, the affix must be of the 1st person and singular number.
14107: When the pronoun @deva[अस्मद्] 'I', understood and also when expressed, is the attendant word in agreement with the verb, then there is the verbal termination called the Highest or 1st person.
14108: In the other cases, viz. where 'thou' or 'I' are not the attendant words in agreement with the verb, there is the verbal termination called the Lowest (3rd person).
14109: The closest proximity of letters, there being the intervention of half a @deva[मात्रा] or prosodial length between them, is called contact or @deva[संहिता]।
14110: The cessation or the absence of succeeding letters is called pause or @deva[अवसान]।
21001: A rule which relates to complete words (and not to the roots out of which the words are constructed) is to be understood to apply only to those words the senses of which are connected.
21002: A word ending in @deva[सुप्] or a case-affix, when followed by a word in the Vocative Case, is regarded as if it was the @deva[अङ्ग] or component part of such subsequent vocative word, when a rule relating to accent is to be applied.
21003: From this point up to the aphorism @deva[कडाराः] @deva[कर्मधारये] @ref[2.2.38], all the terms that we shall say, describe will get the designation of @deva[समास] or compound
21004: The words @deva[सह] @deva[सुपा] meaning 'with a word ending in a case-affix', are to be understood in each of the succeeding aphorisms.
21005: From this point forward whatever we shall describe will get the name @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास] or adverbial compound.
21006: An @deva[अव्यय] - indeclinable, used with the sense of an inflective-affix (@deva[विभक्ति]) or of near to, or prosperity, or diversity, or absence of the thing, or departure, or not now, or the production of some sound, or after, or according to, or order of arrangement, or totality, or termination, is invariably compounded with a word ending in a case-affix which is connected with it in sense and the compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21007: The indeclinable word @deva[यथा] when it does not signify 'likeness' is invariably compounded with a word ending in a case-affix which is in construction with it and the compound is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास]।
21008: The indeclinable word @deva[यावत्] when it signifies limitation, is invariably compounded with a word ending in a case-affix which is in construction with it, and the compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21009: A word ending in a case-affix is compounded with the indeclinable word @deva[प्रति] , when meaning 'a little' and the compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21010: The words @deva[अक्ष] 'a die for playing with', @deva[शलाका] 'an ivory piece used in gambling' and @deva[सङ्खया] 'numerals' are compounded with the word @deva[परि] and the compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21011: The word @deva[विभाषा] or option governs all succeeding sūtras.
21012: The words @deva[अप] , @deva[परि] , @deva[बहिल्] and indeclinables ending in @deva[अञ्चु] may optionally be compounded with a word ending in the 5th case affix and the compound so formed will be @deva[अव्ययीभाव] ।
21013: The word @deva[आङ्] when signifying limit exclusive or limit inclusive, may optionally be compounded with a word ending in the 5th case and the compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21014: The words @deva[अभि] and @deva[प्रति] when implying direction (towards), are optionally compounded with a word ending in a case-affix denoting the limit, or the goal which regulates or marks the direction and the resulting compound is @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21015: The word @deva[अनु] 'near to' is optionally compounded with that word, nearness to which is indicated by the particle and the resulting compound is @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21016: The word @deva[अनु] 'alongside of' is optionally compounded with the word indicative of that whose length the particle expresses and compound so formed is called @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21017: And the words @deva[तिष्ठद्गु] 'at the time when the cows stand to be milked', etc. are @deva[अव्ययीभाव] compounds.
21018: The words @deva[पार] 'across' and @deva[मध्य] 'middle' may optionally be compounded with a word ending in the 6th-Case-affix, when they take forms @deva[परे] and @deva[मध्ये] and the compound so formed is @deva[अव्ययीभाव]।
21019: A numeral (@deva[संख्या]) may be compounded with a word denoting 'one belonging to a family' and the resulting compound is @deva[अव्ययीभाव] ।
21020: A numeral (@deva[संख्या]) may be compounded with the names of 'rivers' and the resulting compound is @deva[अव्ययीभाव] denoting an aggregate.
21021: A word ending in a case-affix is compounded with words denoting the names of rivers, when the compound word denotes a thing other than that expressed by the terms of the compound and is an appellative, the compound so formed being an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] ।
21022: From this sūtra as far as sūtra @ref[2.2.23], the word @deva[तत्-पुरुष] is governing word, and is understood in all the following sūtras.
21023: And the compound called @deva[द्विगु] (Numeral Determinative Compound) is all called @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21024: A word ending in a 2nd case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[श्रित] 'who had recourse to', @deva[अतीत] 'gone by', @deva[पतित] 'who has fallen upon', @deva[गत] 'who has gone to', @deva[अत्यस्त] 'who has passed', @deva[प्राप्त] 'who has obtained' and @deva[अपान्न] 'who has reached' and the resulting compound is called @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21025: The indeclinable word @deva[स्वयम्] 'oneself' is compounded with a word ending in the affix @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21026: The word @deva[खट्वा] in the Accusative -2nd case is compounded with a word ending in the affix @deva[क्त] , when censure is implied and the compound so formed is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21027: The indeclinable word @deva[सामि] 'half' is compounded with a word ending in the affix @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21028: The words denoting time, being in the Accusative -2nd case, are optionally compounded with a word ending in the affix @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
21029: Words denoting time being in the Accusative -2nd case, are optionally compounded with a word ending in a case-affix, when used in the sense of complete connection throughout with the time (i.e. duration of time) and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
21030: A word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix is optionally compounded with what denotes quality, the quality being that which is instrumentally caused by the thing signified by what ends with the 3rd case-affix and with the word @deva[अर्थ] 'wealth' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21031: A word ending in Instrumental -3rd case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[पूर्व] 'prior', @deva[सदृश] 'like', @deva[सम] 'similar', @deva[अनर्थ] 'words having the sense of less', @deva[कलह] 'quarrel', @deva[निपुण] 'proficient', @deva[मिश्र] 'mixed' and @deva[श्लक्षण] 'polished sleek', and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21032: A word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix, when it denotes the agent or instrument -- @ref[2.3.18], is compounded diversely with what ends with a @deva[कृत्] affix and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21033: A word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix when it denotes the agent or the Instrument, is compounded optionally with a word ending in a @deva[कृत्य] affix, when exaggerated statement (whether of praise or of censure) is implied and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21034: A word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix and denoting a condiment, is optionally compounded with a word ending in a case-affix, signifying food and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21035: A word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix and denoting a relish giving or refining ingredient, is compounded with a word meaning, victuals and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21036: A word ending with the Dative -4th case is compounded with what denotes that which is for the purpose of what ends with the Dative -4th case and so too with the words @deva[अर्थ] 'on account of', @deva[बलि] 'a sacrifice', @deva[हित] 'salutary', @deva[सुख] 'pleasure' and @deva[रक्षित] 'kept' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21037: A word ending with the Ablative -5th case-affix is optionally compounded with the word @deva[भय] 'fear' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21038: A word ending with the Ablative -5th case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[अपेत] 'gone away', @deva[अपोध] 'carried away', @deva[मुक्त] 'freed', @deva[पतित] 'fallen', @deva[अपत्रस्त] 'afraid of', when the event takes place in a gradual manner and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21039: Words with a sense of @deva[स्तोक] 'a little', @deva[अन्तिक] 'near', @deva[दूर] 'far' and @deva[कृच्छ्र] 'penance', ending in the Ablative -5th case are compounded with what ends in @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21040: A word ending in the Locative -7th-case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[शौण्ड] 'skilled' etc. and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21041: A word ending with the Locative -7th-case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[सिद्ध] 'perfected', @deva[शुष्क] 'dried', @deva[पक्व] 'cooked', and @deva[बन्ध] 'bound' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21042: A word ending in the Locative -7th-case-affix is compounded with the words @deva[ध्वाङ्क्ष] 'a crow' and synonyms of crow when contempt is implied and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21043: A word ending with the Locative -7th-case-affix is compounded with words ending with @deva[कृत्य]-affix (a Future Passive Participle) and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21044: A word ending with the Locative -7th-case-affix is invariably compounded with a word ending in a case-affix, when the compound thus formed is used as an appellative and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21045: The names of divisions of day or night ending with Locative -7th-case-affix are compounded with words ending with affix @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21046: The word @deva[तत्र] 'there' which is a word ending with Locative -7th-case-affix @deva[सप्तम्यास्त्रल्] @ref[5.3.10], is compounded with a word ending in @deva[क्त] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21047: The word ending in Locative -7th-case-affix is compounded with a word ending with the affix @deva[क्त] when 'censure' is implied and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21048: The words like @deva[पात्रे-सम्मित] 'a dish-companion' (a parasite) etc. are @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compounds when contempt is implied.
21049: A case-inflected word denoting an action which naturally precedes in time (@deva[पूर्वकाल]) and the words @deva[एक] 'one', @deva[सर्व] 'all' @deva[जरत] 'old', @deva[पुराण] 'ancient', @deva[नव] 'new', and @deva[केवल] 'only' are compounded with their co-relative case-inflected words which are in the same case with them and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21050: The words expressing a point of the compass or a number (@deva[संख्या] ) enter into composition with the word correlated to them by being in the same case, when the sense of the compound is that of an appellative and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21051: In a case where the sense is that of a @deva[तद्धित]-affix or when an additional member comes after the compound or when an aggregate is to be expressed, then a word signifying a point of the compass or a number, enters into composition with a case-inflected word which is in agreement with it by being in the same case and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21052: In a case where the sense is that of a @deva[तद्धित]-affix or when an additional member comes after the compound or when an aggregate is to be expressed, the compound, the first member of which is numeral, is called @deva[द्विगु] (Numeral Determinative Compound).
21053: Case-inflected words expressing vileness are compounded with case-inflected words, expressing contempt and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21054: The case-inflected words @deva[पाप] 'sin' and @deva[अणक] 'insignificant' are compounded with words expressive of vileness and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21055: Case-inflected words denoting objects of comparison are compounded with words denoting what is likened to them, by reason of the latter possessing qualities in common with the former and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21056: A case-inflected word denoting subject of comparison is compounded with the words @deva[व्याघ्र] 'tiger' etc., the latter being the standard of comparison and in construction with the former and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ; provided that any word expressing the common characteristic (@deva[सामान्य]) as explained above, is not used.
21057: A case-inflected word denoting the qualifier (the Adjective), is compounded diversely with a case-inflected word denoting the thing thereby qualified, (the Substantive), the latter being in agreement (same case) with the former and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21058: A case-inflected words @deva[पूर्व] 'prior', @deva[अपर] 'other', @deva[प्रथम] 'first', @deva[चरम] 'last', @deva[जघन्य] 'hindmost', @deva[समान] 'equal', @deva[मध्य] 'middle', @deva[मध्यम] 'middle', and @deva[वीर] 'hero' are compounded with words ending with a case-affix and which are in agreement (same case) with them and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21059: The case-inflected words @deva[श्रेणी] 'class' etc. are compounded with words @deva[कृत्] 'made' etc. which are in agreement (same case), with them and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21060: A word ending with the affix @deva[क्त] and not having the negative augment @deva[नञ्] is compounded with the same word ending with the affix @deva[क्त] but which is distinguished from the former, by having the augment @deva[नञ्] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21061: The words @deva[सत्] 'good, @deva[महत्] 'great', @deva[परम] 'highest', @deva[उत्तम] 'best' and @deva[उत्कृष्ट] 'excellent' are compounded with the words denoting the person deserving the respect and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21062: A case-inflected word denoting object deserving of respect is compounded with the words @deva[वृन्दारक] 'eminent', @deva[नाग] 'serpent or elephant', @deva[कुञ्जर] 'elephant' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21063: The words @deva[कतर] 'which or who of two', and @deva[कतम] 'which or who of many', when used in asking questions about the genus or class, are compounded with the other case-inflected words with which they are in construction and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21064: The word @deva[किम्] 'what', when implying 'contempt' is compounded with a word ending in case-affix and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21065: A case-inflected word denoting a genus (@deva[जाति]) is compounded with the words @deva[पोटा] 'a hermaphrodite', @deva[युवति] 'a young female', @deva[स्तोक] 'a little', @deva[कतिपय] 'a few', @deva[गृष्टि] 'a cow which has had only one calf', @deva[धेनु] 'milch cow', @deva[वशा] 'a barren female', @deva[वेहद्] 'a cow that miscarries', @deva[बष्कयणी] 'a cow that has a full-grown calf', @deva[प्रवक्तृ] 'an expounder', @deva[श्रोत्रिय] 'a learned @deva[ब्राह्मण] ', @deva[अध्यापक] 'a teacher' and @deva[धूर्त] 'a cunning fellow' and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21066: A case-inflected word denoting a genus (@deva[जाति]) is compounded with a word denoting praise and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21067: The word @deva[युवा] 'young' is compounded with the words @deva[खलति] 'bald headed', @deva[पलित] 'grey-haired', @deva[वलिन] 'wrinkled', @deva[जरति] 'decayed', when they are in agreement (same case) and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21068: Words ending with @deva[कृत्] -affix and the word @deva[तुल्य] 'equal' and its synonyms are compounded with words which do not denote genus (@deva[जाति]) being in the same case with them and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21069: A case-inflected word denoting 'colour' is compounded with another case-inflected word which is in agreement with the former and also denotes colour and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21070: The word @deva[कुमार] 'a boy' is compounded with co-ordinate words @deva[श्रमण] 'an ascetic' etc. and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21071: A case-inflected word denoting a quadruped is compounded with the co-ordinate word @deva[गर्भिणी] and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष] ।
21072: And the words @deva[मयूर-व्यंसका] 'cunning like a peacock' etc. are @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compounds.
22001: The words @deva[पूर्व] 'front', @deva[अपर] 'near', @deva[अधर] 'lower', @deva[उत्तर] 'upper', are compounded when in construction with a word signifying a thing that has parts, provided that the thing having parts is distinguished numerically by unity; and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22002: The word @deva[अर्द्ध] when it signifies exactly equal parts i.e. halves, is always neuter and is compounded with a word signifying a thing that has parts, provided that the thing halved is numerically one; and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22003: The words @deva[द्वितीय] 'second', @deva[तृतीय] 'third', @deva[चतुर्थ] 'fourth', @deva[तुर्य] 'fourth', are optionally compounded with that word which signifies a thing that has parts, provided that the thing having parts is distinguished numerically by unity. The compound so formed is called @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22004: The words @deva[प्राप्त] 'obtained', and @deva[आपन्न] 'obtained' are optionally compounded with words ending in a Second Case-affix and form @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound.
22005: Words denoting time are compounded when in construction, with words denoting the object whose duration is measured by the time, and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22006: The negative word @deva[नञ्] is compounded with a case-inflected word with which it is in construction, and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22007: The word @deva[ईषत्] 'a little' is compounded with a case-inflected word which does not end with a @deva[कृत्] affix and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22008: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is compounded with a case-inflected word with which it is in construction and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22009: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is compounded with the word @deva[याजक] 'sacrificer' etc. and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22010: A word in the genitive case is not compounded with another, when the force of the sixth case-affix is that of specification (@deva[निर्धारण]).
22011: A word ending in a sixth case-affix is not compounded with a word having the sense of an ordinal, an attribute, or satisfaction, or with a participle ending in the suffix @deva[सत्] 3.2127, or an indeclinable, or ending with the affix @deva[तव्य] , or with a word denoting the same object (i.e. when they are in apposition).
22012: A word ending with sixth case-affix is not compounded with a word ending with the affix @deva[क्त] , when the force of @deva[क्त] is to denote 'respect' etc.
22013: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is not compounded with a word ending with the affix @deva[क्त] , when the force of the latter is to denote 'locality' in which something happened
22014: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is not compounded with another, when the force of the genitive is that of the accusative.
22015: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is not compounded with a word ending with @deva[त्रिच्] or @deva[अक] , when the force of the genitive case is that of an agent.
22016: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is not compounded with a word ending with @deva[त्रिच्] or @deva[अक] affix when the force of these latter affixes is that of an agent.
22017: A word ending with a sixth case-affix is invariably compounded with a word ending with @deva[अक] , when these affixes denote a sport or livelihood; and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22018: The indeclinable word @deva[कु] 'bad' , the particles called @deva[गति] and the prepositions @deva[प्र] etc. are invariably compounded with other words with which they are in construction and the resulting compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22019: An @deva[उपपद] of attendant word @deva[तत्रोपपदं] @deva[सप्तमीस्थम्] @ref[3.1.92] which does not end with a tense-affix @ref[3.4.78] is invariably compounded with that with which it is in construction. The compound thus formed is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22020: When an @deva[उपपद] is compounded with an indeclinable, then it is compounded only with those @deva[अव्यय]s which end in the affix @deva[अम्]।
22021: An @deva[उपपद] ending in third case-affix @ref[3.4.47] etc. is compounded optionally with an indeclinable formed by the affix @deva[अम्] and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22022: An @deva[उपपद] ending in third case-affix or any other of the remaining four cases, is optionally compounded with a word ending with the affix @deva[क्तवा] and the compound is @deva[तत्-पुरुष]।
22024: Two or more words, ending in any case-affix, form compound, denoting another new thing, not connoted by those words individually and the compound is called @deva[बहुव्रीही]।
22025: indeclinable words and the words @deva[आसन्न] 'near', @deva[अदूर] 'near', @deva[अधिक] 'more' and the words called @deva[संख्या] (Numerals) are compounded with another @deva[संख्या] word, when the sense is that of a numeral or @deva[संख्या]। The compound is @deva[बहुव्रीही]।
22026: Words which are the names of the points of the compass are compounded, when the compound signifies the intermediate point and the compound so formed is @deva[बहुव्रीही]।
22027: Two homonymous words (both being in the locative case or both being in the instrumental case) are compounded, the sense being 'this happens therein or with that'. The compound so formed is @deva[बहुव्रीही]।
22028: The word @deva[सह] 'together' is compounded with a word ending with the third case-affix and the compound is @deva[बहुव्रीही] ; provided that, the companion and the person accompanied are equally effected by any action or thing, in the same manner.
22029: When a set of several words ending with case-affixes stands in a relation expressable by 'and' the set is made into a compound and the compound so formed is called @deva[द्वन्द्व]।
22030: The @deva[उपसर्जन] @ref[1.2.43] is to be placed first in a compound.
22031: The @deva[उपसर्जन] is to be put last in the words @deva[राजदन्त] etc.
22032: In a @deva[द्वन्द्व] compound, let a word called @deva[घि] @ref[1.4.7], stand first.
22033: In a @deva[द्वन्द्व] compound, let a what begins with a vowel and ends with a short @deva[अ] be placed first.
22034: In a @deva[द्वन्द्व] compound, that word-form which has fewer vowels, is to be placed first.
22035: A word with the seventh case-affix and an epithet are to be placed first in the @deva[बहुव्रीही] compound.
22036: What ends with a @deva[निष्ठा] @ref[1.1.26] shall stand first in a @deva[बहुव्रीही] compound.
22037: In the compounds @deva[अहिताग्नि] and the like, the @deva[निष्ठा]-formed word may optionally be placed first.
22038: The words @deva[कडाराः] and the like, are optionally placed first in the @deva[कर्मधार्य]।
23001: The word @deva[अनभिहिते] meaning 'not being specified' is to be understood as the governing word.
23002: When the object is not denoted by the termination of the verb i.e. when the verb does not agree with it, the 2nd case-affix is attached to the word.
23003: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Veda), the object of the verb @deva[हु] 'to sacrifice' takes the affix of the 3rd case and of the 2nd case as well.
23004: A word joined with (or governed by) the word @deva[अन्तरा] or @deva[अन्तरेण] takes the second case-affix.
23005: After a word denoting time, or length, the affix of the 2nd case is used, when denoting a full duration.
23006: The 3rd case-affix is used after the words denoting the duration of time or place, when the accomplishment of the desired object is meant to be expressed.
23007: A noun denoting time or place gets the affix of the 7th or the 5th case when the sense applied is that the time or space is the interval between one action and another (or implies an interval of time and space between @deva[कारक]-s.
23008: The 2nd case-affix is employed after a word which is joined with a @deva[कर्मप्रवचनीयाः] @ref[1.4.83].
23009: Where a word is governed by a @deva[कर्मप्रवचनीयाः] @ref[1.4.83] in the sense of 'more than' @deva[उपोऽधिके] @deva[च] @ref[1.4.87] or 'lord of' @deva[अधिरीश्वरे] @ref[1.4.97] there the 7th case-affix (locative) is used.
23010: The 5th case-affix (Ablative) is used when a word is governed by the following @deva[कर्मप्रवचनीयाः] @ref[1.4.83] i.e. @deva[अप] , @deva[आङ्] and @deva[परि]।
23011: The 5th case-affix (Ablative) is used after whatsoever is governed by a @deva[कर्मप्रवचनीयाः] @ref[1.4.83] in the sense of 'substitute' or 'exchange' -- @deva[प्रतिः] @deva[प्रतिनिधिप्रतिदानयोः] @ref[1.4.92].
23012: In the case of roots implying motion, the place which the motion is directed takes the affix of the 2nd (Accusative) or the 4th (Dative) case in denoting the 'object', when physical motion is meant and the object is not a word expressing 'road'.
23013: In denoting the @deva[सम्प्रदान-कारक] -- @deva[कर्मणा] @deva[यमभिप्रैति] @deva[स] @deva[सम्प्रदानम्] @ref[1.4.32], the 4th case-affix of the Dative is used after the noun.
23014: The 4th case-affix is employed in denoting the object (@deva[कर्म]) of that verb, which is suppressed (@deva[स्थानी]) in a sentence and which has in construction (@deva[उपपद]) there-with another verb, denoting an action, performed for the sake of the future action -- @deva[तुमुन्ण्वुलौ] @deva[क्रियायां] @deva[क्रियार्थायाम्]@ref[3.3.10]. In other words, when the sense of an infinitive of purpose formed by @deva[तुमुन्] and @deva[ण्वुल्] -- @ref[3.3.10], is suppressed in a sentence, the object of this infinitive is put in the Dative -- 4th case.
23015: The 4th case-affix is used after a crude-form which ends in an affix denoting 'condition' (abstract noun -- @deva[भाववचनाश्च] @ref[3.3.11]) and having the force of the affix @deva[तुम्] (or Infinitive or purpose).
23016: The 4th case-affix is used in conjunction with the words @deva[नमः] 'salutation', @deva[स्वस्ति] 'peace', @deva[स्वाहा] , @deva[स्वधा] (terms used in offering oblations to Gods and @deva[पित्रि]-s, respectively), @deva[अलम्] , 'a match for', 'sufficient for' and @deva[वषट्] , a term for oblation.
23017: In denoting the indirect object, which is not an animal, of the verb @deva[मन्य] 'to think', the Dative -- 4th case is optionally used, when contempt is to be shown.
23018: In denoting the agent -- @deva[स्वतन्त्रः] @deva[कर्ता] @ref[1.4.54], or the instrument -- @deva[साधकतमं] @deva[करणम्] @ref[1.4.42], the 3rd case is used.
23019: When the word @deva[सह] 'with', is joined to a word the latter takes the 3rd case, when the sense is that the word in the 3rd case is not the principal but the accompaniment of the principal thing.
23020: By whatsoever limb, being defective, is pointed out the defect of the person after that the 3rd case-affix is used.
23021: Any mark or attribute, by which is indicated the existence of a particular state or condition, is put in the 3rd case to express this relation.
23022: After the verb @deva[सम्-ज्ञः] , the 3rd case-affix is optionally used in denoting the object.
23023: When the word denotes 'cause' it takes the 3rd case-affix.
23024: A word implying 'debt', considered as a 'cause' but not as @deva[कर्तृ] or agent, takes the 5th case-affix.
23025: The 5th case-affix is used optionally when the noun expresses an attribute, being the cause of an action and not being of the feminine gender.
23026: The 6th-Case-affix is used after a noun implying the cause of an action, when the word @deva[हेतु] is used along with such a word.
23027: After a @deva[सर्वनामस्थान] -- @deva[सर्वादीनि] @deva[सर्वनामानि] @ref[1.1.27], when it signifies the cause of an action and the word @deva[हेतु] is used with it, the 3rd case-affix is used, as well as the 6th.
23028: When the @deva[अपादान] @deva[कारक] -- @deva[ध्रुवमपायेऽपादानम्] @ref[1.4.24], is denoted, the 5th case-affix is used.
23029: When a noun is joined with words meaning 'other than' or with @deva[आरात्] 'near or remote', or @deva[इतर] 'different from' or @deva[ऋते] 'without', or words indicative of 'directions' (used also with reference to the time corresponding to them) or with words having @deva[अञ्चु] 'to bend' as the last member of the compound and expressive of direction, or with words ending with the affix @deva[आच्] -- @deva[दक्षिणादाच्] @ref[5.3.36] or @deva[आहि] -- @deva[आहि] @deva[च] @deva[दूरे] @ref[5.3.37], the 5th case-affix is used.
23030: The 6th-Case-affix is used when used in connection with words ending with affixes having the sense of the affix @deva[अतसुच] -- @deva[दक्षिणोत्तराभ्यामतसुच्] @ref[5.3.28].
23031: With a word ending with the affix @deva[एनाप्] -- @deva[एनबन्यतरस्यामदूरेऽपञ्चम्याः] @ref[5.3.35], the 2nd case-affix is used, as well as the 6th.
23032: When joined with the words @deva[पृथक्] 'without', @deva[विना] 'without' and @deva[नाना] 'without', the 3rd case-affix is used, optionally (as well as the 5th and the 2nd).
23033: When expressing an instrument-@deva[कारक], optionally after the words @deva[स्तोक] 'little', @deva[अल्प] 'little', @deva[कृच्छ्र] 'difficulty' and @deva[कतिपय] 'some', the 5th case-affix is used, when they do not denote material objects.
23034: When in conjunction with words having the sense of @deva[दूर] 'distant' and @deva[अन्तिक] 'near', the 6th-Case-affix is optionally used.
23035: After the words @deva[दूर] 'distant' and @deva[अन्तिक] 'near', the 2nd case-affix is used as well as the 5th and the 3rd.
23036: The 7th case-affix is used when the sense is that of location -- @deva[आधारोऽधिकरणम्] @ref[1.4.45], as well as after the words meaning 'distant' and 'near'.
23037: By the action (@deva[भाव]) of whatsoever, the time of another action is indicated, that takes the 7th case-affix.
23038: The 6th-Case-affix is used (as well as the 7th), when disregard is to be shown after that by whose action the time of another action is indicated.
23039: The 6th and the 7th case-affixes are used after words when they are joined with @deva[स्वामिन्] 'master', @deva[ईश्वर] 'lord', @deva[अधिपति] 'ruler', @deva[दायाद] 'an heir', @deva[साक्षिन्] 'witness', @deva[प्रतिभू] 'a surety' and @deva[प्रसूत] 'begotten'.
23040: In conjunction with the words @deva[आयुक्त] 'engaged', and @deva[कुशल] 'skilful', when meaning entire absorption in an engagement, the 6th and the 7th case-affixes are used after a word.
23041: The 6th and the 7th case-affixes are used after those words from which specification is made, (as of an individual from the whole class).
23042: The 5th case-affix is used when the thing specified is different or divided from (and not included in) that from which specification is intended.
23043: In conjunction with the words @deva[साधु] 'good' and @deva[निपुण] 'skilful' when they denote respect, the 7th case-affix is used, provided that the word @deva[प्रति] is not used.
23044: In conjunction with the words @deva[प्रसिक्त] and @deva[उत्सुक] 'greatly desirous of', the 3rd case-affix is used after the word, as well as the 7th.
23045: When an affix declaring the time of an Asterism is elided by @deva[लुप्] -- @deva[लुबविशेषे] @ref[4.2.4], the 7th and the 3rd case-affixes are used after the word, whose affix is also elided.
23046: Where the sense is that of the Nominal-stem -- @deva[अर्थवदधातुरप्रत्ययः] @deva[प्रातिपदिकम्] @ref[1.2.45], or of gender only, or measure only or number only, the 1st case-affix is used.
23047: And when the sense is that of addressing, the 1st case-affix is used.
23048: The word ending with the 1st case-affix, in the sense of addressing, is called @deva[आमन्त्रित] or Vocative.
23049: In the case of Vocative, the singular number of the 1st case-affix is called @deva[स्मबुद्धि]।
23050: The 6th-Case-affix is used in the remaining cases, that is to say, where there is a sense, such as the relation between property and its owner etc. different from that of a word related to a verb and from that of a Nominal-stem.
23051: Of the verb @deva[ज्ञा] , when not used in the sense 'to know', the instrument takes the 6th-Case-affix.
23052: Of the verbs having the sense of 'remembering', (@deva[अधिक्]), and of @deva[दय] 'to give', 'to pity', 'to protect', 'to move' and of @deva[ईश] 'to rule or be master of', the object takes the 6th-Case-affix.
23053: The object of the verb @deva[कृ] takes the 6th-Case-affix, when it means 'to impart a new quality or virtue' -- @deva[गन्धनावक्षेपणसेवनसाहसिक्यप्रतियत्नप्रकथनोपयोगेषु] @deva[कृञः] @ref[1.3.32].
23054: The object of verbs having the sense of @deva[रुज्] 'to afflict', with the exception of the Causative verb @deva[ज्वरय] 'to be feverish', takes the 6th-Case-affix, when the verb expresses a condition (i.e. when the subject is an Abstract noun).
23055: Of the verb @deva[नाथ्] when meaning 'to bless', the object takes the 6th-Case-affix.
23056: The object of the verbs @deva[जासि] 'to strike', 'to hurt', @deva[हन्] 'to strike' preceded by @deva[नि] and @deva[ग्र] , @deva[नाट्] 'to injure', @deva[क्राथ] and @deva[पिष] when they mean 'to injure', takes the 6th-Case-affix.
23057: The object of the verbs @deva[व्यवहृ] and @deva[पण्] when they ae synonymous, that is when they mean 'dealing in sale and purchase transactions' or 'staking in gambling' takes the 6th-Case-affix.
23058: The object of the verb @deva[दिव्] when having the above-mentioned sense of 'dealing' or 'stalking', takes the 6th-Case.
23059: The object of the verb @deva[दिव्] when having the above-mentioned sense of 'dealing' or 'stalking', optionally takes the 6th-Case, when preceded by an @deva[उपसर्ग] (preposition).
23060: The object of the verb @deva[दिव्] when having the above-mentioned sense of 'dealing' or 'stalking', takes the 2nd case, in the @deva[ब्राह्मण] literature.
23061: The object of the verb @deva[प्रेष्य] and @deva[ब्रूहि] (imperative singular of @deva[दिवादि] verb, meaning 'send' and 'utter') denoting sacrificial food, takes the 6th-Case-affix, when making offerings to deity is meant or when deity is the recipient.
23062: In the @deva[छन्दस्] the 6th-Case-affix is used diversely with the force of the 4th case-affix.
23063: The 6th-Case-affix is diversely used in the @deva[छन्दस्] in denoting the instrument of the verb @deva[यज्] 'to sacrifice'.
23064: The 6th-Case-affix is used in denoting location (@deva[अधिकरण]) after a word denoting time (@deva[काल]) when used along with a word ending with an affix having the sense of @deva[कृत्वसुच्] -- @deva[संख्यायाः] @deva[क्रियाऽभ्यावृत्तिगणने] @deva[कृत्वसुच्] @ref[5.4.17] 'so many times'.
23065: The 6th-Case-affix is used after a word, in denoting the agent and the object, when used along with a word ending with a @deva[कृत्]-affix --@deva[कृदतिङ्] @ref[3.1.93].
23066: When the agent and the object of the action denoted by the words formed by @deva[कृत्]-affixes, are both used in a sentence, in the object only, the 6th-Case-affix is employed and not in the agent (the object is put in the Genitive 6th-Case and not the Agent).
23067: The past participle ending in @deva[क्त] when used in the sense of the present tense, -- @deva[ञीतः] @deva[क्तः] @ref[3.2.187] and -- @deva[मतिबुद्धिपूजार्थेभ्यश्च] @ref[3.2.188] , is used with the Genitive 6th-Case.
23068: The past participle ending in @deva[क्त] is used with the Genitive 6th-Case, when the former expresses location -- @deva[क्तोऽधिकरणे] @deva[च] @deva[ध्रौव्यगतिप्रत्यवसानार्थेभ्यः] @ref[3.4.76].
23069: The 6th-Case-affix is not used the express the agent or the object, when the word is governed by an Active Participle ending in the affix @deva[ल] , or @deva[उ] , or @deva[उक] or an indeclinable, or by a Past Participle in the @deva[क्त] and @deva[क्तवतु] or by a word ending in an affix having the sense of @deva[खल्] or by a Noun of agency formed by @deva[तृन्]।
23070: The 6th-Case-affix is not used when the word is governed by a verbal noun in @deva[अक] denoting futurity, or in a @deva[इन्] denoting 'futurity and indebtedness'.
23071: The 6th-Case-affix is optionally used in denoting the agent, (but not the object), when the word is governed by a Future Passive Participle (@deva[कृत्य]).
23072: The 3rd or the 6th-Case-affix may optionally be employed, when the word is joined with another word meaning 'like to or resemblance', excepting @deva[तुला] and @deva[उपना]।
23073: The 4th as well as the 6th-Case-affix may be used, when blessing is intended in connection with the words @deva[आयुष] 'long life', @deva[मद्र] 'joy', @deva[भद्र] 'good fortune', @deva[कुशल] 'welfare', @deva[सुख] 'happiness', @deva[अर्थ] 'prosperity' and @deva[हित] 'good'.
24001: All affixes after the verb @deva[गाङ्] 'to study' and the verb @deva[कुट्] 'to be crooked' and the rest, are as if they had an indicatory @deva[ङ्] (@deva[ङित्]), except those affixes which have an indicatory @deva[ञ्] (@deva[ञित्]) or @deva[ण्] (@deva[णित्]).
24002: An affix which begins with the augment @deva[इट्] -- @deva[आर्धधातुकस्येड्] @deva[वलादेः] @ref[7.2.35], is @deva[ङित्] after the root @deva[विज्] 'to fear, to move'.
24003: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound or words signifying persons belonging to the different Vedic-schools, when the sense is that of repetition is singular.
24004: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words denoting @deva[क्रतु] (sacrifices) ordained by @deva[यजुर्] (@deva[अध्वर्यु]) Veda, is singular, provided they are never used in the neuter gender
24005: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words denoting (persons who have studied) subjects, which in their order of study are not remote from each other, is singular.
24006: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words signifying @deva[जाति] (genus) which are not the names of living beings, is singular.
24007: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words of different genders, denoting names of rivers and countries, but not of towns, is singular.
24008: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words signifying small animals, is singular.
24009: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words signifying those animals only among whom there is permanent enmity i.e. natural and eternal antipathy or quarrel, is singular.
24010: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words denoting those classes of @deva[शुद्रा]-s who have not been expelled from the communion of higher classes, is singular.
24011: The word @deva[गवाश] and others are also @deva[द्वन्द] compounds which take the singular number.
24012: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words being the names of trees, wild animals, grass, corn, condiment, domestic beasts and birds and the compounds @deva[अश्व-वडव] , @deva[पूर्व-पर] and @deva[अधरोत्तर] , are optionally singular.
24013: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound of words of contrary significations, but not being the names of concrete substances.
24014: The @deva[द्वन्द] compounds like @deva[दधिपय] etc. are not singular.
24015: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound denoting a fixed number (@deva[एकत्व]) of concrete things (@deva[अधिकरण]) is not singular.
24016: A @deva[द्वन्द] compound denoting an approximate number of concrete substances, is optionally singular.
24017: It, namely the @deva[द्विगु] or @deva[द्वन्द] compound, with regard to which singular number has been ordained by the above rules, is always neuter gender.
24018: An @deva[अव्ययीभाव] -- @deva[अव्ययं] @deva[विभक्तिसमीपसमृद्धिव्यृद्ध्यर्थाभावात्ययासम्प्रतिशब्दप्रादुर्भावपश्चाद्यथाऽऽनुपूर्व्ययौगपद्यसादृश्यसम्पत्तिसाकल्यान्तवचनेषु] @ref[2.1.6], compound is also neuter gender.
24019: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound, with the exception of that which is formed by the particle @deva[नञ्] , and or the @deva[कर्मधारय] compound, becomes neuter gender, in the cases explained in the following sūtras.
24020: When denoting an appellative, a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the word @deva[कन्था] 'town', is neuter in gender, provided that it is the name of a town situated in a country of the @deva[उशीनर]-s.
24021: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the words @deva[उपज्ञा] 'invention' and @deva[उपक्रम] 'commencement' is neuter in gender, when it is intended to express the starting point of a work which is first invented or commenced.
24022: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the word @deva[छाया] 'shadow' in neuter in gender when the sense is that of profuseness of the thing indicated by the first term.
24023: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the word @deva[सभा] 'court' is neuter, provided that it is preceded by (a word synonymous with) the word @deva[राजा] or by a word denoting a non-human-being.
24024: A @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the word @deva[सभा] 'court', when it does not mean a house but means concourse, is neuter.
