24026: The gender of @deva[द्वन्द] compound or @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound is like that of the last word in it.
24027: The gender of the compound of the word @deva[अश्व] 'horse' and @deva[वडव] 'a mare', is like that of the first word in it.
24028: Of the compounds @deva[हेमन्त-शिशिरौ] and @deva[अहोरात्रे] , the gender is like that of the first word, in the @deva[छन्दस्] ।
24029: The @deva[द्वन्द] and @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound ending with the words @deva[रात्र] and @deva[अह्न] are spoken of in masculine.
24030: The @deva[तत्-पुरुष] word @deva[अपथम्] 'a bad road', is neuter.
24031: The words @deva[अर्धर्च] etc. are spoken of in masculine and neuter.
24032: In the room of @deva[इदम्] 'this', in the case of its re-employment in a subsequent member of the same sentence and referring to the same thing (@deva[अन्वादेश]) there is the substitution of @deva[अश्] which is @deva[अनुदात्त] (gravely accented), when the Instrumental -3rd case-affix and the rest follow.
24033: In the room of @deva[एतद्] in the case of re-employment there is the substitution of the gravely accented @deva[अश्] when the affixes @deva[त्र] -- @deva[सप्तम्यास्त्रल्] @ref[5.3.10] and @deva[तस्] -- @deva[पञ्चम्यास्तसिल्] @ref[5.3.7] follow, and the affixes @deva[त्र] and @deva[तद्] are @deva[अनुदात्त] (gravely accented) also.
24034: When an affix of the Accusative -2nd case or @deva[टा] - Instrumental -3rd case singular or @deva[ओश्] Locative -7th-case dual follows, @deva[एन्] which is @deva[अनुदात्त] is the substitute of @deva[इदम्] and its re-employment.
24035: The clause 'when the affix is @deva[आर्धधातुक] is understood in the following sūtras up to sūtra @ref[2.4.58].
24036: The word @deva[जग्धि] is the substitute of @deva[अद्] 'to eat', when the affix @deva[ल्यप्] -- @deva[समासेऽनञ्पूर्वे] @deva[क्त्वो] @deva[ल्यप्] @ref[7.1.37] or an @deva[आर्धधातुक] @deva[कित्] affix beginning with a @deva[त] follows.
24037: When @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) or @deva[सन्] (Desiderative) follows @deva[घसॢ] is the substitute of @deva[अद्] 'to eat'.
24038: And when the affix @deva[घञ्] and @deva[अप्] follow @deva[घसॢ] is the substitute of @deva[अद्]।
24039: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), @deva[घसॢ] is diversely substituted for @deva[अद्]।
24040: When @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows @deva[घसॢ] is optionally the substitute of @deva[अद्]।
24041: When @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows, @deva[वयि] is optionally the substitute follows of @deva[वेञ्] 'to weave'.
24042: @deva[बध्] is the substitute of @deva[हन्] 'to kill' when the @deva[आर्धधातुक] @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) follows.
24043: And when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows @deva[वध] is the substitute of @deva[हन्]।
24044: When @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes follow, @deva[वध्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[हन्] in the @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist).
24045: @deva[गा] is the substitute of the root @deva[इण्] when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows.
24046: When the affix @deva[णि] (causal follows, @deva[गामि] is the substitute of @deva[इण्] when the sense is not that of 'informing' but that of 'going'.
24047: And when @deva[सन्] (Desiderative) follows, @deva[गमि] is the substitute of @deva[ण्] when the sense is not that of 'informing'.
24048: And of @deva[इङ्] 'to study', @deva[गमि] is the substitute when @deva[सन्] follows.
24049: @deva[गाम्] is the substitute of @deva[इङ्] when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows.
24050: @deva[गाङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[इङ्] when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) and @deva[ऌङ्] (Conditional Future) follow.
24051: @deva[गाङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[इङ्] is the causative @deva[णि] , when that causative takes the affix @deva[सन्] (Desiderative) and @deva[चन्] (Aorist).
24052: @deva[भू] is the substitute of the verb @deva[अस्] 'to be' when an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix is to be applied.
24053: @deva[वचि] is the substitute of @deva[ब्रू] 'to speak' when any @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix is to be supplied.
24054: @deva[ख्याञ्] is the substitute of @deva[चक्षिङ्] 'to perceive, to tell', when any @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix is to be applied.
24055: @deva[ख्याञ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[चक्षिङ्] when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows.
24056: @deva[वी] is the substitute of the verb @deva[अज्] 'to drive', 'to lead', when an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix follows, with the exception of the affixes @deva[घञ्] -- @deva[भावे] @ref[3.3.18] and @deva[अप्] -- @deva[समुदोरजः] @deva[पशुषु] @ref[3.3.69].
24057: @deva[वी] is optionally the substitute of @deva[अज्] when the affix -- @deva[अनद्यतने] @deva[लुट्] @ref[3.3.15] etc. follows.
24058: After a word ending with the @deva[गोत्र] affix @deva[ण्य] -- @deva[कुर्वादिभ्यो] @deva[ण्यः] @ref[4.1.151] and after a @deva[गोत्र] word denoting the descendant of a @deva[क्षत्रिय] or a @deva[ऋषि] 'seer' and after a word ending with a @deva[गोत्र] affix having an indicatory @deva[ञ्] , the affix @deva[ञ्] , the affix @deva[अण्] and @deva[इञ्] employed in the forming @deva[युवन्] -- @deva[जीवति] @deva[तु] @deva[वंश्ये] @deva[युवा] @ref[4.1.163], descendants, are elided by the substitution of @deva[लुक्]।
24059: And after the words @deva[पैल] etc. there is the @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[युवन्] affix.
24060: After a word ending in the @deva[गोत्र] affix -- @ref[4.1.95], there is elision of @deva[लुक्] of the @deva[युवन्] affix, when the @deva[गोत्र] of the people called @deva[प्राच्य] 'Eastern' is denoted.
24061: After the words @deva[तौल्वलि] and the rest, there is no @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[युवन्] affix.
24062: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of @deva[तद्राज] -- @deva[ते] @deva[तद्राजाः] @ref[4.1.174], affix, when the word is used in the plural number, provided that the plural number is taken by the base itself and not by its standing as a compound epithet dependent upon another word and provided that the base is not used in the feminine.
24063: After the word @deva[यस्क] etc. there is the @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix when the word of itself and not as part of a compound epithet dependent on another word, takes the plural; but not in the feminine.
24064: And there is @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix @deva[यञ्] -- @deva[गर्गादिभ्यो] @deva[यञ्] @ref[4.1.105] and @deva[अञ्] -- @deva[अनृष्यानन्तर्ये] @deva[बिदादिभ्योऽञ्] @ref[4.1.104], when the word of itself and not as part of a compound epithet dependent on another, takes the plural, but not in the feminine.
24065: After the words @deva[अत्रि] , @deva[भृगु] , @deva[कुत्स] , @deva[वशिष्ठ] , @deva[गोतम] , @deva[अङ्गिरस] , there is elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix, when the word takes the plural, but not in the feminine.
24066: And there is @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix @deva[इञ्] -- @deva[गोत्राद्यून्यस्त्रियाम्] @ref[4.1.95] after a word containing many vowels (a poly-syllabic word) which denotes the @deva[गोत्र] of the people called @deva[प्राच्य] and @deva[भरत] when the word takes the plural.
24067: After the words @deva[गोपवन] etc. there is not @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix, when the word takes the plural.
24068: After the words @deva[तिक] , @deva[कितब] etc. when used as @deva[द्वन्द] compound, there is the @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affixes when the compound word takes the plural.
24069: After the words @deva[उपक] etc. there is optionally @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affix when the words take the plural whether they enter into @deva[द्वन्द] compound or are used separately.
24070: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[गोत्र] affixes @deva[अण्] and @deva[यञ्] of the words @deva[अगस्त्य] , and @deva[कौणडिन्य] , when they take the plural and the words @deva[अगस्ति] and @deva[कण्डिनच्] are the substitutes of the bases so remaining after the elision.
24071: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of the case-affix of a word when it gets the name of @deva[धातु] 'root' or is of a crude form.
24072: After the verb @deva[अद्] 'to eat' and the rest there is @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[विकरण] @deva[शप्] -- @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[शप्] @ref[3.1.68].
24073: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) there is diversely the @deva[लुक्] elision of the @deva[विकरण] @deva[शप्] -- @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[शप्] @ref[3.1.68].
24074: And there is diversely the @deva[लुक्] elision of @deva[यङ्] -- @deva[धातोरेकाचो] @deva[हलादेः] @deva[क्रियासमभिहारे] @deva[यङ्] @ref[3.1.22], when the affix @deva[अच्] -- @deva[नन्दिग्रहिपचादिभ्यो] @deva[ल्युणिन्यचः] @ref[3.1.134], follows.
24075: After the verbs @deva[हू] 'to sacrifice' and others there is @deva[श्लु] elision of the @deva[विकरण] @deva[शप्] -- @deva[कर्तरि] @deva[शप्] @ref[3.1.68].
24076: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) there is elision of the @deva[शप्] diversely.
24077: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of the affix @deva[सिच्] -- @deva[च्लेः] @deva[सिच्] @ref[3.1.44] in the @deva[परस्मैपद] after the verbs @deva[गा] 'to go', @deva[स्था] 'to stand', the verbs called @deva[घु] @deva[मृषस्तितिक्षायाम्] @ref[1.2.20], @deva[पा] 'to drink' and @deva[भू] 'to be'.
24078: After the verbs @deva[घ्रा] 'to smell', @deva[धेट्] 'to drink', @deva[शा] (@deva[शो]) 'to pare' @deva[छा] (@deva[छो]) 'to cut' and @deva[सा] (@deva[सो]) 'to destroy' there is optionally the elision of @deva[सिच्] when the @deva[परस्मैपद] terminations are used.
24079: After the verbs @deva[तन्] 'to expand' and others there is optionally the @deva[लुक्] elision of @deva[सिच्] when the @deva[आत्मनेपद] affixes @deva[त] and @deva[थास्] of the 2nd Person follow.
24080: In the @deva[मन्त्र] portion of the Vedas there is @deva[लुक्] elision of the sign of the Aorist (& @deva[लिट्] -Perfect Tense) after the verbs @deva[घस्] 'to eat', @deva[हूर्] 'to be crooked', @deva[णश्] 'to destroy', @deva[वृ] 'to choose, to cover', @deva[दह्] 'to burn', verbs ending in long @deva[आ] , @deva[वृच्] 'to avoid', @deva[कृ] 'to make', @deva[गमि] 'to go' and @deva[जनि] 'to be produced'.
24081: There is @deva[लुक्] elision in the room of that tense-affix (@deva[लि]) which comes after @deva[आम्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense).
24082: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of @deva[आप्] (the feminine termination) and @deva[सुप्] (the case-affixes) after an @deva[अव्यय] or indeclinable.
24083: There is not @deva[लुक्] elision of the case-affix after an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] compound that ends in @deva[आ] ; @deva[आम्] is the substitute of its case-affix es, but not when it is the 5th case-affix.
24084: The change to @deva[अम्] of the Instrumental -3rd case and Locative -7th-case-affixes coming after an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] compound that ends in @deva[अ] , occurs diversely.
24085: @deva[डा] , @deva[रौ] and @deva[रस्] are substituted respectively in the room of the three-affixes of the 3rd Person of @deva[लुट्] (First Future), both in the @deva[परस्मैपद] and @deva[आत्मनेपद]।
31003: That which is called an affix has an acute accent on its first syllable.
31004: The case-affix es (@deva[सुप्]) and the affixes having an indicatory @deva[प] (@deva[पित्]) are @deva[अनुदात्त]।
31005: After the verbs @deva[गुप्] , @deva[तिज्] and @deva[कित्] comes the affix @deva[सन्]।
31006: The affix @deva[सन्] comes after the verbs @deva[मान] 'to honour', @deva[बध्] 'to bind', @deva[दान्] 'to cut', and @deva[शान्] 'to whet', and long @deva[ई] is the substitute of @deva[इ] -- @deva[सन्यतः] @ref[7.4.79] of the re-duplicate -- @deva[पूर्वोऽभ्यासः] @ref[6.1.4] syllable.
31007: The affix is optionally attached, in the sense of 'wishing' after a root expressing the object wished and having the same agent of the action as the wisher thereof.
31008: The affix @deva[क्यच्] is optionally employed, in the sense of wishing after a word ending in a case-affix expressing the object wished as connected with the wisher itself.
31009: And the affix @deva[काम्यच्] is also used in the sense of 'wishing' after a word ending in a case-affix, expressing the object wished as connected with the wisher's self.
31010: The affix @deva[क्यच्] is optionally employed, in the sense of treatment after a word ending in a case-affix denoting the object of comparison.
31011: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] is optionally used in the sense of 'behaving' after a word ending in a case-affix denoting the object of comparison of the agent and there is @deva[लोप] (elision) of the final @deva[स] of the noun if it ends in a @deva[स]।
31012: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] in the sense of becoming what the thing previously was not, is used after the crude forms @deva[भृश्] etc. which do not end with the affix @deva[च्वि] -- @deva[अभूततद्भावे] @deva[कृभ्वस्तियोगे] @deva[सम्पद्यकर्तरि] @deva[च्विः] @ref[5.4.50], and there is @deva[लोप] (elision) of the final consonant of these words, if they end in a consonant.
31013: The affix @deva[क्यष्] in the sense of becoming what the thing previously was not, is used after the words @deva[लोहित] etc. and after those that end with the affix @deva[डाच्] -- @deva[अव्यक्तानुकरणाद्द्व्यजवरार्धादनितौ] @deva[डाच्] @ref[5.4.57], when these words do not take the affix @deva[च्वि] -- @deva[अव्यक्तानुकरणाद्द्व्यजवरार्धादनितौ] @deva[डाच्] @ref[5.4.57].
31014: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] in the sense of exerting in the dishonesty, is employed after the word @deva[कष्ट] 'mischief' when the latter has the 4th case-affix in construction.
31015: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] is used after the words @deva[रोमन्य] 'ruminating' and @deva[तपस] 'austerity', when they are used as the objects of the action of repeating and performing respectively.
31016: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] is used in the sense of ejecting after the words @deva[वाष्प] 'vapour' and @deva[ऊष्म] 'heat' as the object of the action.
31017: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] , in the sense of 'making', comes after these words, as the object of the action, viz. @deva[शब्द] 'sound', @deva[वैर] 'hostility', @deva[कलह] 'strife', @deva[अभ्र] 'cloud', @deva[कण्व] 'sin' and @deva[मेध] 'cloud'.
31018: The affix @deva[क्यङ्] in the sense of 'feeling', comes after the words @deva[सुख] 'pleasure' etc. when the pleasure etc. belong to the agent as feels thereof.
31019: The affix in the sense of 'making', comes after these words, as the object of the action, viz. @deva[नमस्] 'adoration', @deva[वरिवस्] 'honour', @deva[चित्र] 'wonder'.
31020: The affix @deva[णिङ्] , in the sense of making, comes after these words as the object of the action, viz. @deva[पुच्छ] 'tail', @deva[भाण्ड] 'pot' and @deva[चीवर] 'rag'.
31021: The affix @deva[णिच्] , in the sense of 'making' comes after these words as the object of action viz. @deva[मुण्ड] 'shaving', @deva[मिश्र] 'mixture', @deva[श्लक्ष्ण] 'soft', @deva[लवण] 'salt', @deva[व्रत] 'vow', @deva[वस्त्र] 'dress', @deva[हल] 'plough', @deva[कल] 'strife', @deva[कृत] 'done' and @deva[तूस्त] 'matter hair'.
31022: The affix @deva[वङ्] , in the sense of repetition of the act, comes after a root, having a single vowel and beginning with a consonant.
31023: The affix @deva[वङ्] invariably comes in the sense of 'crookedness' after a simple verb expressing motion.
31024: The affix @deva[वङ्] when it is intended to convey the sense of contempt (@deva[गर्हा]) in respect of the sense of the root (@deva[भाव]) comes always after the following roots - @deva[लुप्] 'to cut off', @deva[सद्] 'to sit', @deva[चर्] 'to walk', @deva[जप्] 'to mutter silently any sacred formula', @deva[जभ] 'to gape or yawn', @deva[दह्] 'to burn', @deva[दश्] 'to bite' and @deva[गृ] 'to swallow'.
31025: The affix @deva[णिच्] is used after these words - @deva[सत्य] 'truth' (which then takes the form of @deva[सत्याप] as exhibited in the sūtra), @deva[पाश] 'a fetter', @deva[रूप] 'form', @deva[वीणा] 'a lute', @deva[तूल] 'cotton', @deva[श्लोक] 'celebration', @deva[सेना] 'army', @deva[लोम] 'the hair of the body', @deva[त्वच] 'skin', @deva[वर्म] 'mail', @deva[वर्ण] 'celebration', @deva[चूर्ण] 'powder' and the verb of the @deva[चुरादि] class.
31026: The affix @deva[णिच्] is used after a root, when the operation of a causer is to be expressed.
31027: The affix @deva[यक्] is used after the roots @deva[कण्डु] 'to itch' etc.
31028: The affix @deva[आय] comes after @deva[गुपू] 'to protect', @deva[धूप] 'to heat', @deva[विच्छ] 'to approach', @deva[पण] 'to contract or praise' and @deva[पन] 'to praise'.
31029: The affix @deva[ईयङ्] comes after the sūtra root @deva[ऋति] 'to reproach'.
31030: The affix @deva[णिङ्] comes after the root @deva[कम] 'to desire'.
31031: The affixes @deva[आय] and those that follow it i.e. @deva[आय] , @deva[ईयङ्] and @deva[णिङ्] are optionally added, when it is desired to express one's self with an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix.
31032: All the roots ending with the affixes @deva[सन्] and others are called @deva[धातु] ।
31033: When @deva[ऌ] and @deva[लुट्] follow, then @deva[स्य] and @deva[तासि] are respectively the affixes of a verbal root
31034: @deva[सिप्] is diversely the affix of a verbal root when @deva[लेट्] follows.
31035: @deva[आम्] is the affix of the verb @deva[कास्] 'to cough' and of those roots that are formed by affixes i.e. the derivative verbs, when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows, in the @deva[मन्त्र]।
31036: The affix @deva[आम्] is used when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows after a root beginning with a letter of @deva[इच्] @deva[प्रत्यहार] and having a heavy vowel, excepting the root @deva[ऋच्छ] 'to go'.
31037: After the words @deva[दय] 'to give', 'to go' and 'to protect', @deva[अय] 'to go' and @deva[आस] 'to sit', there is the affix @deva[आम्] when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows.
31038: The affix @deva[आम्] is optionally used after these - @deva[उष्] 'to burn', @deva[विद्] 'to know' and @deva[जागृ] 'to wake', when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows.
31039: @deva[आम्] is optionally affixed when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows after these verbs - @deva[भी] 'to fear', @deva[ह्री] 'to be ashamed', @deva[भृ] 'to nourish', @deva[हु] 'to sacrifice' and when @deva[आम्] is affixed, the effect is as if there were @deva[श्लु] elision and the roots belonged to @deva[ह्वादि] class.
31040: After a verb which ends with @deva[आम्] , the verb @deva[कृ] 'to do', is annexed when @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) follows.
31041: The form @deva[विदाङ्कुर्वन्तु] is optionally employed as an irregular form.
31042: The forms @deva[अभ्युत्सादयामकः] @deva[प्रजनयामकः] @deva[चिकयामकः] @deva[रमयामकः] @deva[पावयांक्रियाद्] @deva[विदामक्रन्] are irregularly formed in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
31043: When @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows, the affix @deva[च्लि] is added to the verbal root.
31045: After a verb that ends in a @deva[शल] consonant and has an @deva[इक्] vowel for its penultimate letter and does not take @deva[इट्] -- @deva[एकाच] @deva[उपदेशेऽनुदात्तात्] @ref[7.2.10], @deva[क्स] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि]।
31046: @deva[क्स] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] after the verb @deva[श्लिष] , when used in the sense of 'embracing'.
31047: @deva[क्स] is not the substitute of @deva[च्लि] after the verb @deva[दृश्] 'to see'.
31048: After a root which ends in the @deva[णि] -- @deva[पुच्छभाण्डचीवराण्णिङ्] @ref[3.1.20], -- @deva[मुण्डमिश्रश्लक्ष्णलवणव्रतवस्त्रहलकलकृततूस्तेभ्यो] @deva[णिच्] @ref[3.1.21], -- @deva[च्लेः] @deva[सिच्] @ref[3.1.44] etc. and after the verb @deva[श्रि] 'to serve', @deva[द्रु] 'to run', and @deva[स्रु] 'to drop', @deva[चङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] , when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows signifying an agent.
31049: After the roots @deva[धे] 'to suck' and @deva[श्वि] 'to grow', @deva[चङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[च्लि] , when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows signifying an agent.
31050: After the verb @deva[गुप्] 'to protect', @deva[चङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[च्लि] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
31051: After the causatives of the verbs @deva[ऊन] 'to decrease', @deva[ध्वन] 'to sound', @deva[इल्] 'to send' and @deva[अर्द] 'to go or to beg' @deva[चङ्] is not the substitute of @deva[च्लि] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
31052: After the verbs @deva[अस्] 'to throw', @deva[वच्] 'to speak' and @deva[ख्या] 'to speak', @deva[अङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] , when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows signifying an agent.
31053: After the verbs @deva[लिप्] 'to paint', @deva[सिच्] 'to sprinkle' and @deva[ह्वे] 'to call', @deva[अङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] when @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) follows signifying the agent.
31054: After the verbs @deva[लिप्] , @deva[सिच्] and @deva[ह्वे] @deva[अङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[च्लि] when the affixes of the @deva[आत्मनेपद] follow.
31055: @deva[अङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] after the verbs @deva[पुष्] 'to nourish' and the rest; @deva[द्युत्] 'to shine' and the rest; and the verbs having an indicatory @deva[ऌ] , when the affixes of the @deva[परस्मैपद] follow.
31056: After the words @deva[सृ] 'to go', @deva[शास्] 'to order' and @deva[ऋ] 'to go', @deva[अङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] in the @deva[परस्मैपद] as well as the @deva[आत्मनेपद] ।
31057: @deva[अङ्] is optionally the substitute of @deva[च्लि] after that root which has an indicatory @deva[इर्] , when the @deva[परस्मैपद] terminations are used.
31058: And, optionally @deva[अङ्] is the substitute of @deva[च्लि] after the verbs @deva[जॄ] 'to stiffen', @deva[स्रुच्] & @deva[स्लुच्] 'to go', @deva[मुच्] & @deva[ग्लुच्] 'to steal', @deva[ग्लुञ्च्] 'to go' and @deva[श्वि] 'to grow' when the terminations of the @deva[परस्मैपद] are used.

32033: The affix @deva[खश्] comes after the verb @deva[पच्] 'to cook' when the object in composition with it denotes a measure.

32035: The affix @deva[खश्] comes after the verb @deva[तुद्] 'to strike' when @deva[विधु] 'the moon' or @deva[अरुस्] 'a wound' is the word in composition with it as object.

32039: The affix @deva[खच्] comes after the verb @deva[ताप्] 'to heat' when @deva[द्विषत्] or @deva[पर] is the word in composition with it as an object.
32040: The affix @deva[खच्] comes after the verb @deva[यस्] 'to curb' when the word @deva[वाक्] 'speech' is in composition with it as an object and the sense indicated is that of a vow.
32041: The affix @deva[खच्] comes after the verb @deva[दारि] 'to split' and @deva[सह्] 'to bear' when respectively in composition with the words @deva[पुर्] 'a city' and @deva[सर्व] 'all', as objects.

32047: And the affix @deva[खच्] comes after the verb @deva[गम्] 'to go' when in composition with a word ending in a case-affix and when the word to be formed denotes a name.
32048: And the affix @deva[खच्] comes after the verb @deva[गम्] 'to go' when in composition with the verbs - 1. @deva[अन्त] 'end' 2. @deva[अत्यन्त] 'extreme' 3. @deva[अध्वम्] 'road' 4. @deva[दूर] 'far' 5. @deva[पार] 'across' 6. @deva[सर्व] 'all' 7. @deva[अनन्त] 'endless'.

32051: The affix @deva[णिनि] comes after the verb @deva[हन्] 'to kill' when the word in composition with it is @deva[कुमार] 'a child' or @deva[शीर्ष] 'head'.
32052: The affix @deva[टक्] comes after the verb @deva[हन्] 'to kill' when it is in composition with the word @deva[जाया] 'wife' or @deva[पति] 'husband' as object and when the word so formed denotes the agent possessed of that attribute (or when the word so formed denotes a mark).
32053: The affix @deva[टक्] comes after the verb @deva[हन्] 'to kill' when the object is in composition with it and when the word to be formed denotes an agent other than a human being.

32055: The word @deva[पाणिघ] and @deva[ताडघ] are irregularly formed when denoting an artificier.
32056: The affix @deva[ख्युन्] , when in the sense of the word to be formed is that of an instrumental agent, comes after the verb @deva[कृ] 'to make', when the following words are in composition with it - 1. @deva[आढ्य] 'rich' 2. @deva[सुभग] 'fortunate' 3. @deva[स्थूल] 'big' 4. @deva[पलित] 'grey' 5. @deva[नग्न] 'naked' 6. @deva[अन्ध] 'blind' 7. @deva[प्रिय] 'pleasant', provided these words formed by the affix @deva[च्वि] though not actually ending in the affix @deva[च्वि]।
32057: The affixes @deva[खिष्णुच्] and @deva[खकञ्] , when the word to be formed denotes an agent comes after the verb @deva[भू] 'to become', when it is in composition with the words formed by the affix @deva[च्वि] though not actually ending in the affix @deva[च्वि]।

32059: The words - 1. @deva[ऋत्विक्] 'a domestic priest' 2. @deva[दधृक्] 'impudent' 3. @deva[स्रक्] 'a garland' 4. @deva[दिक्] 'direction' and 5. @deva[उष्णिक्] 'a quatrain', are irregularly formed by adding the affix @deva[क्विन्] and also after the verbs 6. @deva[अञ्चु] 'to worship' 7. @deva[युजि] 'to join' 8. @deva[क्रुञ्चु] 'to approach', the affix @deva[क्विन्] is used.

32064: The affix @deva[णिव] after the verb @deva[वह्] 'to carry' in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), when the word ending in case-affix is in composition with it.

32074: The affixes @deva[मनिन्] (@deva[मन्]), @deva[वनिप्] (@deva[वन्]), @deva[विनय] (@deva[वन्]) and @deva[विच्] come in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) after the verbs which end in long @deva[आ] , when used in a case-inflected word or @deva[उपसर्ग] in in composition.
32075: These affixes i.e. - @deva[मनिन्] (@deva[मन्]), @deva[वनिप्] (@deva[वन्]), @deva[विनय] (@deva[वन्]) and @deva[विच्] are seen after other verbs also besides those ending in long @deva[आ]।

32083: And the affix @deva[णिनि] comes after the verb @deva[मन्] 'to think' when the word in composition with it is a word with a case-affix and when it is used to signify thought, whereof the object is self (the sense of the affix being 'thinking himself as such').

32091: The affix @deva[क्विप्]comes after the verb @deva[चि] 'to collect' with the sense of past time, when the word @deva[अग्नि] , in the Accusative -2nd case, is in composition.
32092: In expressing an object the affix @deva[क्विप्]comes after the verb @deva[चि] 'to collect' with the sense of past time when in composition with a word in the Accusative -2nd case, provided the word so formed is the name of fire.
32093: The affix @deva[इनि] comes after the compound verb @deva[विकृ] 'to sell' in the sense of past time, when in composition with a word in the Accusative -2nd case.
32094: The affix @deva[क्वनिप्] comes after the verb @deva[दृश्] 'to see' in the sense of past time, when in composition with a word in the Accusative -2nd case.

32096: The affix @deva[क्वनिप्] comes after the verbs @deva[युध] 'to fight' and @deva[कृ] 'to make' with a past signification when the word @deva[सह] 'with', is in composition.
32097: The affix @deva[ड] comes after the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be produced', with a past signification, when the word, in composition with it is in the Locative -7th-case.
32098: The affix @deva[ड] comes after the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be produced', with a past signification, when the word, in composition with it is in the Ablative -5th case, which does not denote a genus.
32099: The affix @deva[ड] comes after the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be produced', with a past signification, when an @deva[उपसर्ग] is in composition and when the sense is simply appellative.
32100: The affix @deva[ड] comes after the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be produced', with a past signification, when the root takes the preposition @deva[अनु] and is compounded with a word in the Accusative -2nd case.
32101: The affix @deva[ड] is seen to come after the verb @deva[जन्] 'to be produced', with a past signification,though it be in composition with other nouns, having cases other than those mentioned in the previous sūtras.
32102: The affixes called @deva[निष्ठा] come after a verbal root used in the sense of past time.
32103: The affix @deva[ङ्वनिप्] comes after the verbs @deva[सु] 'to press out or extract juice' and @deva[यज्] 'to sacrifice', with a past signification.
32104: The affix @deva[अतृन्] comes after the verb @deva[जृ] 'to grow old' with the sense of past time.
32105: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the affix @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) comes after a verb with a past signification.
32106: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the affix @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) is optionally replaced by the affix @deva[कानच्]।
32107: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) the affix @deva[क्वसु] is optionally the substitute for @deva[लिट्] ।
32108: In modern Sanskrit the affix @deva[क्वसु] optionally replaces @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) after the verbs @deva[सद्] , @deva[वस्] and @deva[श्रु] with a past signification.
32110: The affix @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) comes after the verb in the sense of past time.
32111: The affix @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) comes after a verbal root used in the sense of past before the commencement of the current day.
32112: When a word implying 'recollection' is in connection with it, a verb takes the affix @deva[लृट्] (2nd Future) in the sense of the past before the commencement of the present day.
32113: The affix @deva[लृट्] (2nd Future) is not applied in the sense of the past when the @deva[उपपद] denoting recollection has in connection with it the particle @deva[यत्]।
32114: The affix @deva[लृट्] (2nd Future) is optionally applied in the sense of the past, when a word implying 'recollection' is in connection with it and whether such a word has the particle @deva[यत्] or is used simply; provided that the two verbs, occurring in the same complex sentence, are also connected together, that each is necessary to the other , to complete the sense of the speaker.
32115: The affix @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) comes after the verb in the sense of the past before the commencement of the current day and unperceived by the narrator.

33008: The affix @deva[लट्] (Present Tense) is optionally used with the force of futurity after that root, which is in a conditional sentence, is the condition precedent for the action indicated by another verb having the sense of the imperative mood.
33009: The @deva[लट्] (Present Tense) or the @deva[लिङ्] (Potential) is used under similar conditions in denoting futurity, when the future time is future by a @deva[मूहूर्त] (= 48 minutes).

33149: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes in all tenses when the words @deva[यच्च] and @deva[यत्र] are in composition with it, provided that censure is implied.
33150: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes in all tenses when used with the words @deva[यच्च] and @deva[यत्र] and the sense implied is that of 'wonder'.
33151: In all the cases when 'wonder' is implied by word other than @deva[यच्च] and @deva[यत्र] , the affix @deva[लृट्] (I Future) is used after a root, except when the word @deva[यदि] is used.
33152: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes after a verb in all tenses when the words @deva[उत] and @deva[अपि] , both having the same meaning, are in composition.
33153: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes after a root, in expressing or making known of a wish, except when the word @deva[कच्चित्] is in composition with it.
33154: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) is used after a root, when the expectation (of a person or thing being able or competent to do or suffer the action denoted by the verb is implied (or expressed by any other word used along with them) than 'alarm'.
33155: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) is optionally used after a verb when it has another verb which expresses 'expectation' in construction with it, but not so when the word @deva[यत्] is used.
33156: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) is optionally used after those verbs which express the condition and its consequence.
33157: The affixes @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) and @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) are used after a root when another verb having the same sense of 'wishing' is in construction with it.
33158: The affix @deva[तुमुन्] comes after a verb when another verb meaning 'to wish' is in construction, provided that the agent of both the verbs is the same.
33159: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) is used after a verb when the verbs meaning 'to wish' are in construction with it and the agent of both the verbs is the same.
33160: After roots meaning 'to wish' the @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) is optionally used denoting the present time.
33161: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes after a verb when the agent either 1. commands 2. invites 3. permits 4. politely expresses a wish 6. asks questions or 7. prays.
33162: The affix @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) is used after a root in the sense of commanding etc.
33163: The affixes called @deva[कृत्य] and the affix @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) come also after verbs, in the sense of direction, granting permission and proper (particular) time.
33164: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) (as well as @deva[कृत्य] and @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) ) is used (under similar circumstances in the sense of 1. direction 2. permission etc.) when the time is future by a @deva[मुहूर्त] (48 minutes or an Indian hour); (or the Potential may be used as well when it signifies 'at this very moment').
33165: The affix @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) comes after a verb when the word @deva[स्म] is in composition (when the sense is that of 'direction', permission etc.) and referring to time by a @deva[मुहूर्त] (48 minutes or an Indian hour).
33166: And when 'wish' is meant ( the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) may be used when the word @deva[स्म] is in composition with the verb.
33167: The affix @deva[तुमुन्] comes after a root when the words 1. @deva[काल] 2. @deva[समय] 3. @deva[वेला] (all meaning time) are in composition.
33168: The affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) comes after a root when the word @deva[यद्] is in composition and the words 1. @deva[काल] 2. @deva[समय] 3. @deva[वेला] occur in construction.
33169: The affixes @deva[कृत्य] and the affix @deva[तृच] are added to a root when fitness as regards the agent is implied (as well as in the affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) ).
33170: The affix @deva[णिनि] is added to the root in denoting agent, showing that there is some 'necessity' or 'indebtedness' or 'obligation' on the part of the agent in connection with the action denoted by the verb.
33171: The affixes called @deva[कृत्य] also come after a root when the sense to be indicated is that of 'necessity' or 'obligation'.
33172: And the affix @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) as well as the @deva[कृत्य] affixes come after a verb when the sense is that of 'capability'.
33173: The affixes @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) and @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) come after a verb by which 'benediction' is intended.
33174: The affixes @deva[क्तिच्] and @deva[क्त] are used after a root when benediction is intended, provided that the whole word so formed is an appellative.
33175: The affixes @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) comes after a verb when the word @deva[माण्] is used in connection with it.
33176: When the word @deva[मान] is followed by @deva[स्म] the affix @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense) as well as @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) may be used after a verbal root.
34001: When there is a syntactical relation between the senses of the verbs, the affixes are valid, even in denoting time other than that for which they have been specifically enjoined.
34002: When the (frequency of) repetition of an action is indicated, the affix @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) is added to the root and the verb is repeated. And the affixes @deva[हि] and @deva[स्व] or the affixes @deva[त] and @deva[ध्वम्] are the substitutes of @deva[लोट्] (Imperative).
34003: The affix @deva[लोट्] (Imperative) is similarly added to the root optionally when several themes follow one after another.
34004: In the first case -- @deva[क्रियासमभिहारे] @deva[लोट्], @deva[लोटो] @deva[हिस्वौ], @deva[वा] @deva[च] @deva[तध्वमोः] @ref[3.4.2] the same verb must be used in the subsequent clause, as the verb which was put in the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) .
34005: In the second case -- @deva[समुच्चयेऽन्यतरस्याम्] @ref[3.4.3], where many actions are spoken of together, the verb that is made to follow, should be such as has the sense common to all those verbs.
34006: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist), @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense) and @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) are optionally used in all tenses, in relation to verbs.
34007: The affix @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive) is optionally used the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) wherever the @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) can be used.
34008: Where a contingent promise (a reciprocal agreement) or apprehension is implied, the affix @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive) is used after a root in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) Literature.
34009: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) the following affixes come after the roots with the force of the affix @deva[तुमुन्] , viz. 1. @deva[से] 2. @deva[सेन्] 3. @deva[असे] 4. @deva[असेन्] 5. @deva[क्से] 6. @deva[क्सेन्] 7. @deva[अध्यै] 8. @deva[अध्यैन्] 9. @deva[कध्यै] 10. @deva[कध्यैन्] 11. @deva[शाध्यै] 12. @deva[शाध्यैन्] 13. @deva[तवै] 14. @deva[तवै] 15. @deva[तवैन्] ।
34010: The words 1. @deva[प्रयै] 2. @deva[रोहिष्यै] 3. @deva[अव्यथिष्यै] are irregularly formed Vedic Infinitives.
34011: The words 1. @deva[दृशे] 2. @deva[विख्ये] are anomalous Vedic Infinitives.
34012: The affixes @deva[णमुल्] and @deva[कमुल्] are added to roots in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) to form Infinitives, when they are governed by the verb @deva[शक्] 'to be able'.
34013: The affixes @deva[तोसुन्] and @deva[कसुन्] are added to roots in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) to form Infinitives, when the word @deva[ईश्वर] is in composition.
34014: The affixes 1. @deva[तवै] 2. @deva[केन्] 3. @deva[केन्य] 4. @deva[त्वन्] are added to roots in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), in the sense of @deva[कृत्य]-affixes.
34015: The word of @deva[अवचक्षे] is an anomalous passive participle in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
34016: The affix @deva[तोसुन्] comes in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) after the following verbs, when mere name of the action is indicated viz. 1. @deva[स्था] 'to stand' 2. @deva[इण्] 'to go' 3. @deva[कृञ्] 'to make' 4. @deva[वद्] 'to speak' 5. @deva[चर्] 'to go, to walk' 6. @deva[हु] 'to sacrifice' 7. @deva[तम्] 'to grow tired' 8. @deva[जन्] 'to produce' ।
34017: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the affix @deva[कसुन्] comes after the verbs 1. @deva[सृप्] 'to creep' 2. @deva[तृद्] 'to injure' , in the sense of Infinitives indicating name of action.
34018: According to the opinion of the Eastern Grammarians, the affix @deva[क्त्वा] comes after the verb, when there are in combination with it, the words @deva[अलम्] and @deva[खलु] expressing the sense of prohibition.
34019: According to the opinion of the Eastern Grammarians, the affix @deva[क्त्वा] is added to the root @deva[मेन्] 'to exchange' when the sense is that of interchange, (though the action denoted by the former word is not prior to the action denoted by the latter word).
34020: The affix @deva[क्त्वा] is added to a root, to denote what is situated on the side - @deva[पर] or on this side of something - @deva[अवर]।
34021: When two actions have the same agent, the affix @deva[क्त्वा] comes after that verb which takes place in time anterior to that of the other (i.e. Absolutive in @deva[त्व] refers to that action which precedes in time).
34022: The affixes @deva[णमुल्] and @deva[क्त्वा] come after a root when reiteration is to be expressed.
34023: The affixes @deva[णमुल्] and @deva[क्त्वा] are not added to a root when the word @deva[यद्] is used in a simple sentence which does not depend upon another to complete the sense.
34024: The affixes @deva[णमुल्] and @deva[क्त्वा] come optionally after that verb which denotes the prior action, when both verbs have the same agent, provided that the following words are in composition - 1. @deva[अग्रे] 2. @deva[प्रथम] 3. @deva[पूर्व]।
34025: The affix @deva[खमुञ्] is added to the verb @deva[कृ] 'to make', when a word in the Accusative -2nd case is in construction with it, if the sense intended implies 'abuse'.
34026: (When the actions signified by the verbs @deva[कृ] 'to make' and another have the same agent), the affix @deva[णमुल्] is added to the verb @deva[कृ] 'to make' which is concerned about a time anterior to that of the other), provided that a word signifying 'sweet' is in composition.
34027: When the words 1. @deva[अन्यथा] 'otherwise' 2. @deva[एवम्] 'so' 3. @deva[कथम्] 'how' 4. @deva[इत्थम्] 'thus' are compounded with the verb, the @deva[णमुल्] comes after @deva[कृ] 'to make', if it be such that its omission would be unobjectionable.
34028: The affix @deva[णमुल्] is added to the root @deva[कृ] 'to make', the words 1. @deva[यथा] 2. @deva[तथा] being compounded with it when an angry reply is made (if the omission of @deva[कृञ्] is unobjectionable).
34029: When the object is compounded with it, the verb @deva[दृश्] 'to see' or @deva[विद्] 'to know' takes the affix @deva[णमुल्] to denote the total number of such objects.
34030: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[विद्] 'to know' and @deva[जीव्] 'to live' when the word @deva[यावत्] is combined with them.
34031: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[पुर्] 'to fill' when the word @deva[चर्मन्] and @deva[उदर्] are compounded with it.
34032: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[पुर्] 'to fill' when the word so formed expresses a measure of rainfall and optionally the long @deva[ऊ] of this @deva[पुर्] is elided.
34033: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the causative of the root @deva[क्नूय्] 'to wet', when there is compounded with a noun denoting 'clothing', in the Accusative -2nd case, as an @deva[उपपद] , if the whole word so formed expresses a measure of the rainfall.
34034: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[कष्] 'to rub' when the words @deva[निमूल] and @deva[समूल] are compounded with it in the Accusative -2nd case.
34035: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[पिष्] 'to grind', when the words 1. @deva[शुष्क] 'dry' 2. @deva[चूर्ण] 'powder' 3. @deva[रूक्षे] 'dry', in the Accusative -2nd case are compounded with it.
34036: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verbs 1. @deva[हन्] 'to kill' 2. @deva[कृ] 'to make' 3. @deva[ग्रह्] 'to seize', when the words 1. @deva[समूल] 2. @deva[आकृत] 3. @deva[जीव] in the Accusative -2nd case are respectively compounded with them.
34037: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[हन्] 'to kill' when a word in the Instrumental -3rd case is in composition with it.
34038: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[पिष्] 'to grind' when a word in the Instrumental -3rd case denoting 'liquid' is in composition.
34039: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verbs @deva[वर्त्ति] (the causative of @deva[वृत्]) and @deva[ग्रह्] 'to seize' when a word denoting 'hand' in the Instrumental -3rd case, is in composition.
34040: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verb @deva[पुष्] 'to feed' when a word in the Instrumental -3rd case having the sense of @deva[स्व] is in composition.
34041: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the @deva[बन्ध्] 'to bind' when a word expressing location is in construction with it.
34042: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the @deva[बन्ध्] 'to bind' when a word so formed denotes an appellative.
34043: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the roots @deva[नश्] 'to destroy' and @deva[वह्] 'to carry' when the words @deva[जीव] 'life' and @deva[पुरुष] 'person' expressing the agent of these verbs, are respectively in construction with them.
34044: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the roots @deva[शुष्] 'to dry' and @deva[पूर्] 'to fill' when the word @deva[ऊर्ध्व] denoting an agent is in composition with them.
34045: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a root when an object or an agent denoting similitude is in composition with it.
34046: The same verb should be used after the gerunds formed from the verbs @deva[कष्] 'to rub' etc. as the verb from which the gerund is derived.
34047: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a root @deva[दंश्] 'to bite' preceded by the preposition @deva[उप] when a word ending with the Instrumental -3rd case is in composition with it..
34048: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the roots having the sense of @deva[हिंस] 'to injure, to strike' when the object of this gerund is the same as the object of the main verb and when the noun with which it is compounded ends with the Instrumental -3rd case-affix.
34049: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the roots 1. @deva[पीड्] 'to press' 2. @deva[रुद्ध्] 'to obstruct' 3. @deva[कृष्] 'to draw' when they are preceded by the preposition @deva[उप] and when they are compounded with nouns ending with the Locative -7th case-affix.
34050: (The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a root when a word in the Locative -7th case or Instrumental -3rd case is in composition with it) and when immediate contiguity is intended i.e. 'to fall together by the ears'.
34051: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a root when a noun in the Instrumental -3rd case or Locative -7th case is in composition with it and when measure of length is intended.
34052: The affix @deva[णमुल्] is added to the root when a noun in the Ablative -5th case is in composition and when 'haste' is intended.
34053: The affix @deva[णमुल्] is added to the root when a word in the Accusative -2nd case is in composition and when 'haste' is intended.
34054: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a verb when a word in the Accusative -2nd case is in composition, signifying the limbs of one's own body, when the limb is such that its loss will not destroy life.
34055: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after a root when a word in the Accusative -2nd case denoting a limb of one's own body, which is completely afflicted by the action, is in composition.
34056: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verbs 1. @deva[विश्] 'to enter' 2. @deva[पत्] 'to fall' 3. @deva[पद्] 'to pace, to go' 4. @deva[स्कन्द्] 'to leap', when a word in Accusative -2nd case is in composition and when the sense denoted is that of complete pervasion and total absorption.
34057: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verbs 1. @deva[अस्] 'to throw' 2. @deva[तृष्] 'to be thirsty' when it is intended to express an intermission of the action denoted by the root, provided that a word in the Accusative -2nd case denoting time is in composition.
34058: The affix @deva[णमुल्] comes after the verbs 1. @deva[आदिश्] 2. @deva[ग्रह्] 'to seize' when the word @deva[नामन्] 'name' in the Accusative -2nd case is in composition.
34059: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] come after the root @deva[कृ] 'to make' when an indeclinable word in composition with it and the meaning is the communication of anything in a disagreeable or undesired way.
34060: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] come after the root @deva[कृ] 'to make' when the word @deva[त्रियक्] is in composition in the sense of 'carrying to the end'.
34061: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] are added to the roots @deva[कृ] 'to make' and @deva[भू] 'to be', in composition with a word denoting a member of one's own body when the affix @deva[तस्] is joined thereto.
34062: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] are added to the roots @deva[कृ] 'to make' and @deva[भू] 'to be', when a word ending in the affix @deva[ना] -- @deva[विनञ्भ्यां] @deva[नानाञौ] @deva[नसह] @ref[5.2.27], or in an affix having the force of @deva[धा] -- @deva[संख्याया] @deva[विधाऽर्थे] @deva[धा] @ref[5.3.42], or having the sense of the affix @deva[च्वि] 'to make or to become something with it had not been before' -- @deva[अभूततद्भावे] @deva[कृभ्वस्तियोगे] @deva[सम्पद्यकर्तरि] @deva[च्विः] @ref[5.4.50], is in composition.
34063: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] are added to the roots @deva[भू] 'to be', when the word @deva[तूष्णीम्] 'silently' is in composition.
34064: The affixes @deva[क्तवा] and @deva[णमुल्] come after the root @deva[भू] 'to be' when the word @deva[अन्वक्] in the sense of being favourably disposed, is in composition.
34065: The affix @deva[तुमुन्] is added to every verb when another verb having the sense of 1. @deva[शक्] 'to be able' 2. @deva[धृष्] 'to make bold' 3. @deva[ज्ञा] 'to know' 4. @deva[ग्लै] 'to be weary' 5. @deva[घट्] 'to strive' 6. @deva[रभ्] 'to begin' 7. @deva[लभ्] 'to get' 8. @deva[क्रम्] 'to set about' 9. @deva[सह्] 'to bear' 10. @deva[अर्ह्] 'to be pleased or to condescend' 11. @deva[अस्] 'to be'.
34066: The affix @deva[तुमुन्] comes after a verb having in composition with it @deva[अलम्] and its synonyms when these words express to be capable of something.
34067: The affixes called @deva[कृत्] are used in the sense of an agent.
34068: The words 1. @deva[भव्य] 2. @deva[गेय] 3. @deva[प्रवचनीय] 3. @deva[उपस्थानीय] 4. @deva[जन्य] 5. @deva[आप्लाव्य] 6. @deva[आपात्य] may be optionally be used to denote the agent.
34069: The tense affixes called @deva[ल] are used in denoting the object and the agent and after intransitive verbs, they denote the action as well as the agent.
34070: The affixes called @deva[कृत्य] and the affix called @deva[क्त] and those that have the sense of @deva[खल्] have only these last two senses, viz. an action and an object (@deva[भाव] and @deva[कर्म]).
34071: The affix @deva[क्त] also denotes the agent when it expresses a beginning of an action.
34072: The affix @deva[क्त] is used in denoting the agent as well as the act and the object after verbs implying motion after intransitive roots and after the verbs 1. @deva[श्लिष्] 'to embrace' 2. @deva[शि] 'to lie down' 3. @deva[स्था] 'to stand' 4. @deva[आस्] 'to sit' 5. @deva[वस्] 'to dwell' 6. @deva[जन्] 'to produce' 7. @deva[रुह्] 'to mount' 8. @deva[जृ] 'to grow old'.
34073: The word @deva[दाश] and @deva[गोघ्न] are irregularly formed and the affix in these denotes the idea of the Dative or Recipient.
34074: The words @deva[भीम] etc. are irregularly formed and denote ablation.
34075: The words formed by @deva[उणादि] affixes denote other ideas other than these two - 1. Reciepient 2. Ablation.
34076: The affix @deva[क्त] which is ordained after roots denoting fixedness (to cling to a place), motion and taking gives the sense of location as well.
34077: In the place of @deva[ल] will be substituted the affixes we shall announce hereafter.
34078: The following are the substitutes of @deva[ल] - @deva[तिप्] - @deva[तस्] - @deva[झि] - @deva[सिप्] - @deva[थस्] - @deva[थ] - @deva[मिप्] - @deva[वस्] - @deva[मस्] - @deva[त] - @deva[आताम्] - @deva[झ] - @deva[थास्] - @deva[आथाम्] - @deva[ध्वम्] - @deva[इट्] - @deva[वहि] - @deva[महिङ्] ।
34079: The substitute @deva[ए] replaces he last vowel, with the consonant that follows it, of the @deva[आत्मनेपद] substitutes of that @deva[ल] which has an indicatory @deva[ट्]।
34080: The word @deva[से] is the substitute of @deva[थास्] in those tenses that have an indicatory @deva[ट्]।
34081: The words @deva[एश्] and @deva[इरेच्] are the substitutes of @deva[ट] and @deva[झ] respectively in the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense).
34082: In the room of the @deva[परस्मैपद] affixes, the following are substituted in the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense). Singular - @deva[णल्] (@deva[अ]), @deva[थल्] (@deva[थ]), @deva[णल्] (@deva[अ]). Dual - @deva[अतुस्] (@deva[अतुः]), @deva[अथुस्] (@deva[अथुः]), @deva[व] (@deva[व]). Plural - @deva[उस्] (@deva[उः]) , @deva[अ] (@deva[अ]), @deva[म] (@deva[म]).
34083: The above nine affixes of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) are optionally added in the @deva[लट्] (Present Tense) also after the verb @deva[विद्] 'to know'.
34084: Instead of the first 5 tense-affixes in the @deva[लट्] (Present Tense) coming after the verb @deva[ब्रु] 'to speak' there may optionally be the affixes of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) ; @deva[आह] being at the same time the substitute in the room of @deva[ब्रु] 'to speak'.
34085: The personal endings of the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) are as those of the @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense).
34086: In the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) @deva[उ] is the substitute of @deva[इ]।
34087: In the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) , @deva[हि] is substituted for @deva[सि] and this has not the indicatory @deva[प्] of @deva[सिप्] , i.e. it is acutely accented.
34088: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) the substitute of @deva[हि] is optionally treated as not having an indicatory @deva[प्]।
34089: In the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) @deva[नि] is substituted for the affix @deva[मि]।
34090: In the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) @deva[आम्] is substituted for what would have substituted otherwise @deva[ए] by @deva[टित] @deva[आत्मनेपदानां] @deva[टेरे] @ref[3.4.79].
34091: For such an @deva[ए] coming after @deva[स्] , is substituted @deva[व्] and for that coming after @deva[व्] , is substituted @deva[अम्] , in the (Imperative Mood).
34092: In the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood) @deva[आट्] is the augment of the affixes the first person and the termination is as if it had an indicatory @deva[प्]।
34093: The @deva[ऐ] is substituted for @deva[ए] forming part of the affixes of the first person of the @deva[लोट्] (Imperative Mood).
34094: The augments @deva[अट्] and @deva[आट्] are added to the @deva[तिङ्] (Personal Endings) of the @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive).
34095: In the @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive) @deva[ऐ] is the substitute of @deva[आ] in the first and second person dual of the @deva[आत्मनेपद] ।
34096: In the @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive) @deva[ऐ] is optionally the substitute of @deva[ए] in other places then those mentioned in the last sūtra.
34097: In the @deva[परस्मैपद] affixes the @deva[इ] is optionally elided in the @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive).
34098: The @deva[स्] of the first person is optionally elided in the @deva[लेट्] (Vedic Subjunctive).
34099: There is always elision of the @deva[स्] of the first person of the affixes that come in the room of that @deva[ल] which has an indicatory @deva[ङ्]।
34100: And there is elision of the @deva[इ] of that @deva[परस्मैपद] affix which is the substitute of a @deva[ल] having an indicatory @deva[ङ्]।
34101: The affixes 1. @deva[ताम्] 2. @deva[तम्] 3. @deva[त] 4. @deva[आम्] are the substitutes of the four affixes @deva[तस्] , @deva[थस्] , @deva[थ] and @deva[मिप्] respectively of any @deva[ल] which has an indicatory @deva[ङ्] ।
34102: The @deva[तिङ्] (Personal Endings) of the @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) and the Potential take the augment @deva[स्युत्] ।
34103: When the @deva[परस्मैपद] affixes of the Potential follow, then @deva[यासुट्] acutely accented, is their augment and the termination is regarded as having an indicatory @deva[ङ्]।
34104: The augment @deva[यासुट्] comes after that @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) also which denotes benediction and it is acutely accented and the substitutes of this @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) are as they had an indicatory @deva[क्]।
34105: The affix @deva[रन्] is the substitute of @deva[झ] in the @deva[लिङ्] (Potential and Benedictive).
34106: The short @deva[अ] is the substitute of @deva[इ] of the @deva[आत्मनेपद] first person singular in the Potential and Benedictive.
34107: The augment @deva[सुट्] is added to the following affixes @deva[त] and @deva[थ] when part of the affixes of the Potential and Benedictive.
34108: In the Potential and Benedictive @deva[जुस्] is the substitute of @deva[झि] , the ending of the first person plural @deva[परस्मैपद] ।
34109: (In those tenses which are marked with an indicatory @deva[ङ्] ) @deva[जुस्] is the substitute of @deva[झि] when it comes after an @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) in @deva[सिच्] or the @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense) of a reduplicated verb or the root @deva[विद्] 'to know'.
34110: When @deva[सिच्] is elided @deva[जुस्] is the substitute of @deva[झि] after a @deva[लुङ्] (Aorist) stem which ends in long @deva[आ]।
34111: In the opinion of @deva[शाकटायन] only @deva[जुस्] is the substitute of @deva[झि] , in the @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense) of the roots which end in a long @deva[आ]।
34112: In the opinion of @deva[शाकटायन] only @deva[जुस्] is the substitute of @deva[झि] , in the @deva[लङ्] (Imperfect Tense) after the verb @deva[द्विष्] 'to hate'.
34113: All the personal endings -- @deva[तिप्तस्झिसिप्थस्थमिब्वस्मस्तातांझथासाथांध्वमिड्वहिमहिङ्] @ref[3.4.78], and all affixes with an indicatory @deva[श्] are called @deva[सार्वधातुक] ।
34114: The remainder i.e. the affixes other than @deva[तिङ्] (Personal Endings) and those with an indicatory @deva[श्] sub-joined to a verbal root are called @deva[आर्द्धधातुक]।
34115: The @deva[तिङ्] (Personal Endings) of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) are also called @deva[आर्द्धधातुक] ।
34116: When the sense is that of Benediction, the substitutes of @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) are called @deva[आर्द्धधातुक] i.e. the @deva[तिङ्] (Personal Endings) of the @deva[लिङ्] (Benedictive) are @deva[आर्द्धधातुक] ।
34117: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) this distinction of @deva[सार्वधातुक] and @deva[आर्द्धधातुक] is not always maintained and the affixes are promiscuously used.
41001: (From this point forward up to the end of the Fifth Chapter, whatever we shall treat of, should be understood to come) after what ends with the feminine affixes @deva[ङी] or @deva[आप्] or after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem).
41002: (After what ends with the feminine terminations @deva[ङी] or @deva[आप्] or after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem), the following case-affixes ae used for declension) - 1st - @deva[सु] (@deva[स]), @deva[औ] , @deva[जस्] (@deva[अस्])। 2nd - @deva[अम्] , @deva[औट्] (@deva[औ]), @deva[शस्] (@deva[अस्])। 3rd - @deva[टा] (@deva[आ]), @deva[भ्याम्] , @deva[भिस्] । 4th - @deva[ङे] (@deva[ए]), @deva[भ्याम्] , @deva[भ्यस्]। 5th - @deva[ङसि] (@deva[अस्]), @deva[भ्याम्] , @deva[भ्यस्]। 6th - @deva[ङस्] (@deva[अस्]), @deva[ओस्] , @deva[आम्]। 7th - @deva[ङि] (@deva[इ]), @deva[ओस्] , @deva[सुप्] (@deva[सु])।
41003: When the feminine nature is to be indicated the affixes which we shall treat of hereinafter must be used.
41004: The affix @deva[टाप्] is used to indicate feminine nature after the @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) @deva[अज] etc. and after the stems ending in short @deva[अ]।
41005: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is used in forming the feminine after @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in @deva[ऋ] or @deva[न्]।
41006: And after what has an indicatory @deva[उक्] (@deva[उ] , @deva[ऋ] or @deva[ऌ]) the affix @deva[ङीप्] is used denoting a feminine.
41007: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is added, in forming the feminine to the stems that end in the syllable @deva[वन्] , and @deva[र्] is the substitute of the final such syllable.
41008: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is optionally used in the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending with the word @deva[पाद्]।
41009: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is used in the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending with the word @deva[पाद्] when the word denotes a verse of the @deva[ऋग्वेद]।
41010: The feminine affixes are not used after the stems called @deva[षद्] -- @deva[ष्णान्ता] @deva[षट्] @ref[1.1.24] and after @deva[स्वस्र] etc.
41011: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is not used after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in the syllable @deva[मन्]।
41012: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is not used to denote the feminine after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in @deva[अन्]।
41013: The affix @deva[डाप्] comes optionally after both - 1. @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in @deva[अन्] 2. @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
41014: The following rules apply to a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) which is not a subordinate term in a compound.
41015: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is added in the feminine after the @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stems) ending in short @deva[अ] , if the affix with which it ends has an indicatory @deva[ट्] or if the affix be @deva[ढ] or @deva[अण्] or @deva[अञ्] or @deva[द्वयसच्] or @deva[दघ्नच्] or @deva[मात्रच्] or @deva[तयप्] or @deva[ठक्] or @deva[ठञ्] or @deva[कञ्] or @deva[क्वरप्]।
41016: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is used in denoting the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in @deva[यञ्] -- @deva[गर्गादिभ्यो] @deva[यञ्] @ref[4.1.105].
41017: In the opinion of the Eastern Grammarians, the affix @deva[ष्फ] is used after what ends with the affix @deva[यञ्] and it is to be regarded as a @deva[तद्धित]-affix.
41018: The affix @deva[ष्फ] is invariably added in the feminine after the words beginning with @deva[लोहित] and ending with @deva[क्त] when they take the affix @deva[यञ्]।
41019: The affix @deva[ष्फ] is added in the feminine after the words 1. @deva[कौरव्य] and 2. @deva[माण्डूक]।
41020: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is used in the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in @deva[अ] and denoting early age.
41021: The affix @deva[ङीप्] come in the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) ending in @deva[अ] , which is @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound).
41022: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is not used when a @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided after a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) ending in a word not denoting a mass or measure; or in 1. @deva[बिस्त] 2. @deva[आचित] or 3. @deva[कम्बल्य]।
41023: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is not used after an adjectival @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) ending with the word @deva[काण्ड] where the @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided when the compound means field.
41024: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is not optionally used after a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) where the @deva[तद्धित] affix is elided when the compound ends in the word @deva[पुरुष] , referring to 'measure'.
41025: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is used in the feminine after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in the word @deva[ऊधस्] 'an udder'.
41026: The affix @deva[ङीप्] comes in the feminine after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in the word @deva[ऊधस्] 'an udder', beginning with a Numeral or indeclinable.
41027: The affix @deva[ङीप्] comes in the feminine after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] beginning with a Numeral and ending with the words 1. @deva[दामन्] 'a rope' and 2. @deva[हायन] 'a year'.
41028: The affix @deva[ङीप्] comes after that @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] which ending in the syllable @deva[अन्] loses its penultimate @deva[अ]।
41029: The affix @deva[ङीप्] necessarily comes in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) and in forming Names after that @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] which ending in the syllable @deva[अन्] loses its penultimate @deva[अ]।
41030: The affix @deva[ङीप्] necessarily comes denoting the feminine after the following @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stems) when used to express a Name or in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
41031: The affix @deva[ङीप्] comes after the word @deva[रात्रि] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) and in denoting a Name except the affix @deva[जस्] (1st - Nominative Case Plural) is added.
41032: The augment @deva[नुक्] is added to the words @deva[अन्तर्वत्] and @deva[पतिवत्] when the affix @deva[ङीप्] is added to form the feminine.
41033: The substitute @deva[न्] replaces the final @deva[इ] of @deva[पति] before the feminine affix @deva[ङीप्] when the word so formed means 'a wife' who takes part in the sacrifices of her husband.
41034: In forming the feminine with the affix @deva[ङीप्] , @deva[न्] is optionally the substitute of the final @deva[इ] of @deva[पति] when the latter is preceded by another vowel.
41035: In forming the feminine with the affix @deva[ङीप्] the word @deva[पति] always takes the substitute @deva[न्] in the words like @deva[सपत्नि] etc.
41036: In forming the feminine, the letter @deva[ऐ] is the substitute of the final word @deva[पूतक्तु] when the affix @deva[ङीप्] is added.
41037: In forming the feminine with the affix @deva[ङीप्] the letter @deva[ऐ] having @deva[उदात्त] accent is the substitute of the finals 1. @deva[वृषाकपि] 2. @deva[अग्नि] 3. @deva[कुसति] and 3. @deva[कुसीद] ।
41038: In forming the feminine with the affix @deva[ङीप्] , @deva[औ] is optionally the substitute of the final @deva[मनु] (as well as the @deva[उदात्त] @deva[ऐ]).
41039: The affix @deva[ङीप्] is optionally used after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) expressive of colour ending with a gravely accented vowel and having the letter @deva[त्] as its penultimate letter and the letter @deva[न्] is substituted in the room of @deva[त्]।
41040: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used in the feminine after every other word expressive of colour and ending with an @deva[अनुदात्त] accent.
41041: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used in forming the feminine after the words ending with affixes which have an indicatory @deva[ष्] and after the words @deva[गौर] etc.
41042: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used after the 11 words @deva[जानपद] etc. in the sense of 'profession' etc. 1. @deva[जानप्] 2. @deva[कुण्ड] 3. @deva[गोण] 4. @deva[स्थल] 5. @deva[भाज] 6. @deva[नाग] 7. @deva[काल] 8. @deva[नील] 9. @deva[कुश्] 10. @deva[कामुक] and 11 @deva[कबर] ; the affix @deva[ङीष्] is employed when the sense is that of 1. 'profession or living' 2. 'a bowl' 3. 'a sack or vessel for keeping grain' 4. 'a natural spot of ground' 5. 'a cooked food or rice-gruel' 6. 'stout' 7. 'black-coloured' 8. 'blue-coloured other than cloth' 9. 'a plough-share' 10. 'a libidinous female' 11. 'a fillet or braid of hair', respectively.
41043: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used in the feminine according to the opinion of the Eastern Grammarians after the word @deva[शोण]।
41044: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is optionally used in the feminine after a word ending in short @deva[अ] and being expressive of quality.
41045: And the affix @deva[ङीष्] is optionally used in the feminine after the words @deva[बहु] etc.
41046: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is always used in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) in forming the feminine of the words @deva[बहु] etc.
41047: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is always used in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) in forming the feminine after the word @deva[भु]।
41048: The feminine affix @deva[ङीष्] comes after a word when it expresses the name of a wife in relation to her husband.
41049: The augment @deva[आनुक्] is added to the Proper Nouns 1. @deva[इन्द्र] 2. @deva[वरुण] 3. @deva[भव] 4. @deva[शर्व] 5. @deva[रुद्र] and 6. @deva[मृड] and to the words 1. @deva[हिम] 'snow' 3. @deva[अरण्य] 'forest' 4. @deva[यव] 'barely' 5. @deva[यवन] 'a Yavana' 6. @deva[मातुल] 'a maternal uncle' and 7. @deva[आचार्य] 'a perceptor', before the feminine affix @deva[ङीष्]।
41050: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used in the feminine after a compound word ending in @deva[क्रीत] , the first member of the compound being the name of the means wherewith the thing is bought.
41051: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used after a compound @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) in which a name denoting the means herewith, is the first member and the second member is a word formed by the Particle @deva[क्त] when the sense is that of 'a small quantity'.
41052: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is used in the feminine after that @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] which ending with a word formed by the affix @deva[क्त] has an acute accent on the last syllable.
41053: The affix @deva[ङीष्] is optionally used in the feminine after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending with the word in @deva[क्त] having acute accent on the final, the antecedent word not being a word denoting a part of the body.
41054: And the feminine affix @deva[ङीष्] comes optionally after what ends with the name of a part of the body when the word is a subordinate member in compound and has not a conjunct for its penultimate letter (i.e. the final @deva[अ] is not preceded by a double consonant).
41055: And the feminine @deva[ङीष्] comes optionally after compounds ending with 1. @deva[नासिका] 'a nose' 2. @deva[उदर] 'belly' 3. @deva[ओष्ठ] 'lip' 4. @deva[जंघा] 'leg' 5. @deva[दन्त] 'tooth' 6. @deva[कर्ण] 'ear' and 7. @deva[शृङ्ग] 'horn'.
41056: The feminine affix @deva[ङीष्] does not come after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) which denoting a part of the body, belongs to the class @deva[क्रोडा] 'the flank' etc., of a horse', nor when the word is a stem of more than two syllables.
41057: The affix @deva[ङीष्] does not come in the feminine after a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) denoting a part of the body when the word is subordinate in a compound, preceded by the word 1. @deva[सह] 'with' 2. @deva[नञ्] 'not' or 3. @deva[विद्यमान] 'having'.
41058: The feminine affix @deva[ङीष्] is not used after 1. @deva[नख] 2. @deva[मुख] when (the word at the end of which they stand) is a Name.

41098: The affix @deva[च्फञ्] comes after the words @deva[कुञ्च] etc. when a remoter descendant (called @deva[गोत्र]) is to be denoted.
41099: The affix @deva[फक्] comes, in denoting a @deva[गोत्र] descendant after the @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stems) @deva[नड] etc.
41100: The affix @deva[फक्] comes after the words @deva[हरित] etc. when they end in the affix @deva[अञ्] -- @deva[अनृष्यानन्तर्ये] @deva[बिदादिभ्योऽञ्] @ref[4.1.104]

41102: The affix @deva[फक्] comes in denoting a @deva[गोत्र] (Patronymic) descendant after the words 1. @deva[शरद्वत्] 2. @deva[शुनक] 3. @deva[दर्भा] when they denote the descendants of @deva[भृगु] , @deva[वत्स] and @deva[अग्रायण] , respectively.

41161: The affixes @deva[अञ्] and @deva[यत्] come after the word @deva[मनु] and the augment @deva[षुक्] is added when these affixes follow provided that the whole word so formed denotes a @deva[जाति] (class name).
41162: A descendant being a grandson or a still lower offspring is called @deva[गोत्र]।
41163: But when one in a line of descent beginning with a father (and reckoning upwards) is alive, the descendant of a grandson or still lower descendant is called @deva[युवन्] only.
41164: When an elder brother is alive, the younger brother gets the title of @deva[युवन्] , being the descendant of a grandson etc.
41165: The living descendant of a grandson etc. is called optionally a @deva[युवन्] when a more superior @deva[सपिण्ड] other than a brother is alive.
41166: The @deva[गोत्र] is sometimes optionally regarded as @deva[युवन्] when respectful reference to him is intended.
41167: The @deva[युवन्] is optionally spoken of as @deva[गोत्र] when contemptuous reference to him is intended.
41168: The affix @deva[अञ्] comes in the sense of descendant after a word which while denoting a country, expresses also a tribe of @deva[क्षत्रिय]-s.

42123: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the remaining senses after a @deva[वृद्ध] word denoting a locality of the East-folk, the word having penultimate @deva[र] or ending in @deva[ई]।

42129: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[अरण्य] , in the sense of 'a man'.
42130: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes optionally in the remaining senses after the words 1. @deva[कुरु] and 2. @deva[युगन्धर]।
42131: The affix @deva[कन्] comes in the remaining senses after the words 1. @deva[मद्र] and 2. @deva[वृजि]।

42133: The affix @deva[अण्] comes in the remaining senses after the words @deva[कच्छ] etc. denoting places.

42135: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes after the word @deva[साल्व] in the senses of being born etc. when denoting 'a man 'or 'what exists in a man', provided that it does not mean a foot-soldier.
42136: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the remaining senses of being born etc. after the words @deva[साल्व] etc. when the word signifies 'a cow' or 'a barley gruel'.

42138: The affix @deva[छ] comes in the remaining senses after the words @deva[गह] etc.
42139: The affix @deva[छ] comes in the remaining senses after the words beginning with @deva[कद] denoting the places of the East-folk.

42141: The affix @deva[छ] comes in the remaining senses after a @deva[वृद्ध] word denoting a place and ending with @deva[अक्] or @deva[इक्] or having @deva[ख] as its penultimate.
42142: The affix @deva[छ] comes in the remaining senses after a @deva[वृद्ध] words, having the words 1. @deva[कन्था] 2. @deva[पलद] 3. @deva[नगर] 4. @deva[ग्राम] and 5. @deva[हृद] , as second terms.
42143: The affix @deva[छ] comes after the word @deva[पर्वत] in the remaining senses.

42145: The affix @deva[छ] comes in the remaining senses after @deva[कृकण] and @deva[पर्ण] when denoting the country @deva[भारद्वाच]।
43001: The affix @deva[खञ्] also comes optionally in the remaining senses after the words 1. @deva[युष्मद्] and 2. @deva[अस्मद्]।

43003: In expressing one individual, @deva[तबक] and @deva[ममक] are the substitutes of @deva[युष्मद्] and @deva[अस्मद्] respectively when @deva[खञ्] and @deva[अण्] follow.
43004: The affix @deva[यत्] comes after the word @deva[अर्द्ध] in the remaining senses.
43005: The affix @deva[यत्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[अर्द्ध] when preceded by 1. @deva[पर] 2. @deva[अवर] 3. @deva[अधम] and 4. @deva[उत्तम]।
43006: And the affix @deva[ठञ्] also (as well as @deva[यत्]) comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[अर्द्ध] when the prior term denotes a direction.
43007: The affixes @deva[अञ्] and @deva[ठञ्] come in the remaining senses after the word @deva[अर्द्ध] preceded by a word denoting direction when a particular portion of a village or an inhabited country.
43008: After the word @deva[मध्य] there is the affix @deva[म] in the remaining senses.
43009: The affix @deva[अ] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[मध्य] , the meaning being 'fit' or 'proper'.
43010: The affix @deva[यञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[द्वीप] , which is near the sea.
43011: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the words denoting time.
43012: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[शरद्] when expressing @deva[श्राद्ध]।
43013: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes optionally comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[शरद्] when expressing illness or heat.
43014: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes optionally comes in the remaining senses after the words 1. @deva[निशा] and 2. @deva[प्रदोष] ।
43015: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes optionally comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[श्वस्] and it takes the augment @deva[तुट्]।
43016: The affix @deva[अण्] comes in the remaining senses after the words @deva[संधिवेला] etc. and the words expressing 'season' and 'asterism'.
43017: The affix @deva[एण्य] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[प्रावृष]।
43018: The affix @deva[ठक्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[वर्षा]।
43019: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the word @deva[वर्षा] takes the affix @deva[ठञ्] , in the remaining senses.
43020: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[वसन्त]।
43021: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), the affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the remaining senses after the word @deva[हेमन्त]।

43023: After the words 1. @deva[सायं] 'at eve' 2. @deva[चिरम्] 'for a long time' 3. @deva[प्राह्णे] 'in the forenoon' 4. @deva[प्रगे] 'at dawn' and after indeclinables expressing time, there are the affixes @deva[ट्यु] and @deva[ट्युल्] and their augment is @deva[तुट्]।
43024: Optionally after the words 1. @deva[पूर्वाह्ण] and 2. @deva[अपराह्ण] there are the affixes @deva[ट्यु] and @deva[ट्युल्] and their augment is @deva[तुट्]।
43025: The affixes ordained above or hereafter come after a word in the Locative -7th case in construction in the sense of 'born or grown or originated there or then'.
43026: After the word @deva[प्रावृट्] being in the Locative -7th case-affix, there is the affix @deva[ठप्] in the sense of 'produced therein'.
43027: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes after the word @deva[शरद] in the Locative -7th case-affix in the sense of 'born therein', the whole word being a name.
43028: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the sense of 'born therein' after the words 1. @deva[पूर्वाह्ण] 2. @deva[अपराह्ण] 3. @deva[आर्द्रा] 4. @deva[मूला] 5. @deva[प्रदोष] and 6. @deva[अवस्कर] , the whole being a name.
43029: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes after the word @deva[पथ] , in the sense of 'produced therein' and thereby in the room of @deva[पथ] , the substitute is @deva[पन्थ]।
43030: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes optionally after the word @deva[अमावास्या] in the sense of 'born therein'.
43031: The affix @deva[अ] is also added to the word @deva[अमावास्या] in the sense of 'born therein'.
43032: After the words 1. @deva[सिन्धु] and 2. @deva[अपकर] there is the affix @deva[कन्] in the sense of 'born therein'.
43033: And the affixes @deva[अण्] and @deva[अञ्] come respectively after the words 1. @deva[सिन्धु] and 2. @deva[अपकर]।
43034: The affix denoting 'born therein' is elided by @deva[लुक्] after the words 1. @deva[श्रविष्ठ] 2. @deva[फाल्गुनी] 3. @deva[अनुराधा] 4. @deva[स्वाति] 5. @deva[तिष्य] 6. @deva[पुनर्वसु] 7. @deva[हस्त] 8. @deva[विशाखा] 9. @deva[अषाढा] and 10. @deva[बहुला] , all denoting asterisms.
43035: There is @deva[लुक्] elision of the affix denoting 'born therein' after a word ending in @deva[स्थान] and after the words 1. @deva[गोशाल] and 2. @deva[खरशाल]।
43036: There is optionally @deva[लुक्] elision of the affix denoting 'born therein' after the words 1. @deva[वत्सशाला] 2. @deva[अभिजित्] 3. @deva[अश्वयुक्] and 4. @deva[शतभित्]।
43037: There is diversely @deva[लुक्] elision of the affix denoting 'born therein' after an asterism.
43038: An affix (one of those already taught) comes after a word in the Locative -7th case, in the sense of 'done there', 'obtained there', 'bought there' and 'dexterous therein'.
43039: After a word being in construction in the Locative -7th case, an affix (one of those ordained already) comes in the sense of 'generally found therein'.
43040: The affix @deva[ठक्] comes in the sense of 'mostly to be found there' after the words 1. @deva[उपजानु] 2. @deva[उपकरण] and 3. @deva[उपोनीवि] , being in the Locative -7th case.
43041: After a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) or a word ending in the feminine affix @deva[ङि] and @deva[आप्] , being in the Locative -7th case in construction, an affix comes in the sense of 'adapted therein'.
43042: The affix @deva[ढञ्] comes after the words @deva[कोश] etc. in the sense of 'adapted to that'.
43043: An affix comes after a word denoting time being in the Locative -7th case in construction, in the sense of 'being good', 'flowering' or 'ripening therein.
43044: An affix comes after a word denoting 'time' being in the Locative -7th case in construction meaning 'sown therein'.
43045: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the sense of 'sown' after the word @deva[आश्वयुजी]।
43046: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes optionally after the words 1. @deva[ग्रीष्म] and 2. @deva[वसन्त] in the sense of 'sown'.
43047: After a @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stem) being in the Locative -7th case in construction denoting time, an affix comes in the sense of 'being then due'; provided that the thing due be 'debt'.
43048: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the sense of 'debt then due' after the words 1. @deva[कलापिन्] 2. @deva[अश्वत्थ] and 3. @deva[यवबुस्] , denoting time and being in the Locative -7th case.
43049: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the sense of 'debt due' after the words 1. @deva[ग्रीष्म] and 2. @deva[अवरसम]।
43050: The affix @deva[ठञ्] also (as well as @deva[वुञ्] ) comes after the words 1. @deva[संवत्सरा] 2. @deva[अग्राहायणी] in the sense of 'debt due'.
43051: An affix comes after a word in the Locative -7th case in construction denoting time, in the sense of 'who then wanders' and the word so formed refers to a wild beast.
43052: An affix comes after a word in the Nominative 1st-Case in construction denoting time in the sense of 'this is his habit or endurance'.
43053: An affix comes after a word in the Locative -7th case in construction in the sense of 'who stays there'.
43054: The affix @deva[यत्] comes in the sense of 'who stays there' after the @deva[प्रातिपदिक] (Nominal Stems) @deva[दिक्] etc.
43055: The affix @deva[यत्] comes in the sense of 'what stays there' after a word denoting a part of the body.
43056: The affix @deva[ढञ्] comes in the sense of 'what stays there' after the words 1. @deva[दृति] 2. @deva[कुक्षि] 3. @deva[कलशि] 4. @deva[वस्ति] 5. @deva[अस्ति] and 6. @deva[अहि]।
43057: The affix @deva[अण्] also (as well as @deva[ढञ्] ) comes after the word @deva[ग्रीवा] in the sense of 'what stays there'.
43058: The affix @deva[ञ्य] comes in the sense of 'who stays there' after the word @deva[गम्भीर]।

43060: After an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास] having the word @deva[अन्तर] as prior term, the affix @deva[ठञ्] is used in the sense of 'who stays there'.
43061: After the word @deva[ग्राम] preceded by @deva[परि] or @deva[अनु] (the whole being @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास] ) there is the affix @deva[ठञ्] in the sense of 'who stays there'.
43062: After the words 1. @deva[जिह्वामूल] and 2. @deva[अङ्गुलि] there is the affix @deva[छ] in the sense of 'who stays there'.
