43065: The affix @deva[कन्] comes in the sense of 'what occurs there' after @deva[कर्ण] and @deva[ललाट] , the word denoting 'an ornament'.
43066: After the name of a subject of commentary an affix comes in the sense of 'its commentary', as well as in the sense of 'what occurs there'.
43067: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the sense of 'staying' and 'a commentary' after a polysyllabic word having @deva[उदात्त] on the final (the word being the name of a thing to be explained).
43068: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the sense of 'occurring' and 'a commentary' after the name of a work to be explained provided that such work relates to a @deva[क्रतु] or a @deva[यज्ञ]।
43069: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes after the name of an explainable work called after a @deva[ऋषि] in the senses of 'occurring therein' or 'commentary thereon' when it refers to an @deva[अध्याय] only.
43070: The affix @deva[ष्ठन्] comes in the sense of 'occurring therein' and 'commentary thereon' after the words 1. @deva[पौरोडाश] and 2. @deva[पुरोडाश]।
43071: The affixes @deva[यत्] and @deva[अण्] comes in the sense of 'occurring therein' or 'commentary thereon' after the word @deva[छन्दस्]।
43072: The affix @deva[ठक्] comes in the sense of 'occurring therein' or 'commentary thereon' after a word of two syllables and a word ending in short @deva[ऋ] and the words 1. @deva[ब्राह्मण] 2. @deva[ऋक्] 3. @deva[प्रथम] 4. @deva[पुरश्चरण] 5. @deva[नाम] 6. @deva[आख्यात] and 7. @deva[नामाख्यात] being the names of explainable works.

43076: The affix @deva[अण्] comes in the sense of 'thence come' after the words @deva[शुण्डिक] etc.

43078: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the sense of 'come thence' after a word ending in short @deva[ऋ] and denoting a person related through learning or blood.
43079: The affix @deva[यत्] and @deva[ठञ्] comes in the sense of 'come thence' after the word @deva[पितृ]।

43085: An affix -- @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतोऽण्] @ref[4.1.83] etc. comes after a word in the Accusative -2nd case in construction in the sense of 'what goes thereto', provided that, which goes, is a road or a messenger.
43086: An affix -- @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतोऽण्] @ref[4.1.83] etc. comes after a word in the Accusative -2nd case in construction in the sense of 'a door which looks towards that'.

43089: After a word in the Nominative 1st-Case in construction, an affix comes in the sense of 'this is his dwelling place'.
43090: After a word in the Nominative 1st-Case in construction, an affix comes in the sense of 'this is his mother-land'.
43091: The affix @deva[छ] comes after a word denoting 'mountain' in the sense of 'this is his mother-land', when it is a person who lives by arms.
43092: The affix @deva[ञ्य] comes in the sense of 'this is his native-land' after the words @deva[शण्डिक] etc.
43093: The affixes @deva[अण्] and @deva[अञ्] come respectively after the words @deva[सिन्धु] etc. and @deva[तक्षशिला] etc. in the sense of 'this is his native land'.
43094: After the words 1. @deva[तूदी] 2. @deva[शलातुर] 3. @deva[वर्मती] and 4. @deva[कूचवार] come respectively the affixes 1. @deva[ढक्] 2. @deva[छण्] 3. @deva[ढञ्] and 4. @deva[यक्] in the sense of 'this is his native land'.
43095: An affix -- @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतोऽण्] @ref[4.1.83], comes after a word in the Nominative 1st-Case in construction in the sense of 'this is his object of veneration or love'.
43096: After a word denoting a thing not having consciousness, but not being the name of a country or time, the affix @deva[ठक्] is used in the sense of 'this is his object of devotion or love'.
43097: The affix @deva[ठञ्] comes in the sense of 'this is his object of veneration' after the word @deva[महाराज]।
43098: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes in the sense of 'this is his object of veneration' after the words 1. @deva[वासुदेव] and @deva[अर्जुना]।
43099: The affix @deva[वुञ्] comes diversely in the sense of 'this is his object of veneration' after a word denoting @deva[गोत्र] (Patronymic) or a @deva[क्षत्रिय]।
43100: Of words denoting Princes (literally - who are Lords of @deva[जनपद]) the base and affix meaning 'this is his object of veneration' are the same, in every respect, like those of a word denoting kingdom, provided that, the Prince-denoting words have, in the plural, the same form as the Kingdom-denoting words.
43101: After a word in the Instrumental -3rd case in construction, an affix -- @deva[प्राग्दीव्यतोऽण्] @ref[4.1.83] etc., comes in the sense of 'enounced by him'.
43102: The affix @deva[छण्] comes in the sense of 'enounced by him' after the words 1. @deva[तित्तिरि] 2. @deva[वरतन्तु] 3. @deva[खण्डिक] and 4. @deva[उख]।
43103: The affix @deva[णिनि] comes in the sense of 'enounced by him' after the words 1. @deva[काश्यप] and 2. @deva[कौशिक] denoting @deva[ऋषि]-s (Vedic Seers).

54115: The affix @deva[ष] comes after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in @deva[मूर्ध्न्] and preceded by 1. @deva[द्वि] and 2. @deva[त्रि]।
54116: The affix @deva[अप्] comes after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in a feminine ordinal numeral or in the word @deva[प्रमाणी]।
54117: The affix @deva[अप्] comes after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in @deva[लोमन्] and preceded by 1. @deva[अन्तर] and 2. @deva[बहिस्]।
54118: The affix @deva[अच्] is added to the word @deva[नासिका] final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when it expresses a name whereby @deva[नस्] is substituted for @deva[नासिका] , but not so when the word @deva[स्थूल] precedes the word @deva[नासिका]।
54119: The affix @deva[अच्] comes after the word @deva[नासिका] final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when an @deva[उपसर्ग] (Preposition) precedes it and @deva[नस्] is substituted for @deva[नासिका]।
54120: The following @deva[बहुव्रीहि]-s are irregularly formed by adding @deva[अच्] - 1. @deva[सु-प्रात] 2. @deva[सु-श्व] 3. @deva[सु-दिव] 4. @deva[शारिकुक्ष] 5. @deva[चतुरश्र] 6. @deva[एणी-पद] 7. @deva[अज-पद] and 8. @deva[प्रोष्ठ-पद]।
54121: The affix @deva[अच्] comes optionally after the words 1. @deva[हलि] and 2. @deva[सक्थि] final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when preceded by a negative particle or by the words 1. @deva[दुस्] and 2. @deva[सु]।
54122: The affix @deva[असिच्] (@deva[अस्]) comes invariably after 1. @deva[प्रजा] and 2. @deva[मेधा] final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when the above particles 1. @deva[नञ्] 2. @deva[दुस्] and 3. @deva[सु] precede them.
54123: The form @deva[बहुप्रजास्] is valid in the Vedas.
54124: The affix @deva[अनिच्] (@deva[अन्]) comes after the word @deva[धर्म] when it is the last member of a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] and is itself the only word without any other word joined with it or when the first member is a single word.
54125: The word @deva[जम्भन्] stands at the ending of a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when preceded by 1. @deva[सु] 2. @deva[हरित] 3. @deva[तृण] and 4. @deva[सोम]।
54126: The form @deva[दक्षिणेर्मन्] is an irregularly formed @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when used in conjunction with a hunter.
54127: The affix @deva[इच्] comes after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when the compound denotes the reciprocity of an action.
54128: The words @deva[द्विदण्डि] etc. are valid forms of @deva[इच्]।
54129: After the words @deva[प्र] and @deva[सम्] there is the substitution of @deva[ज्ञु] for @deva[जानु] when forming the @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54130: The substitution of @deva[ज्ञु] for @deva[जानु] when the word @deva[ऊर्धव] precedes it.
54131: The syllable @deva[अनङ्] is the substitute of the final @deva[ऊधस्] in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54132: The @deva[अनङ्] is the substitute of the final of @deva[धनुस्] in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54133: The substitution of @deva[अनङ्] does not optionally take place when the @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] is a name.

54135: For the final of @deva[गन्ध] is substituted @deva[इ] when preceded by 1. @deva[उत्] 2. @deva[पूति] 3. @deva[सु] and 4. @deva[सुरभि] in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54136: The @deva[इ] is substituted for the final @deva[अ] of @deva[गन्ध] at the end of a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when @deva[गन्ध] means 'a little'.
54137: The @deva[इ] is substituted for the final @deva[अ] of @deva[गन्ध] at the end of a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when preceded by a word denoting a thing with which it is compared.
54138: The final @deva[अ] of @deva[पाद] is elided when it is at the end of a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] preceded by a word denoting a thing with which it is compared but not so when such word is @deva[हस्ति] etc.
54139: The words @deva[कुम्भपदी] etc. have been formed by the similar elision of the @deva[अ] of @deva[पाद]।

54141: For @deva[दन्त] is substituted @deva[दत्] in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when a numeral or @deva[सु] precedes it and the whole word expresses a stage of life i.e. an age.
54142: For @deva[दन्त] is substituted @deva[दत्] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) when final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54143: For @deva[दन्त] is substituted @deva[दत्] when in the feminine gender denoting a name.
54144: Optionally @deva[दत्] is substituted for @deva[दन्त] in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when it is preceded by the words @deva[श्याव] and @deva[अरोक]।
54145: The substitution of @deva[दत्] for @deva[दन्त] is optional in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when it is preceded by a word ending in 1. @deva[अग्र] or by 2. @deva[शुद्ध] 3. @deva[शुभ्र] and 4. @deva[वराह]।
54146: The final letter of @deva[ककुद] is dropped in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when it denotes age or condition of animals.
54147: The @deva[बहुव्रीहि] word @deva[त्रिककुद्] formed by the elision of the final @deva[अ] of @deva[ककुद] is the name of a mountain.
54148: After @deva[उत्] and @deva[वि] the final of @deva[काकुद] is elided in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54149: After @deva[पूर्ण] the final of @deva[काकुद] is optionally elided in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54150: The words @deva[सुहृत्] and @deva[दुहृत्] are irregularly formed @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] denoting 'a friend' and 'a foe' respectively.
54151: The affix @deva[कप्] comes after @deva[उरस्] etc. final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ।
54152: The affix @deva[कप्] is added to a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] the last member of which ends in @deva[इन्] when a feminine word is denoted
54153: The affix @deva[कप्] is added to a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] the last member of which is a feminine word ending in long @deva[ई] or @deva[ऊ] defined as @deva[नदी] words or which ends in a short @deva[ऋ]।
54154: After all other @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] not covered by the foregoing rules, may optionally be added the affix @deva[कप्]।
54155: The affix @deva[कप्] does not come after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when a name is meant.
54156: The affix @deva[कप्] does not come after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] the last member of which ends in the affix @deva[ईयस्]।
54157: The affix @deva[कप्] does not come after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in the word @deva[भ्रातृ] when it means 'praised'.
54158: The affix @deva[कप्] does not come after a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] ending in short @deva[ऋ] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
54159: The affix @deva[कप्] does not come after the words @deva[नाडी] and @deva[तन्त्री] final in a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] when they mean organs of the body.
54160: The word @deva[निष्प्रवाणि] is irregularly formed without adding the affix @deva[कप्] though the last word is a @deva[नदी] word.
61001: In the room of the first portion, containing a single vowel, there are two.

61003: The letters @deva[न्] , @deva[द्] , and @deva[र्] being the first letter of a compound consonant and being part of the second syllable, are not reduplicated.
61004: The first of the two is called @deva[अभ्यास] or Reduplicate.
61006: So also the six roots beginning with @deva[जक्षि] are called @deva[अभ्यस्त]।
61007: In the room of a short vowel of the Reduplicate of the the roots @deva[तुज्] etc., a long is substituted.
61008: When the tense-affixes of the Perfect follow, there is reduplication of the root, which is not already reduplicated.
61009: Of a non-reduplicate root ending in @deva[सन्] (Desiderative) or @deva[यङ्] (Intensive) affixes, there is reduplication.
61010: Of a non-reduplicate root there is reduplication when the @deva[विकरण] @deva[श्लु] follows.
61011: Of a non-reduplicate root there is reduplication when the affix @deva[चङ्] of the Aorist follows.
61012: The participles @deva[दाश्वाम्] , @deva[साह्वान्] , and @deva[मीढ्वान्] are irregularly formed without reduplication.
61013: There is vocalisation of the semi-vowel @deva[य्] of the affix @deva[ष्यङ्] @ref[4.1.78] when followed in a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] compound, by the words @deva[पुत्र] and @deva[पति]।
61014: There is vocalisation of the affix @deva[ष्यङ्] @ref[4.1.78] when the word @deva[बन्धु] follows in a @deva[बहुव्रीही] compound.
61015: The semi-vowels of the roots @deva[वच्] , @deva[स्वप्] , and @deva[यजादि] verbs are vocalised when followed by an affix having an indicatory @deva[क]।
61016: There is vocalisation of the semi-vowels of the following verbs, when an affix having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] follows - @deva[ग्रह] 'to take', @deva[ज्या] 'to become old', @deva[वेञ्] 'to weave', @deva[व्यध] 'to strike', @deva[वश] 'to shine', @deva[व्यच] 'to deceive', @deva[व्रश्च] 'to cut', @deva[प्रच्छ] 'to ask' and @deva[भ्रस्ज] 'to cook, to fry'.

61019: There is vocalisation of the semi-vowel, of the verbs @deva[स्वप्] 'to sleep', @deva[स्यम्] 'to shout' and @deva[व्ये] 'to cover', when followed by the affix @deva[यङ्] of the Intensive.

61024: There is vocalisation of the semi-vowel of the root @deva[श्या] (@deva[श्यै]) 'to go' when the @deva[निष्ठा] affix follows, when the sense is 'coagulation' or 'cold to touch'.
61025: There is vocalisation of @deva[श्या] preceded by the @deva[उपसर्ग] @deva[प्रति] , when the @deva[निष्ठा] affixes follow.

61027: Optionally @deva[शृत] is formed in the sense of 'cooked', by the vocalisation of the semi-vowel of @deva[आ] before the @deva[निष्ठा] affix @deva[क्त]।
61028: @deva[पी] is optionally the substitute of the root @deva[प्याय्] 'to increase' before the @deva[निष्ठा] affixes.

61045: In a root, which in the system of grammatical instruction (i.e. the @deva[धातुपाठ]), ends with a diphthong (@deva[ए] , @deva[ऐ] , @deva[ओ], @deva[औ]), there is the substitution of @deva[आ] for the diphthong, provided that no affix with an indicatory @deva[श्] follows it.

61047: In the roots @deva[स्फुर्] and @deva[स्फुल्] 'to move', there is the substitution of the @deva[आ] for the diphthong when the affix @deva[घञ्] follows.
61048: The substitution of @deva[आ] for the diphthong takes place in the causatives of the roots @deva[क्री] 'to buy, to purchase', @deva[इ] 'to study' and @deva[जि] 'to conquer'.
61049: The substitution of @deva[आ] takes for the diphthong in the causative of @deva[सिध्] , when it does not refer to the next life.
61050: And there is substitution of @deva[आ] for the finals of @deva[मी] 'to hurt', @deva[मि] 'to scatter' and @deva[दी] 'to decay' when the affix @deva[ल्यप्] follows, as well as before those affixes which demand this substitution for the diphthong.
61051: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] for the final of @deva[ली] 'to adhere', in the @deva[धातुपाठ] , when the affix @deva[ल्यप्] follows or such an affix as would demand this substitution of the diphthong.
61052: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] in the room of the diphthong of the verb @deva[खिद्] 'to suffer pain', in the @deva[छन्दस्]।
61053: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] in the room of the diphthong of the root @deva[गुर्] 'to exert' when preceded by the preposition @deva[अप] and taking the affix @deva[णमुल्]।
61054: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] in the room of the diphthong of the roots @deva[चि] and @deva[स्फुर्] when in the Causative.
61055: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] in the room of the diphthong of the root @deva[वी] in the causative, when meaning 'to conceive an embryo'.
61056: There is optionally the substitution of @deva[आ] in the room of the diphthong of the root @deva[भी] 'to fear' in the causative, when the fear is produced directly through the agent of the causative.
61057: There is invariably the substitution of @deva[आ] for the diphthong of the root @deva[स्मि] 'to smile' in the causative, when the astonishment is produced directly through the agent of the causative.
61058: The augment @deva[अम्] (@deva[अ]) comes after the @deva[ऋ] or @deva[सृज्] 'to create' and @deva[दृश्] 'to see', when an affix beginning with a @deva[झल्] letter (the Mute and the Sibilant) follows: provided that it has no indicatory @deva[क]।
61059: The augment @deva[अम्] (@deva[अ]) augment comes optionally after the @deva[ऋ] of those roots which are exhibited in the @deva[धातुपाठ] as @deva[अनुदात्त] , when such roots end in a consonant having a @deva[ऋ] has penultimate and are followed by an affix beginning with a mute or sibilant and not having an indicatory @deva[क]।
61061: There is the substitution of this stem @deva[शीर्षन्] for @deva[शिरस्] when a @deva[तद्धित]-affix beginning with @deva[य] follows.
61062: There is the substitution of @deva[शीर्ष] for @deva[शीरस्] when a @deva[तद्धित]-affix beginning with a vowel follows.
61063: In the weak cases (beginning with the accusative plural) the following stems are substituted: @deva[पद] for @deva[पाद] , @deva[दत्] for @deva[दन्त] , @deva[नस्] for @deva[नासिका] , @deva[मास्] for @deva[मास] , @deva[हृद्] for @deva[हृदय] , @deva[निश] for @deva[निशा] , @deva[असन्] for @deva[असृज्] , @deva[यूषन्] for @deva[यूष] , @deva[दोषन्] for @deva[दास्] , @deva[यकन्] for @deva[यकृत्] , @deva[शकन्] for @deva[शकृत्] , @deva[उदन्] for @deva[उदक] and @deva[आसन्] for @deva[आस्य]।

61197: Whatever is derived with an affix having an indicatory @deva[ञ्] or @deva[न्] , has the acute accent invariably on the first syllable.
61198: The first syllable of a Vocative gets the acute accent.
61199: The acute accent is on the first syllable of @deva[पथिन्] and @deva[मथिन्] when followed by a strong case-ending.
61200: The Infinitive in @deva[तवै] has the acute on the first syllable and on the last syllable at one and the same time.
61201: The word @deva[क्षय] has the acute on the first syllable and on the last syllable at one and the same time.
61202: The acute accent falls on the first syllable of @deva[जय] , in the sense of 'whereby one attains victory'.
61203: The words @deva[वृष] etc. have the acute on the first syllable.
61204: The acute accent falls on the first syllable of that word with which something is likened, provided that it is a name.
61205: A disyllabic Participle in @deva[त] (@deva[निष्ठा]) when a Name has the acute on the first syllable, but not if the first syllable has an @deva[आ]।
61206: Also @deva[शुष्क] and @deva[धृष्ट] have acute on the first syllable.
61207: The word @deva[आशित] meaning 'having eaten' has acute on the first syllable.
61208: The word @deva[रिक्त] may have optionally the acute on the first syllable.
61209: In the @deva[छन्दस] , the words @deva[जुष्ट] and @deva[अर्पित] have optionally the acute on the first syllable.
61210: In the @deva[मन्त्राः] , these words @deva[जुष्ट] and @deva[अर्पित] have always the acute on the first syllable.
61211: The acute accent is on the first syllable of @deva[युष्मद्] and @deva[अस्मद्] in the Genitive Singular.
61212: The acute accent is on the first syllable of @deva[युष्मद्] and @deva[अस्मद्] in the Dative Singular.
61213: Whatever is formed by the affix @deva[यत्] , has, if it is a disyllabic word, the acute on the first syllable, with the exception of @deva[नाव्यः] from @deva[नौ]।
61214: The acute accent is on the first syllable of @deva[ईड्] , @deva[वन्द] , @deva[वृ] , @deva[शंस्] and @deva[दुह्] , when they are followed by the affix @deva[ण्यत्]।
61215: The acute accent is optionally on the first syllable of @deva[वेणु] and @deva[इन्धान]।
61216: The acute accent is optionally on the first syllables of @deva[त्याग] , @deva[राग] , @deva[हास] , @deva[कुह] , @deva[श्वठ] , and @deva[क्रथ]।
61217: What is formed by an affix having an indicatory @deva[र] , has acute on the penultimate syllable, the full word consisting of more than two syllables.
61218: The acute accent may be optionally on the penultimate syllable of the reduplicated Aorist in @deva[चङ्] , the word consisting of more than two syllables.
61219: The @deva[आ] before the affix @deva[मत्] has the acute accent, when the word is a name in the Feminine Gender.
61220: The Names ending in @deva[अवति] have the acute accent on the last syllable.
61221: The Names ending in @deva[ईवति] have the acute on the last syllable.
61222: In compound words ending in @deva[अञ्च्] , the final vowel of the preceding word has the acute accent in the weak cases in which only @deva[च्] of @deva[अञ्च्] remains.
61223: A compound word has the acute on the last syllable.
62001: In a @deva[बहुव्रीहि] @deva[समास] the first member preserves its own original accent.
62002: In a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] the first member preserves its original accent when it is a word - 1. meaning 'a resemblance' or 2. an Instrumental or 3. a Locative or 4. a word with which the second member is compared or 5. an indeclinable or 6. an Accusative or 7. a Future Passive Participle
62003: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when a word denoting colour is compounded with another colour denoting word but not so when it is the word @deva[एत]।
62004: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second term is @deva[गाध] or @deva[लवण] and the compound expresses 'a measure or mass'.
62005: In a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] having the word @deva[दायद्] as its second member, the first member denoting inheritance preserves its original accent.
62006: In a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] having the words @deva[चिर] or @deva[कृच्छ्र] as its second member, the first member, when it denotes that which experiences an obstacle, preserves its original accent.
62007: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[पद] denoting 'a pretext'.
62008: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[निवात] in the sense of 'a protection from wind'.
62009: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[शारद] having any other sense than that of 'autumnal'.
62010: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[अध्वर्यु] or @deva[कषाय] denoting a genus.
62011: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[सदृश] or @deva[प्रतिरूप] expressing resemblance with someone or something.
62012: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) denoting 'measure or quantity'.
62013: Before the word @deva[वाणिज] 'a trader' the first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its accent when it is a word specifying the place wither one has to go or the ware in which one deals.
62014: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the words 1. @deva[मात्रा] 2. @deva[उपज्ञा] 3. @deva[उपक्रम] and 4. @deva[छाया] when these words appear as neuter.
62015: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when its second term is @deva[सुख] or @deva[प्रिय] and the sense is 'to feel delight' or 'is good'.
62016: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when its second term is @deva[सुख] or @deva[प्रिय] and the sense is 'agreeable to one' or 'desired'.
62017: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when it denotes a thing possessed and when its second term is @deva[स्वामिन्]।
62018: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when it ends in @deva[पति] and means 'master' or 'lord'.
62019: The words @deva[भू] , @deva[वाक्] , @deva[चित्] and @deva[दिधिषू] however do not preserve their original accent in @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] when coming before the word @deva[पति] denoting 'master' or 'lord'.
62020: The word @deva[भुवन] may optionally keep its accent in a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] before the word @deva[पति] denoting 'master' or 'lord'.
62021: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent before words @deva[आशङ्क] , @deva[आबाध] and @deva[नेदीयस्] , when it treats about a supposition.
62022: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is the word @deva[पूर्व] and the sense is 'this had been lately…'.
62023: The first member of a @deva[तत्-पुरुष] @deva[समास] preserves its original accent when the second member is 1. @deva[सविध] 2. @deva[सनीड] 3. @deva[समर्याद] 4. @deva[सवेश] and 5. @deva[सदेश] in the sense of 'what can be found in the vicinity thereof'.
62024: The words @deva[विस्पष्ट] etc. preserve their accent when followed by an adjective word in a compound.
62025: In a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] the first member consisting of a @deva[भाव] (verbal noun) preserves its original accent before the adjective forms built from @deva[श्र] -- @deva[प्रशस्यस्य] @deva[श्रः] @ref[5.3.60], @deva[ज्य] -- @deva[ज्य] @deva[च] @ref[5.3.61], @deva[अवम] and @deva[कन्] -- @deva[युवाल्पयोः] @deva[कनन्यतरस्याम्] @ref[5.3.64], and before a form built from the word @deva[पाप]।
62026: In a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] the first member consisting of the word @deva[कुमार] preserves it original accent.
62027: In a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] of @deva[कुमार] followed by @deva[प्रत्येनस्] the acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) falls on the first syllable of @deva[कुमार]।
62028: The first syllable of @deva[कुमार] is optionally acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) when the second member is a word denoting 'the name of a horde'.
62029: In a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) the first member preserves its original accent before a stem ending in a simple vowel with the exception of @deva[अ] (@deva[इक्]) before a word denoting time, as well as before 1. @deva[कपाल] 2. @deva[भगाल] and 3. @deva[शराव]।
62030: In a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) the word @deva[बहु] may optionally preserve its accent when followed by an @deva[इक्]-ending stem or by a time-word or by 1. @deva[कपाल] 2. @deva[भगाल] and 3. @deva[शराव]।
62031: In a @deva[द्विगु] @deva[समास] (Numeral Determinative Compound) the first member may optionally preserve its accent when followed by the words @deva[दिष्टि] and @deva[वितस्ति]।as its second members.
62032: When a word ending in the Locative -7th case does not denote time preserves its original accent when followed by 1. @deva[सिद्ध] 2. @deva[शुष्क] 3. @deva[पक्व] and 4. @deva[बन्ध] in a compound.
62033: The particles 1. @deva[परि] 2. @deva[प्रति] 3. @deva[उप] and 4. @deva[अप] preserve their accent before that word which specifies an exclusion or a portion of day and night (in an @deva[अव्ययीभाव] @deva[समास] also).
62034: The first member of a @deva[द्वन्द] @deva[समास] formed of names denoting the @deva[क्षत्रिय] (warrior) clans in the plural number retains its original accent when the warrior belongs to the clan of @deva[अन्धक] or @deva[वृष्णि]।
62035: The numeral word standing as the first member of a @deva[द्वन्द] @deva[समास] , preserves its accent.
62036: When words denoting scholars are named after their teachers and are compounded into a @deva[द्वन्द] @deva[समास] the first member retains its accent.
62037: Also in the @deva[द्वन्द] @deva[समास]-s @deva[कार्तकौजप] etc. the first members retain their accent.
62038: The word @deva[महत्] (@deva[महा]) retains its accent before the following - 1. @deva[व्रीहि] 2. @deva[अपराह्ण] 3. @deva[गृष्टि] 4. @deva[इष्वास] 5. @deva[जाबाल] 6. @deva[भार] 7. @deva[भारत] 8. @deva[हैलिहिल] 9. @deva[रौरव] and 10. @deva[प्रवृद्धे]।
62039: The words @deva[महत्] and @deva[क्षुल्लक] retain their accent before the word @deva[वैश्वदेव]।
62040: The word @deva[उष्ट्र] retains its accent before @deva[सादि] and @deva[वामि]।
62041: The word @deva[गो] retains its accent before 1. @deva[साद] 2. @deva[सादि] and 3. @deva[सारथि]।
62042: The first member retains its accent in the following - 1. @deva[कुरु-गार्हपत] 2. @deva[रिक्त-गुरु] 3. @deva[असूत-जरती] 4. @deva[अश्लील-दृढ-रूपा] 5. @deva[पारे-वडवा] 6. @deva[तैतिल-कद्रूः] 7. @deva[पण्य-कम्बलः] and 8. @deva[दासीभार] etc.
62043: A word in the Dative -4th Case as the first member retains its accent when the second member expresses that which is suited to become the former.
62044: Before the word @deva[अर्थ] the first member in the Dative -4th Case retains its accent.
62045: The first member in the Dative -4th Case retains its accent before a Past Participle in @deva[क्त]।
62046: Before the Past Participle in @deva[क्त] the first member when it itself is not a Past Participle, retains its original accent in a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] ।
62047: Before the Past Participle in @deva[क्त] , a word ending in the Accusative -2nd case retains its accent when it does not mean a separation.
62048: A word ending in the Instrumental -3rd case retains its accent before the Past Participle in @deva[क्त] when it has a Passive meaning.
62049: A word called @deva[गति] -- @deva[गतिश्च] @ref[1.4.60], when standing immediately before a Participle in @deva[क्त] having a Passive significance, retains its accent.
62050: An immediately preceding @deva[गति] -- @deva[गतिश्च] @ref[1.4.60], retains its original accent before (a word formed by) a @deva[कृत्]-affix beginning with @deva[त्] which as an indicatory @deva[न्] but before @deva[तु]।
62051: An immediately preceding @deva[गति] -- @deva[गतिश्च] @ref[1.4.60], retains its original accent before an Infinitive in @deva[तवै] -- @deva[कृत्यार्थे] @deva[तवैकेन्केन्यत्वनः] @ref[3.4.14], but whereby simultaneously the final has the acute as well.
62052: An immediately preceding @deva[गति] -- @deva[गतिश्च] @ref[1.4.60], not ending in @deva[इ] or @deva[उ] retains its accent before an affix having a @deva[व्] follows.
62053: The @deva[गति]-s @deva[नि] and @deva[अधि] however retain their original accent before @deva[अञ्च्] when the affix @deva[व्] follows.
62054: The word @deva[ईषत्] when the first member of a compound may optionally preserve its original accent.
62055: The first member denoting the quantity of gold retains optionally its original accent before the word @deva[धन]।
62056: The word @deva[प्रथम] when first in a compound optionally retains its original accent when meaning 'a novice'.
62057: The words @deva[कतर] and @deva[कतम] when as first member of a compound optionally retain their original accent in a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास]।
62058: The word @deva[आर्य] optionally retains its original accent in a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] before the words @deva[ब्राह्मण] and @deva[कुमार]।
62059: The word @deva[राजन्] optionally retains its original accent in a @deva[कर्मधारय] @deva[समास] before the words @deva[ब्राह्मण] and @deva[कुमार]।
62060: The word @deva[राजन्] ending in Genitive 6th-Case optionally retains its original accent before the word @deva[प्रत्येनस्]।
62061: A word having the sense of 'always' optionally retains its original accent before a Past Participle in @deva[क्त] ।
62062: The word @deva[ग्राम] when first member of a compound optionally retains its original accent before a word denoting 'a professional man or artisan'.
62063: The word @deva[राजन्] optionally retains its original accent after a profession-denoting noun when praise is expressed.
62064: In the following up to -- @deva[न] @deva[भूताधिकसंजीवमद्राश्मकज्जलम्] @ref[6.2.91], inclusive, the phrase 'the first syllable in -(the word standing in the Nominative 1st-Case) has the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त])' is always to be supplied.
62065: If the first member of a compound is in the Locative -7th case or denoting the name of the Receiver of Tax, has acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) first syllable, when the second member is a word denoting 'what is lawful', but not when it is @deva[हरण]।
62066: The first member of a compound has acute on the first syllable when the second member denotes that by whom the things denoted by the first are regulated or kept in order.
62067: The acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable is optional when the word @deva[अध्यक्ष] follows.
62068: The word @deva[पाप] is optionally acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when followed by a word denoting a professional man.
62069: The first syllable of the first member of a compound is acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) before a @deva[गोत्र] (Patronymic) name or a Scholar-name and also before @deva[माणव] and @deva[ब्राह्मण] when a reproach is meant.
62070: The first syllable of the word preceding @deva[मैरेय] gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) when it denotes the ingredient of the same.
62071: A word denoting food gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when before a word which denotes a repository suited to contain that.
62072: A word denoting the object of comparison gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when standing before @deva[गो] , @deva[बिडाल] , @deva[सिंह] and @deva[सैन्धव]।
62073: A word denoting the object of comparison gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when the second member is a word ending in the affix @deva[अक] and the compound expresses a calling by which one gets his living.
62074: A compound, the second member of which is a word ending in affix @deva[अक] and which denotes the sport of the Eastern people, gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable.
62075: A compound, the second member of which is a word ending in the @deva[कृत्] -affix @deva[अण्] and which denotes a functionary, gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable.
62076: And when such a compound ending in @deva[अण्] -affix denotes the name of a professional man, but not when the second term @deva[कार](derived from @deva[कृञ्]), the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) is on the first syllable of the first word.
62077: Also when such an @deva[उपपद] compound ending in @deva[अण्] -affix denotes a Name, the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) falls on the first syllable but not when the second term is @deva[कार]।
62078: The words 1. @deva[गो] 2. @deva[तन्ति] and 3. @deva[यव] get the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when followed by @deva[पाल]।
62079: A compound ending in @deva[कृत्] -affix @deva[णिनि] (@deva[इन्]) has the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable of the first member.
62080: When the first member of a compound expresses that with which resemblance is denoted then it has acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable before a word formed by @deva[णिनि] (@deva[इन्]) affix, only then, when such latter word is radical without any preposition and means 'giving out a definite sound like so and so'.
62081: The compounds @deva[युक्तारोहिन्] etc. have acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable.
62082: When the first member is a word ending in a long vowel or is 1. @deva[काश] 2. @deva[तुष] 3. @deva[भ्राष्ट्र] 4. @deva[वट] and is followed by @deva[ज] , the acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) falls on the first syllable.
62083: In a word consisting of more than two syllables followed by @deva[ज] , the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) falls on the syllable before the last.
62084: Before @deva[ग्राम] the first syllable of the first member as acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) when thereby inhabitants are not meant.
62085: The first member has acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when followed by @deva[घोषा] etc.
62086: The words @deva[छात्रि] etc. get acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when followed by the word @deva[शाला]।
62087: The first member which has not a @deva[वृद्धि] in the first syllable or which is not @deva[कर्की] etc. gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable before @deva[प्रस्थ]।
62088: The first syllable of @deva[माला] etc. gets the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) when @deva[प्रस्थ] follows.
62089: The first member has an acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable before the word @deva[नगर] but not when it is the word @deva[महत्] or @deva[नव] , nor when it refers to a city in the lands of the Northern People.
62090: A word of two or three syllables ending in a @deva[अ] or @deva[आ] (with the exception of @deva[महा] and @deva[नव]) standing before the word @deva[अर्म] has acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable.
62091: The following words do not get acute accent (@deva[उदात्त]) on the first syllable when standing before @deva[अर्म] etc. - 1. @deva[भूत] 2. @deva[अधिक] 3. @deva[संजीव] 4. @deva[मद्र] 5. @deva[अश्मन्] and 6. @deva[कञ्जल]।
62092: In the following sūtras up to @deva[निष्ठोपसर्गपूर्वमन्यतरस्याम्] @ref[6.2.110], inclusive, is to be supplied the phrase 'the last syllable in a word standing in the Nominative 1st-Case has the acute accent (@deva[उदात्त])'.

63113: 1. @deva[साढ्यै] 2. @deva[साढ्वा] and 3. @deva[साढा] are irregularly formed in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
63114: In the following sūtras up to the end of the @deva[पाद] are to be supplied the words 'in an uninterrupted flow of speech'.
63115: Before @deva[कर्ण] there is the substitution of a long vowel for the final of the preceding word when it denotes a proprietorship mark or the ears of cattle, but not when the words 1. @deva[विष्ट] 2. @deva[अष्टन्] 3. @deva[पञ्चन्] 4. @deva[मणि] 5. @deva[भिन्न] 6. @deva[छिन्न] 7. @deva[छिद्र] 8. @deva[स्रुव] and 9. @deva[स्वस्तिक]।
63116: A long vowel is substituted for the final vowel of the preceding word, before the verbs 1. @deva[नह्] 2. @deva[वृत्] 3. @deva[वृष्] 4. @deva[व्यध्] 5. @deva[रुच्] 6. @deva[सह्] and 7. @deva[तन्] when these roots take the affix @deva[क्वि]।
63117: For the final vowel of @deva[कोटर] etc. a long vowel is substituted before @deva[वन] and also of @deva[किंशुलक] etc. before @deva[गिरि] when the compound is a name.
63118: The final of the preceding word is lengthened before the affix @deva[वल]।
63119: The final vowel of a word consisting of more than two syllables in lengthened before the affix @deva[मत्] when it is a name, but not of the words @deva[अजिर्] etc.
63120: The final vowel of @deva[शर] etc. is lengthened before @deva[मत्] when it is a name.
63121: The final @deva[इ] and the @deva[उ] of a word with the exception of @deva[पीलु] are lengthened before @deva[वह]।
63122: The final vowel of a preposition is diversely lengthened before a word formed by the @deva[कृत्] affix @deva[घञ्] but not when the compound denotes a human being.
63123: A preposition ending in @deva[इ] or @deva[उ] lengthens its final before @deva[काश]।
63124: A preposition ending in @deva[इ] or @deva[उ] lengthens its final before the verb @deva[दा] when the latter is changed to @deva[त]।
63125: A long vowel is substituted for the final of @deva[अष्टन्] before a second member, when the compound is a Name.
63126: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) also, the long vowel is substituted for the final of @deva[अष्टन्] before a second member.
63127: The final word of @deva[चिति] is lengthened before the affix @deva[कप्]।
63128: The final vowel of @deva[विश्व] is lengthened before @deva[वसु] and @deva[राट्] (the form assumed by @deva[राज्]).
63129: The final vowel of @deva[विश्व] is lengthened before @deva[नर] when the compound is a Name.
63130: The final vowel of @deva[विश्व] is lengthened before @deva[मित्र] when it is the name of a @deva[ऋषि]।
63131: In a @deva[मन्त्र] the final vowels of 1. @deva[सोम] 2. @deva[अश्व] 3. @deva[इन्द्रिय] and 4. @deva[विश्वदेव्य] are lengthened when the affix @deva[मतुप्] follows.
63132: In a @deva[मन्त्र] the final of @deva[ओषधि] is lengthened before the case-endings but not in the Nominative 1st-Case.
63133: In the @deva[ऋग्वेद] the finals of the particles 1. @deva[तु] 2. @deva[नु] 3. @deva[घ] 4. @deva[मक्षु] , the tense-affix @deva[तङ्] , @deva[कु] the ending @deva[त्र] and the word @deva[उरुष्य] are lengthened.
63134: In a @deva[मन्त्र] the finals of the preceding member ending in @deva[इ] or @deva[उ] are lengthened before the particle @deva[सु]।
63135: A tense affix ending in @deva[अ] is lengthened in the @deva[ऋग्वेद] when the verb consists of two syllables.
63136: In the @deva[ऋग्वेद] the final of a particle is lengthened.
63137: The elongation of the final is to be found in other words also.
63138: The final vowel of the preceding member is lengthened before @deva[अञ्च] when it assumes the form @deva[च] having lost its nasal and the vowel.
63139: The vowel substituted for a semi-vowel is lengthened when it stands as the first member of a compound.
64001: Whatever will be taught here after up to the end of the 7th @deva[अध्याय] is consequent upon the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem).
64002: The long vowel is substituted for a vocalised half-vowel @deva[अ] , @deva[इ] and @deva[उ] at the end of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem), when it is preceded by a consonant which is a portion of the stem.
64003: The long vowel is substituted for the final of the stem before the Genitive 6th-Case plural affix @deva[नाम्] (having the augment @deva[नुट्]).
64004: The finals of @deva[तिसृ] and @deva[चतसृ] are not lengthened before @deva[नाम्] (having the augment @deva[नुट्]).
64005: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) the finals of @deva[तिसृ] and @deva[चतसृ] are found in both ways, before the Genitive 6th-Case plural @deva[नाम्]।
64006: So also @deva[नृ] before the Genitive 6th-Case plural @deva[नाम्] is optionally lengthened.
64007: In a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[न्] the preceding vowel is lengthened before the affix @deva[नाम्] ।
64008: In a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[न्] the preceding vowel is lengthened in strong cases with the exception of the Vocative Case singular.
64009: The lengthening of the penultimate vowel of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[न्] , before the affixes of the strong-case, is optional in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) when @deva[ष] precedes such a vowel.
64010: In the strong cases with the exception of Vocative Case singular, the penultimate vowel is lengthened in the case of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[स्] with a Nasal consonant preceding it, and of @deva[महत्]।
64011: In the strong cases, with the exception of the Vocative Case singular, the penultimate vowel is lengthened in @deva[अप्] in stems formed by @deva[तृन्] and @deva[तृच्] affixes and in 1. @deva[स्वसृ] 2. @deva[नप्तृ] 3. @deva[नेष्टृ] 4. @deva[त्वष्टृ] 5. @deva[क्षत्तृ] 6. @deva[होतृ] 7. @deva[पोतृ] and 9. @deva[प्रशास्तॄ]।
64012: The penultimate vowel is lengthened before the affix @deva[शि] (Nominative 1st-Case and Accusative -2nd case plural) when the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ends in @deva[इन्] or @deva[हन्] or @deva[पूषन्] or @deva[अर्यमन्]।
64013: The penultimate vowels of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[इन्] , @deva[हन्] , @deva[पूषन्] or @deva[अर्यमन्] are lengthened before the @deva[सु] of the Nominative 1st-Case singular but not in Vocative Case singular.
64014: In the Nominative 1st-Case singular (with the exception of the Vocative Case singular) the penultimate vowel is lengthened in a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अतु] and @deva[अस्] when the consonant (@deva[अस्]) does not belong to a root.
64015: The penultimate vowel of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in a nasal is lengthened before the affix @deva[क्वि] and before an affix having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] which begins with a consonant other than a semi-vowel or a nasal.
64016: The lengthening of the vowel takes place in the case of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in a vowel, as well as of @deva[हन्] and @deva[गम्] when the Desiderative affix @deva[सन्] being @deva[झलादि] (i.e. not taking the augment @deva[इट्]) follows.
64017: the lengthened of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) of @deva[तन्] is optional before the Desiderative @deva[सन्] when it does not take the augment @deva[इट्]।
64018: The penultimate of @deva[क्रम] is optionally lengthened before the affix @deva[क्त्वा] when it is without the augment @deva[इट्]।
64019: For @deva[च्छ] (including the augment @deva[तुक्]) is substituted @deva[श्] and for @deva[व्] is substituted @deva[ऊठ्] before an affix beginning with a nasal as well as before @deva[क्वि] and @deva[झलादि] @deva[ङित्] and @deva[कित्] affixes -- @deva[अनुनासिकस्य] @deva[क्विझलोः] @deva[क्ङिति] @ref[6.4.15].
64020: In 1. @deva[ज्वर] 2. @deva[त्वर्] 3. @deva[श्रिव्] 4. @deva[अव] and 5. @deva[मव्] before the above mentioned affixes (@deva[क्वि] and @deva[झलादि] @deva[ङित्] and @deva[कित्] affixes -- @deva[अनुनासिकस्य] @deva[क्विझलोः] @deva[क्ङिति] @ref[6.4.15]) there is the single substitution of @deva[ऊठ्] for the and the vowel preceding the final consonant.
64021: After @deva[र्] there is the elision of @deva[छ्] and @deva[व्] before @deva[क्वि] and @deva[झलादि] @deva[ङित्] and @deva[कित्] affixes -- @deva[अनुनासिकस्य] @deva[क्विझलोः] @deva[क्ङिति] @ref[6.4.15].
64022: The change which is a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) will undergo by the application of any of the rules from this sūtra up to @deva[भस्य] @ref[6.4.129], is to be considered as not to have taken effect when we have to apply any other rule of this very section @ref[6.4.23] to @ref[6.4.129].
64023: After @deva[न] which is added to the roots of the @deva[रुधादिगणः] (7th Conjugation) as a @deva[गणविकरण] - @deva[श्नम्] (characteristic), there is the elision of the following @deva[न]।
64024: In a root-@deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in a consonant preceded by @deva[न्] - this @deva[न] not being added to the root owing to its having an indicatory @deva[इ] -- @deva[इदितो] @deva[नुम्] @deva[धातोः] @ref[7.1.58], the @deva[न्] is elided when an affix having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] follows.
64025: The nasal of 1. @deva[दंश्] 2. @deva[संज्] and 3. @deva[स्वञ्ज] is elided before the @deva[गणविकरण] @deva[शप्] of the roots of the @deva[भ्वादिगणः] (1st Conjugation).
64026: The nasal of @deva[रञ्ज्] is also elided before the @deva[गणविकरण] @deva[शप्]।
64027: The penultimate nasal of @deva[रञ्ज्] is elided before @deva[घञ्] when the word formed with it expresses a state or an instrument.
64028: The word @deva[स्यद्] is formed by @deva[घञ्] in the sense of 'speed'.
64029: 1. @deva[अवोद] 2. @deva[एध] 3. @deva[ओद्म] 4. @deva[प्रश्रथ] and 5. @deva[हिमश्रथ] are irregularly formed by the elision.
64030: The nasal of @deva[अञ्च्] is not elided when meaning is to honour.
64031: @deva[स्कन्दि] and @deva[स्यन्द] retain their nasal before the affix @deva[क्त]।
64032: The nasal may be optionally elided before @deva[क्त्वा] in a root ending in @deva[ज्] and in @deva[नश्]।
64033: The nasal may be optionally elided in @deva[भञ्ज] before the 3rd person passive of the Aorist in @deva[चिण्] (@deva[ई]).
64034: Before the Aorist in @deva[अङ्] and before an affix beginning with a consonant having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] there is the substitution of @deva[ई] for the vowel of @deva[शास्]।
64035: Before the Imperative affix @deva[हि] , @deva[शा] is substituted for @deva[शास्]।
64036: @deva[ज] is substituted for @deva[हन्] before the Imperative affix @deva[हि]।
64037: The final nasal of those roots which in the @deva[धातुपाठ] have an accented root-vowel, as well as of @deva[वन] , @deva[तन] etc. (@deva[तनादिगणः] -8th Conjugation) is elided before an affix beginning with a consonant (except a semi-vowel or nasal) when these have an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64038: The nasal above the roots (i.e. @deva[अनुदात्त] ending in a nasal and @deva[वन] and @deva[तनादि]) is optionally elided before the Absolutive affix @deva[ल्यप्]।
64039: Before the affix @deva[क्तिच्] the above roots (@deva[वन] and @deva[तनादि]) neither drop their nasal nor lengthen their root-vowel.
64040: The nasal of @deva[गम्] is always elided before @deva[क्वि]।
64041: A stem ending in a nasal and followed by the affix @deva[विट्] or @deva[वन्] always substitutes for long @deva[आ] for its nasal.
64042: The long @deva[आ] is substituted for the final of @deva[जन्] , @deva[सन्] and @deva[खन्] before the consonant beginning Desiderative affix @deva[सन्] and before any other affix beginning with a @deva[इल्] consonant which has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64043: There is optionally the substitution of long @deva[आ] for the finals of @deva[जन्] , @deva[सन्] and @deva[खन्] before the affix beginning with @deva[य] and marked with an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64044: The long @deva[आ] is optionally substituted for the final of @deva[तन्] before the Passive characteristic @deva[यक्]।
64045: The long @deva[आ] is optionally substituted for the final of @deva[सन्] before the affix @deva[क्तिच्] and there is also optional elision of the nasal.
64046: From this up to @deva[युप्लुवोर्दीर्घश्छन्दसि] @ref[6.4.68], inclusive, is always to be supplied the words ' before an affix called @deva[आर्धधातुक] -- @deva[आर्द्धधातुकं] @deva[शेषः] @ref[3.4.114] etc.'
64047: In the room of @deva[र्] and the penultimate letter @deva[स्] of the root @deva[भ्रस्ज] , there is optionally the substitute @deva[रम्] when an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix follows.
64048: The @deva[अ] standing at the end of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is elided before an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix.
64049: When a consonant precedes the final @deva[य] in a verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) this @deva[य] is also elided before an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix.
64050: The elision of @deva[य] of he Denominative @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) (@deva[क्य]) is optional when preceded by a consonant and followed by an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix.
64051: The @deva[इ] of the verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) formed with the affix @deva[णि] is elided before an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix which does not take the augment @deva[इट्] ।
64052: The affix @deva[णि] is elided before the affixes @deva[क्त] and @deva[क्तवतु] when these take the augment @deva[इट्] ।
64053: In a @deva[मन्त्र] the word @deva[जनिता] is formed irregularly by the elision of @deva[णि] before the affix @deva[तृ] with the augment @deva[इट्] ।
64054: @deva[शमिता] is formed irregularly by the elision of @deva[णि] before an @deva[इट्] augmented affix when meaning a sacrificial act.
64055: @deva[अय्] is substituted for the @deva[इ] of @deva[णि] before the affixes 1. @deva[आम्] 2. @deva[अन्त] 3. @deva[आलु] 4. @deva[आय्य] 5. @deva[इत्नु] and 6. @deva[इष्णु]।
64056: @deva[अय्] is substituted for the @deva[इ] of @deva[णि] before the Absolutive affix @deva[ल्यप्] when the vowel preceding the @deva[इ] is light.
64057: @deva[अय्] is optionally substituted for the @deva[इ] of @deva[णि] before the Absolutive affix @deva[ल्यप्] , after the verb @deva[आप्]।
64058: In @deva[यु] and @deva[प्लु] , long is substituted for @deva[उ] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
64059: A long is substituted for the @deva[इ] of @deva[क्षि] before the Absolutive affix @deva[ल्यप्]।
64060: A long is substituted for the @deva[इ] in @deva[क्षि] before the Past Participle in @deva[क्त] when it is not in the sense of the future Passive Participle in @deva[ण्यत्]।
64061: The long is optionally substituted for the @deva[इ] in @deva[क्षि] before the Past Participle in @deva[क्त] when it is not in the sense of the future Passive Participle in @deva[ण्यत्] when the word means 'imprecation' or 'a miserable plight'.
64062: Before the affixes 1. @deva[स्य] (First future and Conditional) 2. @deva[सिच्] (S-Aorist) 3. @deva[सीयुद्] (Benedictive) and 4. @deva[तासि] (Periphrastic Future), when they are used in the @deva[भाव] (Impersonal) and @deva[कर्म] (Passive) voices 1. the verbal stems ending in a vowel in the Grammatical system of instruction (@deva[उपदेश]), as well as the verbs 2. @deva[हन्] 'to kill' 3. @deva[ग्रह्] 'to seize' and 4. @deva[दृश्] 'to see' are treated optionally in the same way as in the 3rd Person of the Passive Aorist in @deva[चिण्] and when so treated, they have the augment @deva[इट्] ।
64063: @deva[युट्] is the augment of @deva[दीङ्] of an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix beginning with a vowel and having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64064: The final @deva[आ] of a root is elided before an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix with the augment @deva[इट्] as well as when it begins with a vowel and has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64065: The final @deva[आ] of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is changed into @deva[ई] before the @deva[कृत्] affix @deva[यत्]।
64066: For the final of the roots of the form of @deva[दा] and @deva[घा] (@deva[घु]), as well as for that of the roots 1. @deva[मा] 2. @deva[स्था] 3. @deva[गा] 4. @deva[पा] 5. @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहाति]) and 6. @deva[सा] (@deva[सो]), there is substituted @deva[ई] before an @deva[आर्धधातुक] affix beginning with a consonant which has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64067: @deva[ए] is substituted for the @deva[आ] of the above roots (1. @deva[मा] 2. @deva[स्था] 3. @deva[गा] 4. @deva[पा] 5. @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहाति]) and 6. @deva[सा] (@deva[सो])) in the Benedictive Mood Active.
64068: For the final @deva[आ] of any other root than those mentioned in @deva[घुमास्थागापाजहातिसां] @deva[हलि] @ref[6.4.66], @deva[ए] may optionally be substituted in the Benedictive active, when the root begins with a conjunct consonant.
64069: The @deva[ई] substitution for @deva[आ] under sūtra @deva[घुमास्थागापाजहातिसां] @deva[हलि] @ref[6.4.66] does not apply when the absolutive affix @deva[ल्यप्] follows 1. @deva[मा] 2. @deva[स्था] 3. @deva[गा] 4. @deva[पा] 5. @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहाति]) 6. @deva[सा] and 7. @deva[घु]।
64070: @deva[इ] may optionally be substituted for the @deva[आ] of @deva[मा] (@deva[मयति]) before @deva[ल्यप्] ।
64071: @deva[अट्] acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) is the augment of the verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) in the Aorist, Imperfect and the Conditional.
64072: @deva[आट्] acutely accented (@deva[उदात्त]) is the augment of a verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) beginning with a vowel in the Aorist, Imperfect and the Conditional.
64073: The @deva[आट्] augment is found in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) also.
64074: In connection with the prohibitive particle @deva[मा] the augment @deva[अट्] or @deva[आट्] is not added in the Aorist, Imperfect and the Conditional.
64075: There is diversity in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) : the augment @deva[अट्] or @deva[आट्] is added even with @deva[मा] and sometimes not added even there is no @deva[मा]।
64076: @deva[रे] is diversely substituted for @deva[इरे] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
64077: Before an affix beginning with a vowel there are substituted for @deva[उ] of @deva[नु] , the characteristic of the roots of the @deva[स्वादिगणः] (5th Conjugation) for the final @deva[इ] , @deva[ई] , @deva[उ] and @deva[ऊ] of a root, as well as for @deva[ऊ] of @deva[भ्रू] , the @deva[इय्] (for @deva[इ] or @deva[ई]) and @deva[उव्] (for @deva[उ] or @deva[ऊ]).
64078: @deva[इवङ्] and @deva[उवङ्] are substituted for the @deva[इ] and @deva[उ] of a reduplicate, before a non-homogeneous vowel.
64079: @deva[इवङ्] is substituted for the @deva[ई] of @deva[स्त्री] before an affix beginning with a vowel.
64080: The substitution of @deva[इवङ्] for the @deva[ई] of @deva[स्त्री] is optional before the Accusative -2nd case-endings @deva[अम्] and @deva[शस्] (@deva[अस्]).
64081: For the @deva[इ] of the root @deva[इण्] (@deva[एति]) is substituted a semi-vowel (@deva[य]) before the affix beginning with a vowel.
64082: A semi-vowel is substituted before an affix beginning with a vowel for the final of @deva[इ] or @deva[ई] of a root, not preceded by a conjunct consonant forming part of the root, when the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is mono-syllabic.
64083: When a case-affix beginning with a vowel follows, then the semi-vowel @deva[व्] is substituted for the final @deva[ऊ] of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) containing more than one syllable if the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ends with a verbal root ending in @deva[ऊ] not preceded by a conjunct consonant forming part of the root.
64084: The semi-vowel @deva[व्] is substituted for the @deva[ऊ] of @deva[वर्षाभू] also when a case-affix beginning with a vowel follows.
64085: The semi-vowel substitution does not take place in the case of @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) ending in @deva[भू] or the word @deva[सुधी] before affixes beginning with a vowel.
64086: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas), in the case of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) in @deva[भू] or the word @deva[सुधी] , are found sometimes the @deva[इवङ्] and @deva[उवङ्] and sometimes the semi-vowel substitution.
64087: The semi-vowel @deva[व्] is substituted for the @deva[उ] of @deva[हु] and for that of @deva[नु] (the characteristic of @deva[स्वादिगणः] (5th Conjugation), before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] affix -- @deva[तिङ्शित्सार्वधातुकम्] @ref[3.4.113], beginning with a vowel when the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) consists of more than one syllable and the @deva[उ] is not preceded by a conjunct consonant.
64088: @deva[भू] gets the augment @deva[व्] (@deva[वुक्]) before the tense-affixes of the Aorist and the Perfect, when beginning with a vowel.
64089: For the penultimate @deva[ओ] of the @deva[गुण]-ated @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) @deva[गोह्] (from @deva[गुह्]) there is the substituted @deva[ऊ] before an affix beginning with a vowel.
64090: The @deva[ओ] of @deva[दोष्] is replaced by @deva[ऊ] before the causative @deva[णि]।
64091: The @deva[ओ] of @deva[दोष्] is optionally replaced by @deva[ऊ] when the sense is that of the disturbing of the mind.
64092: The roots having an indicatory @deva[म्] retain their penultimate short vowel before the causative @deva[णि]।
64093: Optionally a long may be substituted for the penultimate of the causative of @deva[मित्] roots, before the third person of the Passive Aorist in @deva[चिण्] (@deva[इ]) and before the Absolutive affix @deva[णमुल्] (@deva[अम्]).
64094: The penultimate of the Causative @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is shortened before the affix @deva[खच्]।
64095: The penultimate of the Causative of @deva[ह्लद्] (@deva[ह्लादि]) is shortened before the Participle affixes @deva[क्त] and @deva[क्तवतु]।
64096: The penultimate of @deva[चुरादि] (10th Conjugation) - @deva[छद्] is shortened before the affix @deva[घ] -- @deva[पुंसि] @deva[संज्ञायां] @deva[घः] @deva[प्रायेण] @ref[3.3.118], when not preceded by two prepositions (or more).
64097: The penultimate of @deva[छादि] is shortened before the affixes 1. @deva[इस्] 2. @deva[मन्] 3. @deva[त्रन्] and 4. @deva[क्वि]।
64098: The root-vowel of 1. @deva[गम्] 2. @deva[जन्] 3. @deva[खन्] and 4. @deva[घस्] is elided before an affix beginning with a vowel when it has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] ; but not before the Aorist affix @deva[अङ्]।
64099: In the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) the root-vowel of @deva[तन्] and @deva[पत्] is elided before an affix beginning with a vowel, when it has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] ।
64100: The root-vowel of @deva[घस्] and @deva[भस्] is elided in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) before any affix whether beginning with a vowel or a consonant which has an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] ।
64101: After @deva[हु] and after a consonant (with the exception of semi-vowels and nasals), @deva[धि] is substituted for the Imperative affix @deva[हि] when the latter does not take the augment @deva[इट्] ।
64102: @deva[धि] is substituted for the Imperative affix @deva[हि] in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas) after 1. @deva[श्रु] 2. @deva[शृणु] 3. @deva[पॄ] 4. @deva[कृ] and 5. @deva[वृ]।
64103: @deva[धि] is substituted for the Imperative affix @deva[हि] when the tense-affix is not @deva[ङित्]।
64104: The personal endings are elided after @deva[चिण्] , the 3rd person singular Passive of Aorist.
64105: The Imperative affix @deva[हि] is elided after a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in short @deva[अ]।
64106: The Imperative affix @deva[हि] is elided after the @deva[उ] of an affix in the @deva[विकरण] with which the Present-@deva[अङ्ग] (stem) (special conjugation) is made, provided that the @deva[उ] is not preceded by a conjunct consonant.
64107: The @deva[पु] of the @deva[विकरण] @deva[उ] and @deva[श्नु] when not preceded by a conjunct consonant, may be elided optionally before a personal affix beginning with @deva[म्] or @deva[व्]।
64108: The elision of @deva[उ] is invariable before @deva[व्] and @deva[म्] in the case of @deva[कृ] 'to make' (@deva[करोति]).
64109: The affix @deva[उ] of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) @deva[कुरु] is always elided before a personal ending beginning with a @deva[य्]।
64110: Before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] affix with an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्] , short @deva[उ] is substituted for the @deva[अ] if @deva[कृ] 'to make' (@deva[कर्] + @deva[उ]) when @deva[गुण]-ated.
64111: Before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] affix, the @deva[अ] of @deva[श्न] and @deva[अस्] is elided.
64112: Before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] affix beginning with a vowel, the long @deva[आ] of @deva[श्ना] (the @deva[विकरण] of the @deva[क्र्यादिगणः] (9th Conjugation)) and of the reduplicate @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) is elided.
64113: Before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] affix beginning with a consonant, the @deva[आ] of @deva[श्ना] (the @deva[विकरण] of the @deva[क्र्यादिगणः] (9th Conjugation)) and of the reduplicate @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) is replaced by @deva[ई] except when the root is @deva[दा] 'to give' or @deva[धा] (@deva[धु]).
64114: @deva[इ] is substituted for the @deva[आ] of @deva[दरिद्रा] before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] affix beginning with a consonant.
64115: @deva[इ] is substituted for the @deva[ई] of @deva[भी] before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] affix beginning with a consonant and having an indicatory @deva[क्] or @deva[ङ्]।
64116: @deva[इ] is optionally substituted for the @deva[आ] of @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहोत्यादिगणः] (3rd Conjugation)) before a @deva[सार्वधातुक] affix @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] beginning with a consonant.
64117: @deva[आ] and @deva[इ] are optionally substituted for the final of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) of @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहोत्यादिगणः] (3rd Conjugation)) before the Imperative ending @deva[हि]।
64118: The final of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) of @deva[हा] (@deva[जुहोत्यादिगणः] (3rd Conjugation)) is elided before an affix beginning with @deva[य्] being a @deva[सार्वधातुक] @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] affix.
64119: For the final vowel of the roots @deva[दा] and @deva[धा] (@deva[धु]) and for the @deva[स्] of @deva[अस्] , is substituted @deva[ए] before the Imperative ending @deva[हि] and thereby the reduplicated syllable of @deva[दा] and @deva[धा] (@deva[धु]) is elided.
64120: @deva[ए] is substituted for the short @deva[अ] standing between two simple consonants of a verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem), before the personal endings of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) which have an indicatory @deva[क्] -- @deva[असंयोगाल्लिट्] @deva[कित्] @ref[1.2.5], provided that, at the beginning of the root, in the reduplication, no other consonant has been substituted and when this @deva[ए] is substituted, the reduplicate is elided.
64121: @deva[ए] is substituted for @deva[अ] of a verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) standing between two simple consonants, the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) not having any different letter substituted in the reduplicate when the ending @deva[थल्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having the augment @deva[इट्] follows and thereby the reduplicate is elided.
64122: @deva[ए] is substituted for @deva[अ] of 1. @deva[तॄ] 2. @deva[फल] 3. @deva[भज] and 4. @deva[त्रप] and the reduplicate is elided when the affixes of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having an indicatory @deva[क्] (or @deva[ङ्]) follow, as well as when @deva[थल्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having the augment @deva[इट्] follows.
64123: @deva[ए] is substituted for @deva[आ] of @deva[राध] when meaning 'to hurt someone' and the reduplicate is elided before the affixes @deva[क्] (or @deva[ङ्]) or as well as before @deva[थल्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having the augment @deva[इट्]।
64124: @deva[ए] is optionally substituted for @deva[अ] of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) 1. @deva[जर्] (@deva[जॄ]) 2. @deva[भ्रम] and 3. @deva[त्रस्] and the reduplicate is thereby elided before the affixes of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having an indicatory @deva[क्] (or @deva[ङ्])
64125: @deva[ए] is optionally substituted for @deva[अ] and @deva[आ] of the seven roots 1. @deva[फण्] 2. @deva[राज्] 3. @deva[भ्राज्] 4. @deva[भ्राश्] 5. @deva[श्लाश्] 6. @deva[स्याम्] and 7. @deva[स्वन्] and the reduplicate is elided thereby, before the affixes of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having an indicatory @deva[क्] (or @deva[ङ्]) as well as before @deva[थल्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) having the augment @deva[इट्]।
64126: @deva[ए] is not substituted for @deva[अ] of @deva[शस्] , @deva[दद्] or of roots beginning with a @deva[व्] or of such verbal @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) in which the @deva[अ] results through the substitution being @deva[कित्] or @deva[ङित्] follow, of the @deva[सेट्] @deva[थल्] of the @deva[लिट्] (Perfect Tense) nor is the reduplicate elided.
64127: @deva[तृ] (which is changed to @deva[न्त्] in the strong cases and forms the feminine in @deva[ई] unaccented) is substituted for the final of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) @deva[अर्वन्] , except in the Nominative 1st-Case singular or when the word is joined with the Negative particle.
64128: @deva[तृ] is diversely substituted for the final of @deva[मघवन्]।
64129: Whatever will be taught in the following up to the end of this @deva[अध्याय] should be understood to apply to the nominal stems called @deva[भ] -- @deva[यचि] @deva[भम्] @ref[1.4.18], @deva[तसौ] @deva[मत्वर्थे] @ref[1.4.19].
64130: For @deva[पाद] is substituted @deva[पद्] when the former is @deva[भ]।
64131: The semi-vowel of the affix @deva[वस्] (@deva[वंस्]) is vocalised to @deva[उ] in a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem).
64132: The @deva[व] is vocalised to @deva[ऊ] (@deva[ऊठ्]) when the compound @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is @deva[भ]।
64133: The @deva[व] of 1. @deva[श्वन्] 2. @deva[युवन्] and 3. @deva[मधवन्] becomes vocalised, but not before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64134: Of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अन्] , the @deva[अ] is elided.
64135: Of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अन्] with a preceding @deva[ष] as well as of @deva[हन्] and @deva[धृतराजन्] , the @deva[अ] is elided before the affix @deva[अण्] ।
64136: In a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अन्] , the @deva[अ] is optionally elided before the Locative -7th case ending @deva[इ] before the ending @deva[शी] (@deva[ई]) of the Nominative 1st-Case and Accusative-2nd case dual Neuter.
64137: The @deva[अ] in @deva[अन्] is not elided when the @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ends in @deva[वन्] or @deva[मन्] with a consonant preceding @deva[व्] or @deva[म्]।
64138: The @deva[अ] of @deva[अच्] (@deva[अञ्च्] ) is elided at the end of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem).
64139: The long @deva[ई] is substituted for the @deva[अ] of @deva[अच्] (@deva[अञ्च्] ) after the word @deva[उत्] when the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is @deva[भ]।
64140: The final @deva[आ] of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is elided when it ends in a root.
64141: In the @deva[मन्त्र]-s , the beginning of @deva[आत्मन्] is elided when the affix of the Instrumental -3rd case singular follows.
64142: Of the @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) @deva[विंशति] , before an affix having an indicatory @deva[ड्] the @deva[ति] is elided.
64143: Before an affix having an indicatory @deva[ड्] , the last vowel, with the consonant, if any, that follows it, is elided.
64144: Of the @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) the final @deva[न्] with the vowel that precedes it, is elided before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64145: The @deva[अ] of @deva[अहन्] is elided only before the affixes @deva[ट] and @deva[ख]।
64146: For @deva[उ] of @deva[ऊ] of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) there is substituted @deva[गुण] before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64147: For @deva[उ] of @deva[ऊ] of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) is elided before the affix @deva[एय] (@deva[ढ]) but not of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) @deva[कट्रू]
64148: The final @deva[अ] and @deva[इ] (both long and short) of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) are elided before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64149: Of the @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) 1. @deva[सूर्य] 2. @deva[तिष्य] 3. @deva[अगस्त्य] and 4. @deva[मत्स्य] (and their derivatives when they are @deva[भ]) the penultimate @deva[य्] is also is also elided before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64150: The @deva[य्] of a @deva[तद्धित] affix when preceded by a consonant and penultimate in a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem), is elided before the feminine @deva[ई]।
64151: The @deva[य्] of a Patronymic affix, preceded by a consonant, is elided before a @deva[तद्धित] when it does not begin with an @deva[आ]।
64152: The @deva[य्] of a Patronymic affix, preceded by a consonant, is elided before the Denominative affix @deva[क्य] and the adverbial affix @deva[च्वि]।
64153: The affix @deva[छ] of the @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) @deva[बिल्वक] etc. is elided before a @deva[तद्धित] affix.
64154: The affix @deva[तृ] is elided before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठन्] 2. @deva[इमनिव्] and 3. @deva[ईयसुन्]।
64155: The last vowel, with the consonant, if any, that follows it, is elided when the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and @deva[ईयस्] follow.
64156: Before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and 3. @deva[ईयस्] the last semi-vowel is elided with that which follows it and for the first vowel, a @deva[गुण] is substituted in 1. @deva[स्थूल] 2. @deva[दूर] 3. @deva[युवन्] 4. @deva[ह्रस्व] 5. @deva[क्षिप्र] and 6. @deva[क्षुद्र]।
64157: Before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and @deva[ईयस्] the following substitutions take place 1. @deva[प्र] for @deva[प्रिय] 2. @deva[स्थ] for @deva[स्थिर] 3. @deva[स्फ] for @deva[स्फिर] 4. @deva[वर्] for @deva[उरु] 5. @deva[बह] for @deva[बहुल] 6. @deva[गर्] for @deva[गुरु] 7. @deva[वर्ष] for @deva[वृद्ध] 8. @deva[त्रप्] for @deva[तृप्] 9. @deva[द्राघ] for @deva[दीर्घ] and 10. @deva[वृन्द] for @deva[वृन्दारक]।
64158: The @deva[इ] and @deva[ई] of these affixes (@deva[इमन्] and @deva[ईयस्]) are elided after @deva[बहु] , and for @deva[बहु] is substituted @deva[भू]।
64159: After @deva[बहु] , the augment @deva[यिट्] is added to @deva[इष्ठ] and @deva[भू] is the substitute of @deva[बहु]।
64160: @deva[आ] is substituted for the first letter of @deva[ईयस्] after @deva[ज्य]।
64161: Before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and 3. @deva[ईयस्] , @deva[र्] is substituted for @deva[ऋ] in a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem), when this @deva[ऋ] is preceded by a consonant and is not prosodially long (on account of being followed by a double consonant).
64162: Before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and 3. @deva[ईयस्] , the @deva[ऋ] of @deva[ऋजु] may optionally be changed to @deva[र्] , in the @deva[छन्दस्] (Vedas).
64163: A monosyllabic @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) retains its original form without undergoing any change before the affixes 1. @deva[इष्ठ] 2. @deva[इमन्] and 3. @deva[ईयस्] ।
64164: The final @deva[इन्] of a @deva[भ] @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) remains unaltered before the non-Patronymic @deva[अण्] affix.
64165: 1. @deva[गाथिन्] 2. @deva[विदथिन्] 3. @deva[केशिन्] 4. @deva[गणिन्] and 5. @deva[पणिन्] remain unchanged before the Patronymic also.
64166: The syllable @deva[इन्] of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[इन्] remains unchanged before @deva[अण्] when a conjunct consonant precedes it.
64167: The syllable @deva[अन्] of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अन्] remains unchanged before @deva[अण्] affix whether Patronymic or otherwise.
64168: The syllable @deva[अन्] of a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) ending in @deva[अन्] remains unchanged before a @deva[तद्धित] affix beginning with @deva[य्] when it does not denote existence in abstract of the avocation of someone.
64169: The finals of the @deva[अङ्ग] (stems) @deva[आत्मन्] and @deva[अध्वन्] remain unchanged before the affix @deva[ख]।
64170: In a @deva[अङ्ग] (stem) in @deva[अन्] with a preceding @deva[म्] with the exception of @deva[वर्मन्] , the ending @deva[अन्] does not remain unchanged before the Patronymic affix @deva[अण्] ।
